name: Job
description: This is a game about finding a secure job and avoiding unemployment. Players have a team of 3 pawns. On their turn, players roll a die and then decide which of their pawns to move on the board. The pawns encounter the positive and negative events of working life - unemployment, advancement and financial gain, strikes, early retirement, and many more.

name: Prophecy
description:
Each player drafts Old Testament prophets, then match each prophets' prophecies about the coming Christ with the fulfillment in the New Testament. Prophets are afflicted with weakness, discouragement & wanderlust or attacked by evil forces. Defend your prophets by surrounding them with loyal friends (other biblical characters), sending guardian angels, or the occasional divine intervention. It's a race for inspiration with the wisdom to not let one's guard down.

From designers website (http://www.unitygame.com)
"Prophecy is a very easy game to play. On each turn, you just draw a card and then play any card in your hand (that is playable), or you ask an opponent for a card. It is kind of an enhanced Go Fish. However, determining which is the best card to play is not always as straightforward as it seems."
(http://www.unitygame.com/prophecy_strategy.htm)
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: The Man from Snowy River
description:
From the back of the game:

"There is movement and bustle at the big cattle station. A valuable colt has got away and galloped into the mountains.

The men are saddling up their horses as fast as they can, because the station owner has promised a big reward to the rider who finds the colt and brings him back.

But - which is the right track among the many dangerous paths through the mountains... to the gully where the colt is grazing?

And will the colt break away on the return journey? Will he be captured by another rider? Will you be the Man from Snowy River?"

Contents:
1 board
6 horse tokens
40 track cards
6 horse cards
spinners indicating numbers 1-6 and direction - "turn left", "turn right", and "straight ahead"

name: League Leader Hurling Boardgame
description:
This boardgame depicts all the aspects of the Gaelic sport of hurling including rules, terminology and tactics.

Players play their games against the board. A single game is played by traveling the perimeter of the board from the throw in square to the final whistle square. Goals and points are scored during each game by landing on certain squares.

Each circuit of the board results in a score which players record on a league table. Each player has their own league table for recording results. When each player's league table has been completed, the player with the most league points wins the game.

(edited from official description)

name: The Land of Cotton Game
description: (From the box) An exciting new game for budding young cotton growers, ages 8 to adult.

name: Poisson Vole
description: This game has fish (that are tossed up and your job is to catch them and get them into your bucket. It is for kids 5 years old and above.

name: Il Gioco della Pace
description: The scope of the game is to try to eliminate progressively all the weapons of which the various zones of the world are equipped, replacing them with flowers. The game finishes when all the symbols of war are replaced from the flowers or, for the inability resolving a crisis series, bursts the war.

name: Corral
description: This game, produced by the Are-Jay Game Company of Cleveland, Ohio features a hardwood board. The Board has holes in it and also has red and white pegs. Object of the game is to make squares with your color of pegs. Rectangles do not count, only squares. Squares can be any size.

name: Augen auf und aufgepaßt!
description:
Cooperative children's game around traffic education.

The children have decided that walking is better than going by car, as it's faster and more environmentally friendly. So, they challenge the grown-ups to a race to the pool; the children walk, and the grown-ups drive. Both parties have to follow the traffic rules. The children win if they make it to the pool before the cars arrive.

name: Black Castle
description:
According to the introduction of the rules:
"Imagine a castle in the middle ages with four armies facing one another, ready to battle. You command one of those armies. You send your soldiers off to attack the enemy and capture prisoners at the same time remaining vigilant so that your own troops don't fall into a trap."

In this abstract strategy game, you command an army of 8 soldiers and one captain. Each turn you have six movement points to distribute among your forces. A standard move is one square horizontally or vertically. The captain add the possibility of a diagonal move. The board offer many opportunities for jumping (black squares) or diagonal movement (black squares with an "X"). The capture of an opponent piece is made by surrounding it with two friendly pieces. You score one point for capturing a soldier and three points for a captain. You can also score points by occupying enemy territories or denying an opponent's army to move is full movement points allowance. 27 points is needed for claiming the victory.

The game included:
- a game board (10 x 10 squares)
- 36 game pieces (8 soldiers and a captain in each of four colors)
- an instruction booklet
- some pegs to indicate victory points on the board
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Team-Based Game

name: New York Wealth
description: Players start with $1,000,000 cash and attempt to meet the winning conditions by traveling a board of New York landmarks. Players can buy up property, sell it back (at varying prices according to propeties owned) or find themselves in dice duels for price breaks. The first player to stand in the Winner's Circle, own a Broadway or Opera card and have at least $5,000,000 is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Hole in One
description:
"The golf trivia game that will leave you longing for the greens without leaving a divot on your brain!"

The board depicts a nine-hole golf course, with spots along each hole equal to that hole's par. Players advance their golf tee from spot-to-spot and hole-to-hole by successfully answering golf trivia questions. Some spots have a possible penalty or bonus, as determined by a die roll when you get there. A die roll also determines which of four categories a player's question will come from: History, Tournaments, People, or Rules. First player to complete the course wins.

Perfect to play in the golf clubhouse while waiting out a thunderstorm. Avoid under any other circumstances!

name: Chanugame
description: This is a Jewish education game that teaches the history, laws and customs of Chanukah. This game encourages cooperation as the group as a whole can win by triumphing over the Greeks. There is also an individual winner determined by the number of victory coins collected. This game is geared for ages 8 and up , and also comes with rules for 4-8 year olds.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lauf, Maulwurf, lauf
description:
Players work together to take the moles off the board before the gardeners reach them.

Contents: 1 board, 3 gardeners, 18 moles.

name: Da ist doch der Wurm drin
description:
This is a game for players 6 years and older. The goal of the game is to have the most apples without worms at the end of the game.

Players roll the die and pluck an apple showing the number they rolled from the apple tree on the game board. If there is no apple with the corresponding number left on the tree, the player can steal such an apple from another player. In any case, the player can look at the backside of the apple to see whether it has a worm.

The game finishes once all apples have been plucked from the tree.

Contents: 1 board, 24 apple tokens, 6 baskets, 1 die

name: Church On The Way
description:
Church On The Way sets out to loosely simulate the influx of new church plants into a city. Up to six players each decide on a church name and draw their first two leaders to add to their church of twenty members and a very small budget.

As the game progresses each church looks to increase their 'Holiness', 'Theology' and 'Holy Spirit' points through preaching different topics from the 'Preaching Track' (each of which give different variations of point provision - for example preaching on Biblical Truth gives +3TH while preaching on Serving allows an extra leader to be drawn next turn). Points can also be gained from buying equipment and events (buying Original Greek New Testaments gives a Theology bonus each turn for example).
These equipment and events can also be used to increase the size of the church (Church barbecues, Harvest Festivals, Bible Weeks etc)or to make your current members happier (doughnuts, china cups, quality tea, comfy chairs).

Make sure the church can afford to pay the rent of the pub meeting room it is meeting in and look for bigger and better buildings to rent and buy that are on the market!

However church life isn't always fun and roses, watch out for the potentially damaging "Event Cards". Some good, some bad, some indifferent, but all a talking point, as the churches look to grow, compete or work together in a game trying to balance between dry wit, in-jokes and a business simulation.

But which church is the most rounded and most developed by the time all the world's people groups have been reached?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Biwords
description:
Biwords is the bilingual word game. Players are given English or French words and must try to supply their equivalents in the other official language.
The game contains 5,000 English and French words and short phrases ranging from familiar, everyday terms to the frankly very difficult. Score points are earned according to the number and difficulty of words that each player can identify.

name: Snap Quiz
description: A simple card playing game where players try to find answer cards to the question cards in their hand. Once found the player takes the completed question/answer set and places it in front of him. Winner is determined by the highest number or question/answer sets when the cards are exhausted.

name: Space Shuttle
description:
It is 20 years into the future and NASA is now defunct. The U.S. Government has decided to take their space shuttle program to the corporate level. Players take the role of one of several corporations vying for a fat government contract to build space shuttles for the U.S.A.

Objective
To be the first player to successfully launch a space shuttle by acquiring 20 or more lift-off points.

Contains
(6) Shuttle System Displays
(30) Display Tokens
(122) Cards

name: Rivalry
description:
In Rivalry each player controls a historical civilization and works to achieve supreme power through military, economic, and diplomatic means. Each civilization is entirely different from the others and has its own distinctive benefits and heroes. The game has no specific time period, so Alexander the Great can battle Rommel with his armies, while Montezuma can be played against Genghis Khan.
Rivalry emphasizes cooperation between players since individual civilizations will have difficulty winning alone. While predominantly a military strategy game, the historical flavor and distinctiveness between civilizations adds a role-playing element.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Tek-No-Krazy
description:
TEK-NO-KRAZY Board Game by Reilly & Lee Co.

Vintage 1950's game made by Reilly and Lee co. Small box game that includes 36 metal pegs, playing board, and directions.

An elusive fascinating game for everyone 9-90

name: Operation Rescue
description:
From the box cover: "Fascinating adventure on land, sea and air... finding the astronaut in the vast recovery area."

Race to the Recovery Area at the center of the game board to be the first to reach the space capsule in splashdown. The game includes a little silver Gemini space capsule.

name: Moon Blast Off
description:
"The winners blast off for Earth below, the loser doesn't get to go."

The game consists of a circular molded plastic gameboard about 12" diameter which resembles the lunar surface and is raised on 'legs'. There are four craters in the surface, one for each player. The center is dominated by a plastic rocket which locks into the gameboard mechanism, effectively creating a platform beneath each crater.

Each player starts with the full complement of five plastic astronauts of their selected color. Players place one of their astronauts on the platform in the nearest crater.

A marble is spun around the rim of the circular gameboard; when it loses velocity it drops into one of a series of colored depressions which circle the board just inside the marble track. The player controlling the astronauts corresponding to the colored depression that the marble stops in must quickly grab the central rocket & remove it from the board. This causes the platforms beneath the craters to move aside and the astronauts to fall through the board. Players must attempt to catch their astronauts before they fall.

Any astronauts that fall through the board are given to the player who removed the rocket. The winner is the first player to get ten astronauts.

Interesting game in that four (and only four) players are required.

name: Fortunet: A Game of Ultra-Net Wealth
description:
From the side of the box:

Find excitement and intrigue in the fast paced world of high finance and investments! See which player can attain the greatest wealth by making the wisest investment decisions in a complex and risky financial marketplace.

Start out with borrowed funds and invest your money to earn millions; act as a consultant as a strategy to achieve more wealth. Develop your own strategies and become financial guru extraordinaire!!!!!

For Adults of all ages.

2-4 individuals or 2-4 teams.

Game includes: Gameboard . 4 colored playing pieces (gurus) . 4 portfolio trays . question/answer cards . money . 1 die. Box is approx 9 1/4" X 9 1/4" x 3 1/4".

(c) R. M. Samuels P.O.Box 2686, Station B, Richmond Hill, Ontario L4E 1A7. TM Fortunet is a registered Trademark of R. M. Samuels.

Printed in Canada
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: DEMOCRACity
description: Democracity is an educational game. By establishing a political party and creating a city, players learn how politics work. As a group they work together at a political project. They experience that debate, majority and consensus are needed in a democratic society and that all votes count.

name: Warlords & Wizards
description: The most challenging board game created since the ancient game of chess. Imagine controlling two armies of magical creatures with specific movement patterns into battle. Enter your most powerful piece, the Wizard, from off the battlefield to create havoc for your opponent. Use your Dragon Slayer and Priestess in mystical movements to bewilder your challenger. Confuse your opponent by disguising your true intentions, followed with an ambush from your Warlord; Combine your sorceress, Elf, and Fortress to finish off your rival in one breathtaking conclusion!

name: GummiHamster 40K
description:
Appeared in Dork Tower: The Junkfood Issue (#19 June/July 2002).

Miniatures rules for Gummi Bear warfare.

You need:
-- 10 Gummi Bears for each player's army (each player has Gummi Bears of a distinct color)
-- a dollar bill for measuring movement distance and attack zone
--a set of 'Fate Bears' for each player (one bear of each of the five main colors) for combat resolution.
--Play area with obstacles

On your turn, you may move (some or all of your Gummis) and the attack. Combat is resolved by the attacker secretly choosing a Fate Bear and the defender secretly choosing one or more (depending on the situation) Fate Bears. If the attacker's Fate Bear does not match any of the defender's Fate Bear colors, the attack is successful.

Comes with 4 scenarios (variants).

name: The Welfare Game & A Modest Solution
description:
A St. Croix's Socio/Economic Game Kit

The sensational game that shows how to stop spiraling welfare costs: stimulate the economy: bring creativity back to the bureaucracy and make money for it's players!

name: The People's Choice
description: Four parties (Democrat, Green, Libertarian, and Republican) compete for ten US Senate seats. The catch: they don't know until the end game which method (plurality, instant runoff, approval, Borda count, or Condorcet) will be used to count the ballots! Special cards cover fund raisers, gerrymandering, apathy, scandals, and ballot tampering.

name: Quinna
description:
Quinna was developed by NBV (Nykterhetsrörelsens bildningsverksamhet/ The Educational activity of the Sobriety movement) to be part in a study circle about womens situation across the world.

You and those you play each with choose a women and then roll dice to either answer questions about Womens Rights and situations or about the situation for the women you choice to play. When you answer correctly you get a tile to a puzzle that will end up showing the womens face. First one to get the full face wins. You might also both lose and get bonus tiles when you use the dice.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: City Dogs
description: A children's game where you move around the board trying to collect four cards. Looks to be a fairly simple game suitable for younger children.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Prehistoric Dogs
description: Be the first player to collect 'The Cavepainter's Palette', 'The Cookout Spear', 'Fire Sticks' and 'The Big Round Turning Thing That's Fun to Chase' pieces for each player.

name: Card Dice
description:
The game comprises a deck of cards that set the challenge and four 14 sided dice that mimic a deck of cards (including jokers). The start player takes a card and reads the challenge (roll 4 dice and get all hearts and diamonds; get a flush; get two pairs etc), and then all players roll the dice, and will score according to how many rolls it takes for them to achieve the challenge. The game continues like this for 14 rounds (regardless of number of players), highest score at the end is the winner.

Apparently patented worldwide, the only version of this game I have seen is an Arsenal Football Club colored edition.

name: Mighty Comics Superheroes Game
description: Includes superheroes from comic books published under the Mighty Comics imprint of MLJ/Archie (who were more successful publishing teenage humor comics featuring Archie and friends). Many of the featured heroes are members of the Mighty Crusaders team. For some reason several of the names are slightly different from how they appear in the comics. The ten heroes featured are: The Shield, The Web, Mr. Justice, Fly Girl, Fly Man (originally called The Fly), Captain Flagg (spelled with one "G" in the comics), The Hood (The Black Hood), Mr. Fox (The Fox), Mr. Jag (The Jaguar), and Mr. Steel (Steel Sterling). First to the middle wins.

name: Tarzan Jungle Map and Treasure Hunt
description: Tarzan Jungle Map and Treasure Hunt came free with the purchase of Weston's English Quality Biscuits in 1933. The map measures 20" x 14" and is in full color. Each player could be Tarzan, Akut, Sheeta, or Numa. Players draw upside-down tiles numbered 1, 2, 3, or 4 and then move the corresponding number of footprints along the jungle map. The first person to reach the end of the Tarzan Trail wins the Treasure Hunt.

name: Korall
description: In Korall, players imitate a western ranch by moving their horses through passes, trails and along the fence line in a competition to be the first one to get four of their horses in a corral.

name: HMO: The Game
description:
Welcome to HMO: The Game. This is a medical game designed for people affiliated with today's medico-commercial-legal-governmental complex or what was once called health care. Americans have always been able to laugh at adversity. Hopefully this game will help you see the humor in our changing medical system.

The object of the game is to accumulate $500,000 to retire from practice. There's many obstacles to overcome such as income tax, malpractice premiums, litigation, and much more.

Playing pieces are a syringe, urinal, hot water bottle, and a crutch. Game also includes gameboard, 1 die, play money, deck of 4 different situation cards (Family Affairs, Legal Encounters, Practice of Medicine, and Investment/Taxes), and instructions.

name: Blackboard
description:
An educational Black History game. You begin with a chain that has 7 removable links. You roll the dice, move your game piece (Amistad slave ship) around the board, and follow the instructions for each space. When you land on a question space, you must answer the question for that category. Each time you answer a question correctly, you'll discard one link. If you answer incorrectly, you'll collect a link. The first player to run out of links, wins the game.

The game includes a 20" game board, 7 game pieces (Amistad slave ships), liberation dice (red, black, & green), chains, entertaining situation cards, game rules, and multiple choice question cards (covering Entertainment, Politics, Science, Invention, Art, Literature, Sports, Education, Law, and more). Over 420 questions.

name: The Mighty Hercules Game
description: Game based on the 1963 TV series, The Mighty Hercules. In the series, Hercules got his great strength from a magic ring given to him by his family, the father sky god Zeus. The object of the game is to get your Hercules character up to Mount Olympus.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology

name: Karma Chakra
description:
Karma Chakra is a board game that is based on Buddhism.

The game is titled Karma Chakra as it tries to show the outcome of one’s actions from past and present lives leading towards future rebirth. The design concept of the board is based on Mandala, five elements and the Wheel of Life.

name: Raging Fury: The Hurricane Game
description: The object of the game is to keep your properties insured and direct the storm(s) at your opponents property. The last player in the game is the winner.

name: StockPro
description:
A classic Stock Market Board Game that provides players with the same opportunities and risks. The players no longer need to depend on luck to win the game but rather on their intellectual prowess. The game includes 3 stocks, each having 6 quarterly earning cards and 3 quarterly dividend cards.
The game starts with disclosure of each stock's 3 quarterly earning cards and 1 quarterly dividend cards. Therefore, during the game the players need to sum up the three quarterly earnings and calculate the probabilities of the fourth quarterly earning in order to estimate this year's annual earning, and further the year-end target prices. With comparisons of the current stock prices, the players can conclude if the stock is over-valued or under-valued. There are also day-to-day return-on-equities and risks due to the fluctuation of each stock. The game provides players the opportunities to play as day-traders or long-run investors, or both. This game teaches players the portfolio management skills and how to make correct strategic investment decisions on the stock market.

name: Pepe Postflieger
description:
Players take turn rolling the dice and trying to acquire cubes of the color shown by the dice. The cubes are hidden from view in bins called airports and players must remember where the cubes are hidden to fulfill their order. If a cube is rolled with the color purple showing it means bad weather and the player cannot fly that round. (miss a turn).
If the player chooses an airport without one of the colors rolled their turn ends. If the airport has the color they need it is loaded into the biplanes wings and the plane flies for home. Before a plane lands it is flipped over and any cubes that fall out are lost. All other cubes are worth one coin when delivered to the airport.

The first player to collect 7 coins wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Star Power
description:
From the publisher's website:

Star Power is designed for children between the age ranges of 4 to 9. This game is similar in concept and design to Follow the Clues... A Game of Destiny but it simplifies the process and allows the younger child to become acquainted with positive words and thoughts through fun and entertaining action and interplay. This game introduces the child to the 24 angel-like characters, Lit'l Messengers, and in a playful way, teaches the child about the qualities of each angel and their messages. "Star Power" also encourages the child to feel free to act out and participate in exploring "noble sense," values in a fun and joyful way.

Contents: Game board with 4 plastic baskets, Spinner with plastic arrow, 4 pawns and plastic stands and 25 cards:(24 angel cards and 1 sun card), 4 washable markers, A bag of plastic stars.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Funetically Correct
description:
From the publisher's website:

Funetically Correct the board game that lets you spell it like you hear it. Funetically Correct is a game of innocent creativity and flexibility. The game challenges its participants to spell words the way they sound. Players use letters, numbers and a few assorted icons to spell words or phrases.

The game can be played by as few as 2 people or as many as multiple teams. Because the game relies on others being able to identify your word or phrase, the game changes every time you play. Enjoy the experience. Challenge your imagination with this fun, creative game. Recommended for ages 7 and up.

name: Pete's Lucky Unders
description:
From the publisher's website...

Easy to learn, quick to play, and fun for the whole family!

Be the first player to get rid of all the cards in yer hand, yer Over-All's and yer Lucky (or not so Lucky) Unders.

Discard cards of equal or higher value than the last card played or play a "Lucky" card that saves you from addin' the whole darn pile to yer hand if you can't beat it.

Includes a deck of 110 cards and instructions.

You won't want to leave this game hangin' out on the line!

name: Vertic
description:
From the designer's website...

Vertic is the first creation of our vertical game board system. Yes, it is a board game—it just goes vertical. The object of the game is to get four “Ver” tile cards in a row or four “Tic” tile cards in a row. This might sound easy but each player has the opportunity to drop tile cards, spin the board, or spin segments of the board, which drops tile cards to new locations. This changes tile card and board positioning. Vertic is a game of strategy, memory, movement, and pure excitement. If you want more intensity, add another Vertic Vertical Game Board on top and play eight in a row or add another — just make sure your mind can handle it.

name: Capt'n Pike's Cruising North America
description:
From the publisher's website...

Capt'n Pike's Cruising North America is a fun and interesting board game with a nautical theme. Shiver me timbers, it's a totally new concept and there is nothing like it on the seven seas or in the market place. Do you know how many light houses surround Lake Michigan, where is Angel's Gate, how many teeth a shark has, what are your chances of surviving a lighting strike, what is a hawse pipe, where is the Norwegian Riviera, what is a drink water sailor, or who started Chris Craft boats? Find out the answers to theses and over 1000 more while playing Capt'n Pike's Cruising North America.

Choose your vessel and cruise the West Coast, Gulf Coast, East Coast, Mississippi River system and the Great Lakes while answering nautical questions about weather, navigation, boat handling, marlin spike, seamanship, local points of interest and history. Great fun for all who have owned a boat and dreamed of cruising!

name: ImagiNotions
description:
From the publisher's website...

Get ready to tickle your brain and stretch the imagination beyond your wildest dreams! ImagiNotions is the fun-filled, thought-provoking, mind-numbing game that literally lets you say what you see!

ImagiNotions are literal word and picture puzzles that form common phrases, people, places, or even other words.

To play, get your team to correctly solve 3 ImagiNotions puzzle cards before time runs out. After the ImagiNotions are solved, strain your brain and tie all three puzzles together to solve the Notion, or theme, of the card! "Advance along the game board for every ImagiNotion and Notion solved correctly. But watch out, and plan your time wisely, because your opponents can steal the puzzles you can't answer!" You'll soon discover the thrill, the fun, and the challenge of this mind-bending, thrill-a-minute game.

So say what you see and relate all three!

That's ImagiNotions!

Game Contents:
900 ImagiNotions Puzzles
150 colorful cards
Custom Card Holder
Deluxe Game Board
2 Tokens
Sand Timer
Easy-to-follow Instructions
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fossil Island
description:
From the publisher's website:

Take a trip through Fossil Island for an exciting adventure of ups and downs. Players navigate a colorful dinosaur down an eggshell trail by rolling a die & solving an addition card problem.

As you race across Fossil Island, you get to discover shortcuts, take chances on Dino Dare cards, survive the ups and downs, bump an opponent, and race ahead………..try not to fall back!

It’s hours of fun for ages 7 and up.
Variations for many ages & abilities included.
People of different ages and abilities will be able to play side by side without the fear of being wiped out. With all on an even playing ground and each making their best contributions, players are all together to the end of the game!

It's completely unique to other board games - or even educational games, offering future potential for creating dozens of games from this one box. Change the game simply by adding a new deck of cards.

This game contains:

45 fossil addition fact cards
Folding game board
72 Dino-Dare cards
12 cross safely cards
4 dinosaur playing pieces
1 multicolored die

name: Follow the Clues... A Game of Destiny
description:
From the publisher's website...

Follow the Clues...A Game of Destiny
The angels in this game and throughout life are always giving us powerful messages to help, assist and guide us as we continue on our pathway but we are the ones who must follow the clues so that we will reach the sunlight which represents inner joy and happiness in life. The lessons learned, as children will carry us through life.

The game board "Follow the Clues...A Game of Destiny" is done in circles. There is no beginning and no end. For each of us to reach our highest level we must go to the next dimension.

We continue on our journey till we reach complete joy, inner peace and harmony. There are no winners or losers in the game. When the first player reaches his/her goal, he/she is obligated to go back and help another player on the board with support and encouragement to reach his or her goal.

The game may be played by 2-6 players.

Recommended for children age 10 and up

CONTENTS

Game board, spinner with plastic arrow, 6 child like figures with plastic stands, 27 Angel cards with text on the back, one sunlight card, glossary of word and phrase definitions, a pink and blue washable magic marker.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Roy Rogers Rodeo Game
description: Four games include: Bronco Busting/Trick Riding/Bulldogging/Calf Roping. Complete with instructions inside lid. Comes with board and four rodeo rider figures. You can be Roy Rogers, Slim Jim, Smokey Joe, or Rusty Mac.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hopalong Cassidy / Stroehmann's Sunbeam Bread Game
description: Hoppy and Topper at lower right by spinner. Bottom text reads "Boys And Girls! Tell Mom To Buy Stroehmann's Sunbeam-It's Hoppy's Favorite Bread!" Spin the spinner and the first to make it to Hoppy's Ranch wins.
categories: American West, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: J. Fred Muggs 'Round The World' Game
description: Based on the popular chimpanzee from the Dave Garroway show of the time, this is a travel game with a Pan American Airways (PanAm) tie-in as well, for 2 to 4 players, ages 7 to 12. Comes with rules, board, score pad, 4 colored markers, PAA tickets, Pan American coasters, baggage stickers, PanAm calendars and postcards, die. The coasters, etc., are items that you are supposed to "pick up" along the way.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel

name: "Still Safe!" Safety Boardgame
description: Players move their pieces through the hazardous terrain of the laboratory, advancing by answering questions about general lab safety, lab procedures and apparatus, and trying to avoid unsafe practices that will land them in the first aid station.

name: Assumption
description:
From the back of the box:
Assumption allows you and your friends to be the experts on every topic imaginable, in a game where there is never an incorrect answer.
Assumption is a fun and intriguing game in which each player must assume to know-it-all in order to win! If you can admit to being a know-it-all, have ever been accused of being a know-it-all, or happen to know a know-it-all... Assumption is definitely a game for you!

Object of the game -
To be the player with the best assumptions as to why things are the way they are... to win!!! Assumption is the game where the players decide the best answers to outrageous questions seldom contemplated! Questions like...

Why don't fortune tellers win the lottery?
Why don't nudist camps have age restrictions?
Why do men like old cars and not old women?
Why do they make catheter tubing so large?

name: Putts & Drives
description:
DRIVES AND PUTTS
A great game for Golfers to place in their golf bags for those times when the weather pushes them off the course and into the clubhouse.

The deck consists of 48 cards.
With each card having a “shot value” from 0 to 4
The deck consists of the following:

10 - (D) Cards or “DRIVES”
12 - (P) Cards or “PUTTS”
13 - (FW) Cards or “FAIRWAY SHOTS”
2 – “R” Cards or “ROUGH”
2 – (PTY) Cards or “PENALTY STROKE”
2 - (WC) Wild Cards, may be used as Drive, Fairway or Putt
3 - (ST) Cards or “ SAND TRAPS”
4 - (PS0) Cards or “ PRACTICE SWING” - Does not count against total strokes on hole, but does count as one of your cards played.

2-4 players
Fast & easy to play
Play 1 hole or 18
Competitive and fun for all ages
Pick your pars, make your birdies & accept your bogeys, low score wins.

Before starting play the dealer or the golf course scorecard decides if the hole is a par 3, par 4, or a par 5. Cards are then shuffled.

On Par 3's 4 cards are dealt to each player
On Par 4's 5 cards are dealt to each player
On Par 5's 6 cards are dealt to each player
Remaining deck is then placed in the middle of the table and becomes the "FUTURE SWINGS" deck.

PLAY

All players look at their cards and discard one of their cards face up next to the remaining cards this is the discard pile.

The players then draw one card and from the "future swings stack", and then waits for all players to collect one card from the "future swings stack". Play then continues as each player then discards one card of their choice from their hand.

This cycle of Drawing "Future swings" and discards goes on for two turns.

Following the second round of "future swings" the dealer then takes the stack of future swings and deals each player 2 cards face down. After all players have received their face down future swings each is allowed to look at his/her two cards and discard any two cards in their hand.

After all discards the players turn over the cards in their hand & the lowest score wins that hole. The following are the MINIMUM Requirements for a hand to be played.

On Par 3’s a player is required to hold and play 3 cards.
The minimum requirement to play is one “DRIVE Card (D)” and one “PUTT Card (P).

On Par 4’s a player is required to hold and play 4 cards.
The minimum requirement to play is one “DRIVE Card (D)”, one “FAIRWAY Card (FW), and one “PUTT Card (P).

On Par 5’s a player is required to hold and play 5 cards.
The minimum requirement to play is one “DRIVE Card (D)”, one “FAIRWAY Card (FW), and one “PUTT Card (P).
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Tosipeli
description: There are 54 cards containing beginnings of sentences. Players should continue these sentences and the most creative player emerges as the winner in the end.

name: DogTales B.C.
description:
The object of the game is to bring your dog through the board and collect all 4 items. This game aimed at children has the premise of "What would happen if dogs evolved instead of humans?" A simple game, much like it's sibling-game : Dogtales in Outer Space (GAME ID 17668)

This game is aimed at kids from 3 to 6 years old, according to the rules.

From the box :
Be the first player to collect 'The Cavepainter's Palette', 'The Cookout Spear', 'Fire Sticks' and 'The Big Round Turning Thing That's Fun to Chase' pieces for each player.

name: De Grote Geschiedenisshow: Het Egypte van de Farao's
description:
The gameboard represents a maze build up of rooms connected with corridors.

Each player starts by placing their locked & unlocked key-cards face down in the corridors. They then place their explorer at the starting point of the maze.

The movement is done by a dice roll. If you enter a corridor with a locked key you can't move. If you choose not to roll the dice you may also swap 2 key-cards on the board.

Some rooms have a special symbol that leads to a special action. For example: Skip a turn, take a chance card, return the way you came, enter a secret passage or a (hard!) question about ancient Egypt.

The final goal of the game is to find the door that hides the treasures of Tutanchamon. That player wins the game.
categories: Ancient, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Beaver Tooth Game
description:
Anybody studying the history of the American Indians?
For an innovative addition to your curriculum, you might try Beaver Tooth, a game played for centuries by the "First People of the Pacific Northwest."

The game includes a woven basket, four carved beaver teeth (dice), and a bundle of "counting bones." (In the original game, the beaver teeth were real teeth and the counting bones, bird bones; in the modern version, both are reproductions, made from bone-colored polymer.)

The game is simple, fast-paced, and fun: depending on the fall of the carved teeth, players win counting bones; the player with the most bones at the end of the game wins.

An accompanying color-illustrated booklet (Beaver Tooth: An Authentic Game from the First People of the Pacific Northwest by David G. Gordon & Mike Kowalski) contains a native legend about the origin of the beaver, historical background information about the Indian tribes of the Pacific Northwest, a list of related reading suggestions, and a history of the Beaver Tooth game.

For two or more players, aged 6 and up. $19.95; from the Skookum Jump Rope Co., Box 1159, Port Townsend, WA 98368; (800) 255-9526; fax (360) 379-9049.

Authentic good fun.

Partial proceeds help support the United Indians of All Tribes Foundation.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition

name: YPAW: Young People At Work
description: YPAW is a children's game made to help players memorize 20 Bible verses. Pieces of a charm bracelet are drawn from a bag which are linked to one of the verses. An instructor reads a question about the verse aloud; if the player answers the question and recites the verse properly, he or she keeps the charm. Otherwise, other players get a chance to answer. The first player to get four correct answers wins.

name: Die Troll Familie
description:
Simple memory game for children 5 years and older. Each player places their troll at the start of a path, with each space on the path showing a fruit corresponding to a fruit marker. The fruit markers are placed face down on the table and shuffled.

On their turn, a player turns over a fruit token. If it shows the same fruit as the next space on the player's path, the player's troll moves to that space; if not, the troll stays where it is. In any case, the token is put back, face down, and it's the next player's turn. The player whose troll reaches the end of the path first, wins.

Contents: 1 game board, 4 trolls, 7 round fruit markers

name: Migration Game
description: Each player starts out with a flock of 500 geese and 100 energy points. By rolling the die and following the instructions on the cards, players simulate the full migration of their flock. Along the way, each player's flock will encounter conditions, both favorable and unfavorable, that actual geese might face during their annual migration. The player who completes the migration with the highest score is the winner.

name: Water Cycle Game
description: With a roll of the dice and a spin of the wheel, players flow through the various components of the water cycle on their way back to the ocean. The game helps players understand the hydro-logic behind evaporation, transpiration, condensation, precipitation, the concept of ground water versus land runoff and the complexity of the water cycle.

name: Life Cycle Game
description: Players learn about the four-part life cycle of both a Monarch butterfly and a green bean plant. The first player to collect all eight life cycle cards and reach the finish circle wins. The game comes with an extra 25 question cards for upper-level play.

name: Shotgun Slade
description: Shotgun Slade has captured 4 outlaws in different locations around this frontier town. The players, his deputies, must bring them in and lock them up. The first player to get all four of his outlaws (marbles) around the board and into his four jail holes by exact count, wins the game. Much like Aggravation
categories: American West, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: How To Build a Nucleotide
description: The game is played like the basic "Rummy" or "500" card games. Drawing from the hand they are dealt, the deck and/or the discard pile, players try to obtain the proper cards to build as many nucleotides and complementary base pairs as possible. Each deck includes 94 cards - 10 cytosine, 10 adenine, 10 guanine, 10 thymine, 10 hydrogen bonding, 20 phosphate, 20 sugar, and 4 wild.

name: ERG: The Energy Resource Game
description: This Rummy-style card game teaches about the transport and use of renewable and non-renewable resources. Players must overcome natural disasters, depleted resources, and conservation efforts. The Teacher's Manual, which comes separately, offers more comprehensive information on the game topics.

name: Chase-Bots
description:
It all comes down to this. You are competing against rival corporations for a multi trillion-dollar contract. You are up against the most brilliant robotics engineers in the Solar system.

Each opponent will deploy a squadron of four robots representing decades of development and billions of dollars in material and research.

Your goal: Infiltrate your opponent’s home stations while preventing all of them from doing the same.

But wait! There’s a catch. A single Intercepting Trapper robot represents the previous champion. The I.T. robot will capture and imprison any other robot it comes into contact with.

You will have to use all of your best programming skill. Employ on the fly upgrades to your robots to make them more formidable, more elusive and more intelligent. Of course, your rivals will all be doing the same!

A description of the game itself:

Each player controls a squad of four Chase-Bots. The object is to get your robots into the starting spaces of your opponents. Game play is in three phases.

1. The Programming Phase
2. The Reveal Phase
3. The Movement Phase

In the Programming Phase, each player selects one card from their hand and places it face down in front of them.

In the Reveal Phase players simultaneously turn their cards over. Turn order for each round is determined by the values of the cards.

In the Movement Phase, each player moves his Chase-bots in turn.

The last player to move one of his Chase-bots into the main play area is the first to be IT. He must capture another Chase-bot with the black IT robot before he can move his own Chase-bots again. This makes one of the other players IT.

Throughout the game players will be installing, stealing and interfering with each other’s Upgrades. Upgrades give each player additional abilities such as alternative ways of moving their robots, increasing their hand size and any of up to 30 special powers.

Special Trigger cards add to the excitement as players wrest turn order from each other, steal upgrades from one another and basically sabotage their opponents.

Playground tag was never quite like this!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Vakkari
description: An educational Finnish card game published by the University of Oulu. There are 2 decks of cards. One contains cards about studying, the other about working. On each turn the player draws a card and tries to get as many studying or working points as possible.

name: Mr. Mad
description:
"Make him mad and he will spin...
Throwing marbles so you can win!"

Mr. Mad requires 2 D-cell batteries.
The object of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all their marbles.

All players select a particular colored group of marbles to represent them during the game. Players start the game with 8 marbles; all do not belong to that player but are divided as equally as possible between the relevant colors selected. A turn consists of dropping 1-3 marbles one at a time into the mouth of Mr. Mad, a plastic robot about 10" high. Players are required to state the color of marble to be introduced into Mr Mad's mouth prior to doing so.

On the floor of his transparent mouth is a button; if a marble hits this button the mechanism inside Mr Mad is triggered, causing him to spin around, flinging the marbles in his mouth out through large gaps where his hands would otherwise be. The player represented by the marble which activated Mr Mad must switch him off with the special 'stopping rod' provided as quickly as possible, as all marbles flung from mr Mad are collected by that player.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Tasten in het Duister
description:
Kleptonauts are hunting the dark and empty universe for Lux supplies. They are raiding neighboring planets and settlements as well as each other to get to these supplies. Their only real concern however is that they don't run out of space rum! If you can keep their ships stocked with run they will most likely do your bidding and make you the richest man in the universe.

Players bid space rum for control of each of the 6 kleptonaut ships each turn. If they gain control they can move them to pick op Lux treasures and/or deliver them to their own space stations which will generate money. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: A Nation on Trial
description:
A Nation on Trial is an operational level miniature battle simulation system. The game includes easy to use rules for command-control, supply, and designing historical campaigns.
Featuring:

The same basing system as the Tactical-Level system Johnny Reb.
Rules for command-control, supply and the fog of war
Big battles such as Antietam are playable in a 4'x 8' space.
Big battles can be played in either a day or a weekend.
The Three Days of Gettysburg: a ready to play scenario for A Nation on Trial.
Ratings for over fifty different divisions, corps and army commanders for the Union and Confederacy.


Expanded by:

Blow! Bugles! Blow!

name: UnVeiled
description: A bachelorette bash in a box! Just what you need to throw a fun and sexy party for the bride-to-be. Customize the board with photos of the bride, have her fiancé fill out the special questionnaire, gather some friends and start playing. Just roll the die and use the utterly adorable shoe-shaped game pieces to move along the board. Choose the activity cards you want to create the perfect event (from the tame "sing a Madonna song with only vowel sounds" to the wilder "lick and kiss a stranger's tattoo"). Includes recipes and suggestions for three types of bachelorette party, from an intimate (and inexpensive) evening in to a lavish night on the town. The bride-to-be and up to 30 players can participate
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Up 'N' Under
description:
Up N Under!

The Rugby board game for all Rugby Players, Rugby Fans, and Referees worldwide.

If your favorite Rugby team gets knocked out of the Cup, don’t despair just open up your “Up N Under” Rugby board game and carry on playing on this perfectly packaged portable game.

This is a Quikky dice rolling game with simple rules for 2 players of any age from 9 to 99 or more and each player plays the full 80 minutes or less if you prefer.

Ideal entertainment anytime anywhere - in the playground, in the back of the car, on the train, on the plane, on the beach, in the club house, in the changing rooms at half time or anywhere you fancy – any time is Quikky time.

Comes in one of several formats including: pocket travel case (using coins for randomization), slim-line case, tuf-case, birthday card, greeting card, or beermat coaster.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Von nix kommt nix
description: The players (or teams) will take two roles in this game: They are buying and selling product of development countries, aiming for a high product. At the same time, they are consumers which will buy products of developed countries, having an eye on the price, but also on several guaranteed values, coming with the goods (i.e. boycott products which might have used child labor).

name: Wellington
description:
The publisher's description reads: "WELLINGTON is a puzzle-game of concentration and strategy inspired by the 18th century Pentomino concept. The Pentomino design--up to five connecting blocks in different shapes--is the basis for the game pieces in WELLINGTON, named after the capital of New Zealand in honor of Arthur Wellington, the 'Iron Duke.'"

The playing surface consists of a 10x10 grid, called the "town grid." A burgundy-colored T-shaped piece that covers four squares represents Parliament. Each player has a Duke, represented by a one-square obelisk. With Parliament and the Dukes placed on the board, players alternate turns in placing wooden blocks representing buildings in the city on the board. The objects are to capture the opposing Duke, capture territory, and capture buildings. Parliament, when captured, can be relocated to any available area on the board. Capturing the opposing Duke wins the game immediately. If neither Duke is captured, when no more buildings may be legally played the player capturing the most territory wins.

The publisher also included rules for a solitaire version.

According to the designer, fewer than 100 copies were produced.

name: Fühlo
description:
A tactile memory game for 2-4 players age 3 and up.
Players search for the second of a pair by feeling the objects in a box.

Contents:
Large, colorful wooden box (50 x 50 x 20 cm) with 4 curtained holes to put your hand through
50 objects (25 pairs) in cloth bags

name: Planetenspiel
description:
"Planetenspiel" or "Planets Game"

In a galaxy far far away, 7 suns are orbited by 2 planets each. These planets are home to the Plonx and the Quirx, who both feel they are the better tribe. The more common galactic option to prove superiority, open warfare, has been abandoned. Instead both tribes go head to head in an annual contest, using their ability to manipulate the speed with which their tribe's planets turn around the suns. The tribe that is most skillful at manipulating the planets in such a way that it manages to establish contact between tribe-members on neighboring planets most often, wins the tournament and gains the brag rights for that year.
This is a highly abstract space game for 2 players that is a slight step away for a designer that is better known as a safe pair of hands for decent children's and family games. Manfred Ludwig shows here he can be equally at home with challenging the more abstract gamer as within its simplicity lies an engaging little dice less strategy game that isn't spectacular, but works surprisingly well.

The board shows a large sun on each corner of a hexagonal, and a seventh sun right in the middle of it. Another 3 lines are drawn that divide the hexagonal in 6 equal pizza slices. Then 6 planets are placed at equal distance in circular orbits around each sun, in such a way that the planets closest to a foreign sun are directly facing a planet of that sun. These are the possible meeting points.

Each player get 5 contact chips and places one tribe planet around each sun on the prescribed starting places. Then, in turn, each player moves one own planet. When a player ends a move by making "contact" with another planet of the own tribe, that player claims one contact-chip of the opponent. The first player to own all chips wins the tournament.

Movement follows a strict pattern. Each player can only move one (own) planet each turn. The first player moves a planet exactly one space clockwise, the other player gets to move two spaces. Then moves of three, four and five spaces follow, and when a player has moved five spaces, the whole sequence gets repeated, starting with one. Planets can overtake each other, but moves that would result in planets landing on each other are blocked and force a player to move one of the other planets instead. In the rare cases that a player cannot move any own planets, the opponent gets to move instead.

Publishing history: this abstract game appeared in the German game magazine Pöppel-Revue (1987/2 April-MAY) as that edition's "Das Spiel im Heft". A pull-out board and rules were provided, players still needed to supply their own pieces (2x7 pawns and 10 contact-chips).

name: Kitty Keeno
description: A simple gambling game which consists of rolling dice and making or collecting payments in the form of chips. Each player has a row of numbered tiles corresponding to the possible outcomes of the roll of 2d6, except 7. On their turn if a player rolls a number equal to an un-flipped tile, they flip it; if the tile is already flipped their turn ends. Rolling a 7 or 11 ('kitty') forces the player to pay a chip to the pot while rolling a 12 ('keeno') allows the player to collect the accumulated chips. The first player to flip all of their tiles wins the game and collects points based on the chips they have collected and the un-flipped tiles of their opponents.

name: The Wright Brothers at Kitty Hawk
description:
As of 2006, this game is produced in Seattle, Washington and sold in the souvenir shop at the nearby Museum of Flight. Players are assigned the roles of Wilbur and Orville Wright, each moving along their own separate track of 38 spaces. Movement is handled by flipping a coin, moving one or two spaces forward depending on the result.

Each track is peppered with trivia questions about the Wright brothers, which move the player an additional space forward if answered correctly. The first player to reach the end of their track is the winner.

The game is printed on the back of a large sheet of card stock, which is folded into a simple, 6-page book about the Wright Brothers, providing the basis for the game's trivia questions. Also included are two folded cards, one for each of the players, which contain the answers' to the opposite player's trivia questions.

name: Oliphant Football Game
description:
Art deco design vintage sports graphics on this 1930s football game. Box design features Oliphant front and center plus inset photographs of the following college football coaches:

Miller -Navy

Crisler -Princeton

Phelan - U of Washington

Neyland- Tennesee

Davidson -Army

Anderson –-Notre Dame

Wade - Duke

Kizer- Purdue.

Many other coaches endorsements listed including Knute Rockne and Pop Warner.

Game includes double sided wood playing board decorated as playing field with various field demarcations, OLIPHANT FOOTBALL GAME cards- full deck of 52 cards in decorated box, and a 20 pg instruction book. Game play is mostly determined by card draw.

name: Crossroads
description:
Aim of the game
Crossroads Farm needs new guardians. The person who wins the game will earn the right to care for the farm on a long term basis. Your challenge is to make decisions which allow the farm to make money so that you can maintain the farm. The decisions you make must leave the farm in as good a state or better than when you received it so that future generations can live, work and enjoy the farm.

Earning the most tokens wins you the right to manage the farm.
In this game you will answer questions, take chances, make decisions.

this game was made as an integral part of a sustainable agriculture resource kit distributed to New Zealand Schools by the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries

name: Fielder's Option
description:
Fielder's Option is now a game! Like the excellent original, which was developed to instruct young people in the important fundamentals of baseball, this version may also be played alone or with others.

No one has to tell a serious player that a MENTAL MISTAKE can often make the difference between winning and losing a ballgame. It is for this reason that college and high school students - as well as the recognized professionals - are required to read and memorize play books and study sheets. They are aware that such activity is just as important to becoming a good ballplayer as knowing how to hit the ball and run the bases.

Fielder's Option is different because it puts the "fun" into it. It generates a sense of competition, which is what baseball is all about. And when you play Fielder's Option you have the opportunity to learn not only what is requested of you when playing your "favorite" position, but all the other positions as well.

Pete Rose has recommended it. The creators of Fielder's Option are grateful, for we know there is no better example of a player always being mentally prepared than Pete Rose.

name: Numero Striker
description:
From the publisher:
Use your skills of memory and observation to capture the highest scoring strikers... but beware of dirty tricks (Poaching)

Simple dice game based around buying football/soccer players.

name: Spread the Word
description:
Make up a word, the longer the better, times running out... so pick up a letter.

A word game played on a circular clockwork board. Each player gets a few seconds to place a letter on the board at the end of the currently forming word, scoring points if they form a complete word (1 point per letter in the word).

Players can challenge the previous player if they cannot name a valid word that begins with the currently placed letters.

name: Dorm Rules
description:
Dorm Rules is a set of 10mm/15mm/HO-scale skirmish miniatures rules written by William F. Hostman. The game is designed to be playable in fairly small spaces, and with a minimum of figure manipulation needed for skirmish units.

The use of coherency bases allows instant identification units in coherency.

The game is in beta play test, despite being marked Alpha play test.

Feedback is welcome. No, Feedback is desperately wanted. Consider at least one session report payment for your copy.

The rules are available at [url]http://aramis.hostman.us/games/DormRules0_2ap.pdf [/url]
and the forces list at [url]http://aramis.hostman.us/games/dr0_2ap_forces.pdf [/url]

name: Slag! Campaign Rules
description:
This web-expansion for Greg Porter/BTRC's SLAG! is authorized by Greg Porter, and is listed on his support page http://www.btrc.net/html/suppmain.html#SLAG.

Players build the stellar map tiles, place their systems upon them, and build the space map from them. From there, it is a low randomness 4X game using the SLAG! rules.

There are a few new SLAG! systems developed by the Author.

To get it, aramis.angeltowns.com/slag/

For support questions, geekmail the Author.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Stratagem
description:
Stratagem is an abstract simulation of international conflict. You control a country in a specific historical period and use its resources to accomplish certain objectives. You earn Victory Points by reaching these objectives. The player with the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins.

Stratagem is played in Game-turns. A Game-turn proceeds as follows:

First, up to 10 minutes per turn are allocated for negotiation among the players.
Then the first player receives Resource Factors (RFs) and deploys them. The number of RFs each player receives is specified in the Scenario Instructions.
The player then conducts attacks against other players' RFs. This completes the player's turn.
The remaining players receive RFs, deploy RFs, and then make attacks with their RFs in the sequence given in the Scenario Instructions.
When all of the players have taken their turns, one Game-turn has been completed.
Each game lasts for a specified number of Game-turns. The game is over after all of these have been completed. The players total their Victory Points and the winner is determined.

Stratagem is based on Jim Dunnigan's Origins of World War I and Origins of World War II games.

Not to be confused with:

StrataGem (2004)
Stratagem (2014)

name: Spice Merchants
description: A game of travel and trade set in the late 1500's and early 1600's. Each player is an independent European merchant traveling along the trade routes between Venice, Italy and the Far East. Players buy various spices and commodities in the hopes of a large pay-off when delivered in Venice.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Marble Bowl
description:
Dexterity game which consists of a cardboard ramp up which players roll marbles into a cardboard tray with slots and holes of various point values. From inside the box lid:
"Each player stands several feet from the game and rolls the marbles up the ramp, through the arch and into the box. A marble which does not roll into the box is counted 'out' and does not score. Player with the highest total score wins the game."

name: Maze Trap
description:
From the envelope:


Maze Trap is a 3-DIMENSIONAL strategy game you color, build, then play. Move your "runner" through the maze as quickly as you can while, at the same time, trying to obstruct your opponent's runner with your "blockers." Pieces move around maze walls, over bridges and through warp zones. The first runner to get to the finish, wins.


Maze Trap is a abstract racing game played in a maze. Each player has one runner, four blockers, and one super blocker; regular and super blockers are identical except that regular blockers move up to six spaces and super blockers move up to twelve spaces.

In a round each player moves exactly three of their five blockers, after which each player moves their runner. Runners move up to ten spaces, including zero, but if a runner is blocked so that it can't possibly move ten spaces it returns to start. There are two sets of "warp zones" which teleport pieces between them.

The three-dimensional aspect of the game (aside from the pieces) are bridges across the center of the board, but they could have been represented in two dimensions.

name: Chopper Read The Board Game: A Ram-Raid Ride Through the Aussie Criminal Underground
description:
From the game's web site,

Part board game, part Russian Roulette and all Chopper Read madness, Chopper The Game is a ram-raid ride through the Australian crime world!!!

Start off on the dole (of course) then visit brothels, stand-over notorious crimes, take the blows, beat the coppers and belt your way "Chopper style" through Pentridge to Tassie after rampaging through not-so-sunny Melbourne.

name: Triapon
description:
Triapon

This abstract game is played on a triangular board with 45 holes (the longest row has 9 holes, the tip has one). It can only be played by 3 players exactly, and is, in essence, "Nine Men's Morris" for three.

Each player gets 9 playing pieces and play starts with placement of these pieces onto the board. Clockwise, each player places a piece onto a free space until all pieces are on the board. From then on, in each turn, a player must move one marble to an immediately neighboring empty space. When this result in one or more "Triads" (three uninterrupted marbles of that player's color in a straight line), then that player removes an unprotected marble from one opponent. Extending an existing Triad does not count as creating a new one. The first player who reduced both opponents to 2 marbles each, is the winner.

The designer has come up with a rules set that makes great use of the nature of a triangular grid, making Triapon a much cleverer strategic game than a simple connect-3 on a triangle. A careful observer will notice that, besides the obvious Triad that is made on neighboring rows, there are two other straight lines along which Triads can be formed. If a "short Triad" uses 3 neighboring rows, a "medium Triad" uses holes that lay one row removed from each other, and a "long Triad" even has gaps of 2 rows between the marbles.

Pieces get taken first from the opponent who has the most marbles left on board, and only vulnerable marbles can be removed. These are pieces that don't form part of any Triad, are in a Triad that gets crossed by a longer Triad, or are part of an extended Triad, but, when removed, leave the other marbles still in a Triad.

And in the Nine Men's Morris tradition: when a player is reduced to just 3 pieces, that player gains the option to move a marble to any free space. The moment that a player has only 2 pieces left, that player is eliminated.

This is, in broad lines, how standard Triapon is played. An entertaining variation in which blocking marbles are brought back onto the board is also included.

Publishing history: released in 2 versions by the Swiss "Murmel Spielwerkstatt und Verlag" in 1999. The packing is as clever as the game itself: the board edges flap up to form a pyramid shaped box, neatly holding all the pieces. The deluxe board, or "Triapon Classic", is made of 8-layer plywood and comes with 30 glass marbles (10 in 3 colors) in a pouch. The cheaper version is made of cardboard, has a picture of a famous Swiss Alp printed on the outside, and is hence known as the "Triapon Matterhorn" edition.

name: Dragondisks
description:
Acorn Games has updated their original game from 1999, Dragons & Danes.

They have updated the artwork and changed the name as well as added a new twist with a mini-game within the main game which can affect the outcome.

Dragondisks is an exciting "Combat" style game that uses unique "Throwing Disks" that will either score you points or enter you into a "Battle" mode. You may find yourself in the middle of a "War," fighting a "Skirmish," "Ambushing" your enemy or find yourself saying "OH NO!" as your "Ambush" backfires in your FACE! There is even a side game where you can gamble to win or lose it all within the main game.

On each turn you either win or lose pieces of treasure from your treasure horde. Of course everyone knows, "He who getteth the most treasure WINS!"

Dragons & Danes is hand-crafted in the Acorn Games studio. Each game gets hand-assembled by the in-house game-crafters. The same pair of hands sees each game through from start to finish.

Each set of Dragondisks includes:
1 set of 5 hand-crafted "Throwing Disks"
1 velvet carrying pouch
1 booklet with complete game rules
30 jewel colored "Treasure Horde" pieces

name: Resort
description: Every game you play is different. The combinations of sites and investment opportunities create exciting options for every player.The basic idea is to move around the board investing in different resorts. You can upgrade these resorts so when landed on by another player the amount payed to the owner is increased.(the concept is very similar to Monopoly)

name: Family Jewels
description: The sexy who, where, what and which adult mystery game. Includes game board, 6 game pieces, 13 playing chips, 29 playing cards and rule sheet. For 3-6 players.

name: Peter Gunn Detective Game
description: The Peter Gunn Detective Game is based on the highly successful Peter Gunn Television series from the early 1960's. Craig Stevens' character features prominently on the box of this licensed board game for kids 7-14. Each player takes a piece and start in the center of the board. A face-down person (Mr. Aay, Mr. Bee, Mr. Cee, Mr. Dee) and a face-down weapon (hammer, gun, knife, poison) are laid about on the board, and each player gets 2 cards, one showing which person to find, and one showing which weapon to find. Players spin the spinner to move around the board, looking at the face-down pieces in each area until they find the 2 on their cards. They then return to the center, reveal their cards, and tell the other players where their weapon and person are on the board. If they succeed, they win! If they declare wrong they are eliminated.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery

name: Play & Learn the Childcraft Quiz Game
description:
Play and Learn is a trivia game based on the Worldbook 'How & Why' library of children's encyclopedias.
Players move around a square board and depending where they land are required to take a volume of the World Book encyclopedias and then answer a question after being directed to the required page by the cards.

name: Favored of Zeus
description:
From their website.

Favored of Zeus is a card game for two to five people in which you take the place of one of the gods of Olympus. Zeus has declared a challenge among his gods and goddesses to be the first to gather one-hundred thousand followers.

To aid you in this task, you are allowed to choose one amongst the mortals who will champion your cause. This mortal will fight off the obstacles placed in your way by competitors as well as quest to increase your reputation. Along the way your hero can encounter allies to aid him, and you may take control of mighty Creatures that can make your obstacles more difficult for opponents or attack opponents' followers directly.

All you need to play are the cards, two six-sided dice, the game boards for each god, and something to use as a counter for each player (a penny or dime works well). An average game takes 30-60 minutes.

name: Soul Sight CCG
description: Soul Sight CCG (Customizable Card Game) is a Bible based card game. The cards are put into ply via the quoting of scripture. This game is heavy on memorization. Memory skills and deck building make this a game for ages 8-adult.

name: Libido
description: The spicy dicey adult game of strategy and luck! Contains 6 Libido™ dice cups 36 Libido™ dice, storage bag, and rule sheet. For 2-6 players.

name: Down & Dirty
description: The lusty "inspect and collect" adult card game. Contains 104 Down & Dirty playing cards and rule sheet. For 2 to 6 players.

name: Cajones
description: The adult strategy game that takes balls! Contains 1 playing board, 24 Cajones™ balls, drawstring storage bag, and rule sheet. For 2 players or teams.

name: Nice or Nasty?
description: The adult sexy slang game for word freaks! Contains 104 Nice or Nasty cards, 1 Nice or Nasty playing board, 8 pawns, 8 pads, and 8 pencils. For 2 to 8 players.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Word Game

name: Bare with Me
description:
Players reveal their sexy reasoning or complete "pointed" sentence stems in their own words. For instance, do you know what your lover or friends would write if asked to list 2 reasons for having sex on the first date? Or how would they complete the sentence "If sex was playground equipment, I'd be..." or "You know I'm feeling horny when..."? Winning the game is easy: be the first player to collect a token from each of the other players by correctly guessing their answer!

The game where you "Bare" more than your soul! Includes 64 game chips, 80 game cards, 1 die, 8 pads, 8 pencils and rule sheet. For 3-8 players.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Pose & Disclose
description: The Scandalous game for show-offs and posers! Includes 160 game cards, 2 dice, rule sheet. For 2 or more players.

name: Throws of Passion
description: The hilarious 'Love Positions' Dice Game. Includes male and female dice, 6 'positions' cards, score pad, rule booklet, pencils and storage pouch. For 2 or more players.

name: Trylogy (The Twin Cities)
description: Tryology appears to be a combination of trivia and abstract strategy. Shipped in a triangular box, just like another Osobo title Triopoly. They also seemed to love to produce black components, as evidenced by Tryology, Triopoly and Beverly Hills.

name: Bee Bopper
description:
"BOP UP YOUR BEE BOP, WHEN THE SPINNER POINTS TO YOU...
I'LL TRY TO CATCH YOUR BEE AND WIN A CHIP OR TWO"

"Get ready! Get set! Play BEE BOPPER! One player bops their bee when the spinner points to their color. To win chips, opponents try to trap the bee before it is bopped, or catch the bee in their net after it is bopped. Who's the best BEE BOPPER? ...invite the gang around to find out!"

Players must try to increase their initial complement of ten chips to twenty by catching or trapping opponent's bees with their net. The first to do so is the winner.

The game comes in a large colorful box (16" x 14" x 3") with four nets, four bees, four bopping devices, a spinner and a supply of chips. Apart from the cardboard spinner base, all components are plastic.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Professor Noggin's Life on the Farm
description:
Cultivate your mind with trivia questions from Professor Noggin’s Life on the Farm. Topics range from all aspects of farm life, including animals, plants, and machines.

Card topics include:
Apples
Berries
Chickens
Corn
Cotton
Cows
Dogs
Donkeys
Ducks
Eggs
Farm Buildings
Farm Tools
Fish Farming
Flowers
General Topic Card
Goats
Grain
Hay
Herbs_&_Spices
Honey Bees
Horses
Horseshoes
Manure
Maple Syrup
Nuts
Pigs
Protecting the Farm
Pumpkins
Sheep
Turkeys
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Farming, Trivia
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., Outset Media

name: Rhyme Thyme
description: Rhyme Thyme is a fast-action matching game that will have you racing to get rid of your cards first. Spot a rhyme in another player's hand and be the first to call out the match. You will need keen eyes and fast hands to "catch the match" in this game.

name: Picture Spot
description: It's a whole lot of fun trying to match the pieces of the modes of transportation together. Line up the puzzle cards with the right spot on the game board to reveal the whole picture. Children successfully complete the pictures by using visual clues to match the cards to their boards.

name: A Day at the Races
description:
A Day at the Races is a novel if somewhat random attempt at creating the excitement of a race meet complete with betting on the family room table.

This game comes from the Crown and Andrews stable well-noted for their tabletop cricket simulation "Test Match" which has stood the test of time as the benchmark children’s cricket game that delivers strategy and fun through a heavily TOY based game. e.g.: manually triggering your bowler to bowl a ball which the batsman needs to manually trigger and hit to toy fieldsmen.

However a Day at the Races involves you clamping one end of the racetrack to the end of your table with two provided metal clamps and then pulling a tensioned green vinyl racetrack out until you can hook it over the other end of the table. Then it is a matter of setting up the other colorful bits such as the starting stalls, the finishing post and of course the five lovely plastic horses complete with weighted swinging jockeys.

Players then present their stall cards to get their starting places and have an opportunity to bet on who they think will hit the finish line first.

From here it is a matter of turning a crank at the starting line which causes the track to vibrate under the horses propelling them slowly forward, until a winner emerges.

As far as I can determine this seems entirely random (although the weighted jockeys seem to behave differently each time). Though the game would be a great beer and pretzels action affair or for those loving horse racing. Due to the random nature and betting I wouldn't really recommend for youngsters.

name: Conjecture for Kids
description:
The "model" game for enhancing a child’s creativity. Based on the best-selling original Conjecture, Conjecture For Kids is designed for younger players. The object of the game is to sculpt modeling dough into a topic identified on your game card in hopes that your team can guess the right answer before your opponents.

This game offers parents and teachers a wonderful tool to help children develop hand-eye coordination, and teach them to associate imagery with words.

Similar to the classic game of Pictionary, only using sculpting dough rather than drawings, Conjecture For Kids offers hours of entertainment for parties of all sizes. To assist the artistically-challenged, we permit the sculptor to make motions with the dough, however noises (aside from laughter) are forbidden.

The hilarious game features two varieties of uniquely scented dough that will last several years if maintained properly, and because it is water based, it won’t make a mess.

name: Sebastopols Belägring
description:
SEBASTOPOLS BELÄGRING. Nytt slags schackspel.
Ett underhållande tidsfördrif för ungdom och i sällskapskretsar.
Detta nya spel bildar en övergång från Dam- till Schackspelet samt ger eger ökadt intresse genom att bildlikt framställa den krigsskådeplats, som fortfarande tager vår samtids hela uppmärksamhet i anspråk.

Nytryck 2001, Armémuseum Stockholm.

THE SIEGE OF SEBASTOPOL. New kind of Chess.
A amusing pastime for youth and society.
This new game is a link from Checker to Chess and tries to visualize the battleground, that still claim all our society's attention.

New print 2001, The Swedish army museum Stockholm.
publishers: (Public Domain), Armémuseum, C. F. Arwidssons förlag

name: Daler
description: In the year 1613 The Danish King Christian IV forbade cursing and gaming. Daler is one of the games which was played at open seas behind the canons of the ship, because the gamblers were afraid of getting caught in the act. The game is a simple dice game for gamblers.

name: Bulyah
description:
