Armed with the beverage of their choice, players of BULYAH take turns rolling dice and moving around the board, trying to collect enough Letter Cards to spell the word, "BULYAH." In true board game fashion, there are stops along the way that try to prevent players from reaching their goal. These stops are what make the game interesting and bring the drinking into the picture.

Before play begins, a 4-ounce glass is filled to the brim with the beverage of everyone’s choice and is placed in the middle of the board. The "Grave" will be consumed many times throughout the game, as players either land on a "Grave Stone" space on the board or are instructed to do so by one of the 100 Action Cards. When an Action Card is drawn, the player must follow the command designated. These can range from announcing, "I am stupid" before taking a drink, to revealing one of your most embarrassing moments, to acting as servant to all of the other players by refilling their drinks, and even making up your own rule as the "Rule Master." Oh yeah, be weary of the Prison and Hospital spaces, however, you can gain relief by hiding out in the "Safety Zone".

Contents: One party board, 100 Action cards, 60 Letter cards, two die, and six tokens.

name: Murder à la carte: Eat, Drink, and Be Married
description:
The mystery: Welcome to Vegas with it's glitzy casinos and show-stopping entertainment. The deck is stacked against wealthy casino owner, Blackjack White, as he bursts into the love-me chapel to stop his beautiful naive daughter from marrying a burly biker named Ezekiel Z. Ryder. Alas, Blackjack is shot dead by a member of the wedding party. Don't bet on the guilty suspect...it may be you...

Includes party planner, character booklets for all suspects including their roles and background information, 8 place cards, 8 party invitations & envelopes, 6 secret clues, and cassette tape with an introduction, summary of events, and the solution to the crime.

name: Branson the Game
description:
Take a vacation to Branson, Missouri. While playing the game, players roll dice, move around the floor, and collect as many Vacation Cards as possible. At the end of thirty minutes, the player with the most Vacation Cards is the winner.
Vacation Cards include Show-Time Cards, Meal-Time Cards and Fun-Time Cards. There are also Action Cards which include Think-Fast Cards, Audition Cards and Good News/Bad News Cards. Side loop trips also offered on the game board.
Very colorful board with playing pieces in the shapes of little family sedans. The good news: no money involved.
BONUS: This is a virtual time capsule of Branson in 1992. Many of the attractions and stars featured on the game board are no longer in Branson or have passed away. Includes Boxcar Willie, John Davidson, Wayne Newton, Tony Orlando, Ray Stevens, Jim Stafford and more!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The New York Game
description:
(from game insert:)
Now New York is a game! And playing the subway can be fun..

Take the subway to 6 of New York's fascinating places of interest. You'll find 36 of them on THE NEW YORK GAME board. Change lines! Detain every player to your advantage. Let those delays, repairs and mix-ups obstruct your opponents' progress. The first one to return to his starting point wins.

THE NEW YORK GAME keeps things moving. It's fast. It's fun. Skill and chance work together to insure a great time for all. And, when the game is over, you'll be surprised to see how much you have learned about the city of New York.

Sibling: The Boston Game
Sibling: The London Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sacoma!
description:
Each player has 6 pieces to place on the outer edge of a hex-shaped pattern of holes forming 3 concentric circles. After placement they then take turns moving one piece, with no more than three pieces allowed in a line and no more than two of the same color.

One point is scored for each piece in the middle ring and two points for each piece in the center ring - with none for the outer ring. The winner is the first person to eight points.

name: Goblin Wood
description:
From the box:

Goblin Wood is the home of mischievous Goblins and naughty magpies. As a snail you must follow the bridal paths through the wood in search of the golden keys to the castle on the hill. But beware! The Goblins and magpies lie in wait, ready to steal your golden keys. The first player to reach the castle with a key is the winner.

Goblin Wood is the first in a new and exciting range of quality toys, puzzles and boardgames from Play Games UK Ltd. It's very simple to play, will improve the memory skills, is full of decision making and is extremely colorful and packed with fun. The constant changes in the direction of play ensure that you'll never tire of playing Goblin Wood."
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: RithmaSpace
description:
From the game:

"The object of the game is simply to occupy four colored spaces. There are 8 spaces to aim for so the task shouldn't be too difficult. Although the final task remains the same, there are four versions of Rithma that get progressively harder and finally allow you to play really deviously. For all the versions each player starts with four cube pieces of one color and chooses a target space (cyan, magenta or gold) to aim for."

The board is 7x7 squares and each square is either colored or has a shape in it. A piece moving off the shapes has to move the number of spaces that the shape has sides - 3 for a triangle, 4 for a square and 5 for a pentagon.

name: Chandal Mandal
description:
"The game of Chandal Mandal"

A variation of Chaupar, the national game of India. Chaupar later became Parcheesi - aka Ludo - in the west. Invented by Akbar the Great, ruler of India, who lived from 1542 to 1605.

Think of it as 16 player Chaupar, with 16 arms instead of 4, and you are a long way there. The board is made out of 16 parallelograms arranged in a circle around a centre. Each parallelogram is divided in 24 fields, in 3 rows of 8. Each of the 16 players get 4 pawns each. Four (traditional) dice are used, with the longer sides marked 1,2,10 and 12. As in Chaupar, the pieces are moved anti-clockwise, and go around the whole circle. The first player out wins the agreed amount from all other 15, and each subsequent finisher also gets that same amount from whoever is still left to finish. So the last player loses the most.

His Majesty seemed to play 12 broad variations:

1. No pawn can remove another pawn, but it moves on by itself instead.
2. Single pawns may be captured, and are sent back to start.
3. With each throw two pawns are moved at a time (with or without the option to capture).
4. Three or four pawns are moved like this.
5. The dice are thrown four times, and four pawns are moved at each throw.

Usually players would all move in the same direction, but sometimes some players would move anti-clockwise, whilst other would play clockwise.

6. A player is out when he reaches the starting point of the player directly opposite, moving from the middle row of his opposite number into the empty centre space. Longer games would require players to reach the starting point of the player sitting on the left.
7. Each player has three throws. On the first throw two own pawns are moved, on the second throw, the player moves one own pawn, and one pawn belonging to the player on the right. On the third throw, again, one own pawn gets moved, plus the player on the left may also move one pawn belonging to that player. Pawns belonging to neighbours cannot be removed, and when they land in the same row as a player's own pieces, they are moved as if they belonged to the throwing player.
8. Two pawns together may hit two other pawns, but single pawns cannot hit each other.
9. Four pawns combined can remove 3 pawns, 3 pawns can hit groups of 2, 2 can hit single pawns, but single pieces cannot remove any.
10. A player whose turn it is moves according to the dice rolled, the player opposite him moves at the same time, but uses the eyes of the bottom side of the dice, whilst the players on the left and right also move, but according to the eyes on the left and right face of the rolled die.
11. Five dice are rolled. The active player moves the sum of the two highest rolls. The next highest roll is used by the person on the opposite side of the board. The lowest two rolls are used by the players sitting on the left and right.
12. Five dice and five pawns. At every throw, the result of one of the rolled dice is given to the player on the right. In a variation to this, the thrower would name four players before rolling, and would give one result to each of these players, keeping only the fifth die. And when only a few points are left to get pukhtah, the remaining points go to those near to where the dice come to rest.

If the game was played by less people the board and the number of dice thrown would be amended accordingly. It is highly likely the boards were frequently life-sized and groups of slave girls were sent around the track, dressed in appropriate colours.

Brief history: ask anyone to name great rulers of history and you are unlikely to hear the name Akbar, ruler of the Mughal Empire (1556-1605). Leaving remarkable military and administrative successes, and a fondness for alcohol and women to one side, the illiterate and, at times, brutal man, also had a passion for religious tolerance and class harmony. He surrounded himself with scholars, thinkers and poets, and was persuaded by the Plato school that argued that a great ruler should be like a philosopher-king. Whilst trying to unify the different religions, he became a great patron of the arts and literature, for which he is best remembered. Thanks to the recordings in the "Ain I Akabari", third volume of the "Akbarnāma", a detailed biography and history record kept by his close advisor and court scribe, Abu'l Fazl, we know that the good bloke also had a weak spot for games, and had even invented a game of his own. It is because of Abu'l Fazl passion for detail and accuracy that the rules of this elaborate Chaupar descendant have been preserved to this day, as part of a seperate chapter on Amusements.

name: How to make a Million!
description:
From the game:

"Sport, Business, Crime and Acting. Choose the career that suits you best and set about making your million, but remember, life is never easy. Apart from the pitfalls built into your career, your scheming rivals will be plotting your downfall.
Build up your tactical defenses and plan attacks on your opponents, or join forces with an ally to fight a common foe.
Lawsuits, Court Orders and Suspensions may all be used against your rivals and a timely gamble could help you win the game.
You will need all your skills to make a million, have you got what it takes?"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Dr Fox's the Pepsi Chart No. 1 Board Game
description:
From the box:

"You've just launched three new singles ... they're hot and ready to trot ... hovering just outside the Pepsi Chart Top 50! BUT, so have your rivals just across the table ... WHO is going to be first to the NUMBER ONE slot?? "Take a chance, Take a chance" as some Swedish group once said. Rock and Roll that dice and get those records moving up the chart! It's not just a steady climb upwards, things can go Down just as easily. On the way you may have a FLOP or two, all just one of life's set backs on the way to fame and fortune. Pick yourself up, dust yourself down, and start all over again! Still, you'll need more than a little POP knowledge if, or WHEN you land on one of those tricky little 'trivia' spaces. Good luck. See you at Number ONE!"

'Nuff said!

name: BBC TV's One to Win
description:
From the box:

" The quick fire quiz game where you cover numbers until you need ... ONE TO WIN!

Here's your chance to test your general knowledge to the limit and play the hit TV quiz just like a real game show contestant.
The questions come hard and fast so there's never a dull moment - just a whole lot of fun for friends and family!
Finish the proverb "Absence makes the heart ..." Decide whether the tomato is a fruit or a vegetable, whether tortoises have teeth and whether or not a maharajah is an Indian prince.
Will you be the first to cover your score board completely and attempt the Word Challenge?
Lose the challenge and you'll lose half your hard earned-points. But as they say, its tough at the top if you really want to be 'The One to Win'!"

name: Toot! Toot! A Train Game for Tiny Tots
description:
This a game designed for children 4-8 and has wooden trains, cardboard signal lights, and a board that has a track on it.

On each turn the child tries to move a to colored space on the track and "builds" his train to make his delivery at the end. First complete train around the track wins. The interesting part in what would be a simple roll and move is that the "roll" is dexterity-based, you have to roll a marble in a box with holes - this determines the color in which to move your train to... Good for developing fine motor skills.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: FOO: Fundamental Order of Operation
description: This game teaches the order of operation. Players arrange cards in a frame in order to create formulas which result in a multiple of 12. There are 78 cards and four frames used for arranging cards. The cards bear the numbers 1 through 9 and symbols for addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, parentheses, brackets, and exponents.

name: Say-it Subtraction
description: This bingo-style game is used to teach basic subtraction problem recognition for 2-6 players. Game includes 6 subtraction sheets and 100 problem cards.

name: Auto Assault TCG
description:
Auto Assault TCG is a fast-paced digital trading-card game for two players based on the fastest, most explosive MMO ever!

As a member of one of three factions, Biomek, Human and Mutant, you command a high-performance vehicle, and must destroy your opponent’s vehicle or complete four missions for the win. Along the way, you’ll need to master maneuvers, gear, tactics and your vehicle itself. Each faction has four classes with their own strengths and weaknesses, and it’s up to you to discover them!

Auto Assault TCG: Ignition is a 339-card base set and is available in a number of introductory packages. Starter decks and boosters are also available.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Modern Warfare, Racing, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme

name: Armego: The Board Game
description:
In the twilight of the old era, the Earth suffers from the last colonial war. Gigantic mobile cities are fighting for global domination over the planet and its resources. As the leader of a warring faction, you control the destiny of your people. You've got to exploit raw materials, to build an army strong enough to destroy your enemies. You may build alliances, but take care of whom you trust. Manage your troops wisely, became a cunning diplomat and it can be you, who will be the first global ruler in the dawning of a new age of the Earth.

Armego contains:

* 1 game board (4 pieces)
* 16 bases
* 160 combat units
* 4 status cards
* 4 rule summary cards
* 9 help maps
* banknotes
* 2 six-sided dice
* 1 rulebook
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Divorce Cope
description:
A unique and fun game to help parent and children cope with divorce.

Divorce cope takes you through the ups and downs of divorce. As you go around the Divorce Cope board, you'll deal with real life situations which families of divorce experience. These include child support, custody battles, school problems and step-families.

Players deposit anger, depression and loneliness cards and pick up happy times, independence and optimism cards, competing for growth points along the way. 250 specially designed questions will help you and your children understand each other's feelings while having fun.

Divorce Cope will open a whole new world of communication between you!

name: Slim Chance
description:
Players compete "to gain the least amount of weight by answering questions about Diet, Nutrition, and Health." The playing surface rings the board in an 8x8 square. Pawns move the number of spaces indicated on a die roll. The game lasts for five rounds of five turns each, for a total of 25 turns.

A player "gains weight" either by landing on the buffet space (thereby overindulging) or landing on a colored square. If the latter, the player must correctly answer a question from a supplied card to avoid the weight gain. (The cards give both the correct answer and its rationale, to provide an educational experience for the players.)

Players "lose weight" either by landing on the "Fat Farm" or by correctly answering a question when landing on the "Slim Chance" space.

Players sent to the "Pig Pen" must wear a supplied Pig Mask until their next turn.

name: Logus Jr.
description:
(children's version of Logus Sr.)

The slide-letter game for children. Combines spelling skill and manual dexterity as players race to spell a word by sliding letters in their board.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Puzzle, Word Game
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Spelling, Tile Placement

name: Quest NLP
description:
Quest NLP is the first game specifically created to enhance the learning of NLP (Neuro Linguistic Programming) skills and knowledge. NLP is a form of applied psychology, used in business, therapy, coaching, education, health, and many other contexts.

Players move their brain tokens around the Trivial Pursuit style board, and answer questions from their knowledge of NLP. When successful, players receive coins, and must collect 4 coins in each of 3 categories to be the winner. Up to 6 players can compete individually, or up to a suggested 12 in teams.

Contents include game board, 6 player brain tokens, 300 question cards, lots of coins for scoring, dice, timer, rules.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rio Ranchos
description:
Solitary Cowboys wanting to gain money in the West with cattle, except that not all have the same fighting ability, or the same intelligence, and that after a while, the board is crowded and there is not much place left for new herds.

Cards give you powers or special actions, fights are solved with dices, and each player has a "Cowboy Sheet" with all details of his lone worker.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: First Down Derby
description:
First Down Derby is the new interactive board game invented and intended to provide family and group entertainment while viewing or listening to any football game played at any level.

First Down Derby includes a 23"x11" Game Board including Rules of the Game, 1,000 Derby Dollars, 10 numbered multicolored markers and 10 First Down Derby Champion Stickers.

Up to ten people may play at one time, but all players must start and finish at the same time.

First Down Derby play may start or end at any time during the duration of any football game.

1) In the beginning of the game a banker is elected. The banker should also play the game. The banker is responsible for distributing the Derby Dollars to all players.

2) Each player then picks a marker, numbered 1-10.

3) Before the start of each series of offensive downs, each player must place his/her marker on the position they feel the offensive team will obtain a first down, no first down or a turn-over (fumble or interception). More than one player may place their marker on a position at one time.

name: Fraction Quizmo
description: A bingo-style game where math questions are asked and the player must mark the answer on their bingo card. This is a precursor to the more modern Quizmo version which covers both decimals and fractions.

name: Bug World
description:
BUG WORLD is a game in which the players control a team of ants. Three worker ants and one soldier. Each team leaves the safety of your nest in search of different types of food. You roam throughout the garden, seeking under leaf and twig for the next morsel... but look out! Around the next corner could be an even hungrier praying mantis, trap door spider, assassin bug or other nasty predator, which you need to fight off to survive. Figure out where your paticular type of food is hidden and get them back to your nest first, and you can become king of the Bug World! Game includes a large folding game board, 1 die, 12 worker ant pieces, 4 solider ant pieces, 20 bug playing pieces, an insect glossary with cool bug facts and playing instructions.

Ages 9 and up.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Clam Chowder: The Server's Card Game
description:
From the website:

Imagine a game that entertains the servers, guests, and could quite possibly help you to enjoy waiting tables again. Remember your first day on the floor by yourself? Your own section, your own tables, and your own tips. What will you say? What if someone asks about the specials that you can't remember squat about? Clam Chowder: The Server's Card Game has the potential to bring the butterflies back, but this time you know the menu and are ready to enjoy them.

110 cards of strange upselling, humor, and debauchery. No longer will you be saying the same thing over and over again like a broken record. 2 to 10 players try to complete as many cards as they can through the course of a shift or play by yourself and try to beat your last score.

Hey, everyone has to work, why not have some fun at it? Don't worry, I've included some goodie-goodie cards to keep the managers off your back.

You'll laugh, you'll cry, you'll probably get fired. But hey, I hear they're hiring next door and the tips are better.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time

name: Maths Me!
description:
This game is designed by a Singaporean company, Camelot Hobbies. Players try to get rid of cards in their hands by playing cards that fit the mathematical conditions at the time. The game comes with a deck of 39 cards and two special six-sided dice (the dice show 1,1,2,3,+ and -).

From the rules:


Object of the GameTo be the Greatest, just be the first to discard all your Maths Me! cards! To do this, players place them in turn in a centre discard-pile according to the 'condition' of the play at the time.

One pack of Maths Me! cards is just right for 2-4 players. For more than 4 players, just add another pack!

Game Structure

Maths Me! is a mathematical symbol game that revolves around placing valid cards according to one of the 2 prevailing conditions, "Greater Than" or "Less Than". The prevailing condition refers to the current flow of the game. During "Greater Than", players must place cards which continually increase the numerical value being played (e.g. 47, 63, 89, 92 ...). On the other hand, when the prevailing condition is "Less Than", numbers must become smaller and smaller.

The game came with a sticker indicating the National Parenting Center Seal of Approval 1997 (The Camelot Hobbies website gives the year for the seal of approval as 1996).

URL for Camelot Hobbies website: http://www.camelot.com.sg/

name: The Game of Midlothian, VA
description: This is a version of Monopoly put out in Midlothian, VA. It features businesses local to the area, such as Ukrop's, Kabuto,and out of business Heilig-Meyers. Illustrations are by Cynthia B. Guerra.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Patton Takes Command, the Tunisian Campaign, 1942-43
description:
An operational level game on the Tunisian Campaign in 1942 and 1943. Ground scale is 5 miles per hex, counters represent brigades and regiments.

Development of this game is currently on hold.

name: Ortho
description:
From the Pennsylvania Packet, March 1, 1783:

"The subscribers beg leave to offer to the Public, a new invented GAME at CARDS, called ORTHO, designed not only for amusement, but instruction in the orthography of the English language ; instead of the four suits, or pips, in common use, these cards are furnished with four sets of the English alphabet, having such certain powers assigned to the respective letters as to admit of variety, ingenuity, and entertainment in the play, with the additional and important advantage of insinuating a correctness in spelling, and a knowledge in the operation of letters in the formation of words. These Cards, neatly ornamented and made up in packs of 104 cards each, with full Directions how they are to be played, printed on the wrapper, are made and sold by the subscribers, at their Card and Paper-Hanging Factory, in Walnut street, above the New Gaol, Philadelphia, and may be had at most of the shops. Price, but the single pack, 7s 6d, with a large allowance to purchase by the dozen.

EDWARD RYVES & CO.

N.B. The above CARDS are likewise Sold by the Printer hereof."

Glossary of terms --
orthography - the art of writing words with the proper letters according to standard usage
gaol - chiefly British variant of jail

name: Plus 'n' Minus Games
description:
From the box:

Each player draws a card from the stockpile, each card will show a maths question. That player reads the card and gives the answer. If the other player agrees with that answer, the player moves to the appropriate number square, ie. if the player draws the card 6 - 3, and correctly answers 3, the marker will be moved to the next 3 on the board.

name: Staffa
description:
Each year the different life forms on the planet Staffa compete in their traditional game of Hex Rock Climbing. The first team to have three members reach the Transmat station at the top of the Great Hex Rock is the winner.

The game consists of a game board, the Transmat station, 6 teams of 4 unique Staffans, 100 small rock pieces and 2 dice. The two dice are rolled and allocated between Staffan movement and the introduction or movement of the hex rocks. Rock placement is subject to certain rules and cannot be placed on top of Staffans! Staffan movement is across hexes or up or down. When a Staffan reaches the Transmat, the next player relocates the station.

There are variants for impatient people, athletes, architects and hamsters!
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Wheel 'N Deal
description:
Each Player Owns a Casino! And what a choice of casinos: Wilbur Clark's Desert Inn; New Frontier; Sahara; El Rancho Vegas; The Thunderbird; or the Showboat. The big names of the 1950's, now, mostly history.
Game comes with six of the aforementioned casino placards to place in front of you when you play "the house", a miniature roulette wheel, a roulette board and a craps board, regular dice and, the main game mechanic, one die with the names of the six casinos and one die with the games poker, 21, roulette and craps on four sides and "Dealers choice" printed on the other two.
When the special dice are rolled, it determines who will be "the house" and the game to be played. The other players will play three games as customers in the host casino before the special dice are rolled to determine where the party will move next.
Play continues till all the money is in one casino's vault or until an agreed upon time.

name: Star-Struck
description:
An acting game, in which you play a star in 1 of 5 entertainment categories (commercials, TV, music, theater, and movies). Your teammates have 2 minutes to guess your identity and situation.

You can talk, sing, dance, or use an actor's famous lines to get your identity across. The winning team is the first to successfully audition around the board in all 5 casting studios.

Includes gameboard, question cards, timer, 4 playing pieces, 1 6-sided die, and instructions
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Tover je Toverweg
description:
Translation from the website:

Every year the wizards compete to become the Masterwizard. This year the tournament is held in the forest of a thousand roads. There the wizards will have to prove themselves by bringing their new students to the magical destination. Do you dare taking on this challenge and play the game? Your students aren't allowed to use magic, so the result of the tournament is in your hands. By acquiring the right magic cards your students can travel quickly or your opponents students can be hindered.

By smartly and tactically using your magic powers, you can easily reach the destination. With Tover je Toverweg the takes the first steps in the magical world of boardgames. The structure and setup offer the right balance between options and ability for the youngest players. With 4 different game boards, accessories and extensive variants the game is a challenge for young as well as old (and even grown-ups). The game grows along with the development of the spacial view.

name: Mighty Max Ultimate Adventure Game
description: A 3-D board game where players join Mighty Max in a quest for 6 magical Doom stones. The game is played through 6 different Doom zones, all built within the six sides of a 3-D cone-shaped tower on a box base. Each zone has 2 playable level floors and all are based on popular Mighty Max toy play sets. The first player to collect all the 6 Doom stones from each zone is declared the winner of the game. The game is highly detailed and is played with cards and dice. Mighty Max - His Fate Is In Your Hands! For ages 3 and up.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ponents
description: The object of the game is to be the first player to move all of your "Ponents" (game pieces) to the opposite side of the board. Pieces can move one space diagonally, staying on their color spaces, or can diagonally jump pieces of any color, but again must stay on their own color spaces. Includes rules for a points variant.
publishers: Dynamic Games / Dynamic Design Industries, Reiss Games

name: Lucky Puppy Math
description:
This game has a two sided board. On one side there is a version of Snakes and Ladders called Blue Ribbon Pooch in which players use dogs as tokens, and use two numerical dice and one operations dice to add or subtract before moving their token. Hence, players must perform the required mathematical operations in order to move their token.

On the other side of the board is Lucky Puppy, in which all players begin in the dog pound and work their way around the board to find a home. There are four special places on the board, where players may improve or hamper their progress by completing a task. When a player lands on one of these spaces, however, all players get a chance at receiving the bonus or penalty: they complete to answer the math question posed by the roll of the dice. A player must complete all the tasks to get a home. Dice are used in the same way as in Blue Ribbon Pooch. The graphics on the game board depict various situations in which a child might interact with a dog.

This is a children's game designed to develop math skills.

name: Climbing Everest
description: Essentially a roll-and-move fest along the lines of snakes and ladders, players begin at base camp and advance to the top of everest with various aids or hindrances represented by special squares on the track. Players can get boosted forward or backwards depending on the roll. The game is based on the Sir John Hunt expedition to Everest in 1953.
publishers: CEFA (Celulosa Fabril S. A.), G. J. Hayter & Co, Ltd.

name: Multiplication 0-12
description: This is a simple card game that teaches young children the multiplication tables. Each card depicts a math problem with one factor missing such as 1x_=3 or _x4=12. Players try to collect sets of 4 cards that all have the same missing factor. Sets are laid on the table and the first player to empty his/her hand of cards is the winner.

name: Murder Mystery Party: Panic at the Prom
description:
It promises to be a magical night as Centerville High School celebrates Senior Prom...“Under the Sea”!

All eyes are on the two most popular and beautiful students, Katelyn and Dylan, as they are crowned King and Queen of the Prom. But during the spotlight dance, the emergency sprinkler system soaks the entire student body. Who had the motive and the opportunity to sabotage the evening?

Game Includes:

Everything you’ll need to play a 2-3 hour dinner party game

• 10 Party invitations
• Secret clues
• Party Planner Booklet
• Name tags
• 10 Player’s Booklets
• Dinner menus & recipe

name: Bad Boys Collector Game Cards
description:
This was one of the games published in TSR's "Comics Modules" - it appeared in Warhawks Comics Module #5, which is called Warhawks 2050 Part 1 on the cover.

It consists of a deck of 24 cards depicting characters, places, and objects from "Bad Boys," the backup feature in the Warhawks book. These are used to play two games, one (not given a separate title) which is rummy-like, and one, The Hunt for El Presidente, which is similar to Old Maid.

For the first game, the cards can be combined with those from other TSR comics - Buck Rogers, 13: Assassin, RIP: Avenger of the Dead, Black Barney, and the Warhawks main feature.

name: Roll'em Show'em
description:
ROLL’EM SHOW’EM is a fun and exciting game of Strategy, Challenge, Skill, Will, Luck and Love. Wherein, the players advance in the game by complying to a variety of twists and tasks. They range anywhere from kissing an opposing player, having to remove an article of clothing or having to place a dividend of money into the pot for the winner in the end and much more.

The Tasks are given in means by either from the results of the thrown colored Blue and White Dies, The Big Black Task Die, the ROLL’EM SHOW’EM Task Deck of Cards, or by a command from an opposing participating player. By the way the winner of the game is the person who just happens to be the last player standing with either clothing left on, or money left in hand.

ROLL’EM SHOW’EM is a game that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Oh and by the way, keep your eyes wide open as well, you aren’t going to want to miss anything.

ROLL’EM SHOW’EM is designed and created with adult content, and it is intended to be played by Adults, with 2-12 players. So, in a game it could be just you and that special someone, or you can have a group of friends at a party, either way you are sure to have a BLAST!! OH YEAH.

name: Blow! Bugles! Blow!
description:
Blow! Bugles! Blow! is a set of six scenarios for Jolly Roger's A Nation on Trial rules: First Manassas, Shiloh, Second Manassas, Antietam, Fredericksburg, and Chancellorsville. Each scenario includes a battle map, order of battle, and scenario special rules.

One interesting feature of the scenario maps is that there are no units shown. Players could, for example, scan the maps, print them out, and play on them. The scale is 9" = 1 mile (approx. 1"=200 yds.).

Expands:

A Nation on Trial
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Six Gun Assassins
description:
Grab your Guns, the Wild West is about to get Wilder! Welcome to the World of Six-Gun Assassins, a fast play, rip roaring gunslingin’ good time! Easy to learn and fun to play, Six-Gun Assassins has something for everyone!

Rebel Minis' Place & Play rules make it easy to live out your wild west adventures, grab your favorite figs, git on your horse and start raising a ruckus. Create your own scenarios with these core rules or try your hand that some of the scenarios provided.

Six-Gun Assassins has it all, so Saddle up outlaws there's some gun fighting to be had.

17 pages

name: The Driving Spirit Safety Game
description:
Players answer trivia questions, mostly about Alfa Romeo. The person to answer correctly wins the card. Each card has a letter a letter on it (M,I,L,A,N or O). The first person to spell out "MILANO" (home of the game's maker) wins.

Game Contents:
Playing board
1 die
4 markers 64 cards- 10 each M,I,L,A,N,O
4 blanks
Instructions

name: Die kleine Maus
description:
Rummy Game for 3 of more players.

32 cards.

Object of the game
To collect and lay in front of you as many sets of 4 matching cards as possible. A quartet is made up of 4 cards with the same symbols or the same numbers.

The cards, illustrated by Helmut Spanner, show pictures of cute little mice playing with objects from around the home.

name: Birth of A Nation American Civil War Rules
description:
A set of medium to large scale wargames rules for the American Civil War period 1861 to 1865.

Units are organized into Brigades and commanded at Divisional level for the Confederation and at Corp level for the Union.

A very simple command ordering system allows a fast flowing game to unfold right before your eyes. This is achieved through a command structure where commanders must keep their troops motivated or their formation and army morale may crumble. Control of the battle is achieved through a series of morale checks; these are effortless and give extremely good historical results. You may find your units running for cover when you least desire it, then find that they return with a new resolve and vigor for the fight.

These rules are capable of reproducing all the major battles of the American Civil War from Bull Run 21st July 1861 through to Parnetto Ranche 13th May 1865.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Colmo
description:
The board is the outer 5 concentric rings of a 14x14 square grid, with the middle 4x4 area out of play. The rings are partially separated by walls. Each player has 10 pieces, 2 each that can move 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 spaces.

Players compete to be the first to score 11 points by completing widdershin circuits of the board and/or capturing opposing pieces. Pieces may turn corners and pass through gaps in the walls between rings to take shorter paths, and may pass over linear groups of connected pieces (considering the whole group as one space in the movement), but may not move backwards more than a quarter of the distance around the board from their starting points and may not occupy the same space more than once during the same move. Opposing pieces that are not part of a linked group may be captured by displacement.

United Kingdom of Great Britain Patent GB9520980.5, applied 13 October 1995, granted 7 July 1999.

name: Oilfield's Car Quiz
description: Oilfield’s Car Quiz is the all-new automotive trivia game which explores the history of the automobile from the development of the Model-T to the American muscle car! Here opponents compete as they test their classic car knowledge while playing Oilfield’s unique 30-mile racing board game, or by playing against the competitive and challenging score card system!

name: Political Favours
description:
From the rulebook:

Political Favours is a board game for social interaction. In order for a backbencher (ordinary member) to rise up the greasy pole, using favors, deal-making, pay-backs and pork-barreling to both advance and secure their position.

Political Favours is based on skill, chance, strategy, tactics, duplicity, greed and ambition - all the elements necessary to climb up the greasy pole.

The object of the game, and the winner, is the player who can accumulate the greatest number of Favour Tokens. If at the end of the game (or allocated time) there are two or more players with the same number of Tokens, then the amount of cash each player has determines the result.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Flip-ball
description:
A children's dexterity game slightly reminiscent of skee-ball, only you use a small metal catapult to launch the ball instead of one's own hand. A cardboard insert remains in the box to collect low-scoring tosses (ones which don't go through the clown's holes). Another piece of cardboard folds over and stands upright, creating a vertical target.

Points are scored depending on the point value of the hole the ball goes through. First shooter to reach 1000 points is the winner. Original price $1.00. Stands out due to colorful, wacky 60s artwork and type usage, and for the clown actually being not-creepy.

name: Le Jeu de Jet
description:
Truly like no other board game; like nothing else around, above, below or underneath, Le Jeu de Jet is a Battle game for 2 players fought over a number of Rounds between their Houses where the winner is the player who takes "prisoner" all of their opponents set of 18 pieces, called Woods.

Taking turns, players choose Woods from their Maison table then shake them in their hand, or in a cup, & then throw them down into the Battle circle. These are now divided according to how they land, to be secretly built (stacked) into Houses in whatever way the player chooses ready for Battle; & that's when the real fun begins! Recommended Ages 9+

name: Flight
description:
This is a simple but addictive 2 to 4 players race game (no dice are used) where the players ’fly’ their men across the board, racing to be the first to bear off all his men from the board.

In this game the players men are called Merels.

If you jump your opponent’s Merels, you go again; If you jump your own Merels, then you go again! So fly across the board in a single strike, or block & wait for a better opportunity in this multi-color, multi-level, multi-player race game! Recommended Ages 7+

name: Kenshin vs Shingen: Battle of Kawanakajima
description:
This game simulates the clash between Takeda Shingen and Uesugi Kenshin that took place near the Kawanakajima plains on September 10th, 1561 (1561 being Eiroku 4 in the calendar system of the time). This was the 4th, and greatest (yet still inconclusive) of the battles of Kawanakajima.

Many previous wargames use luck of the dice to determine the results of combat, but this game instead has players choose one of their combat cards, numbered 1-6, to resolve battles. Because of this, victory is determined not by the 'random factor' of one's luck with dice, but with 'reading and bluffing'.

name: Hundred Days Campaign
description:
This game covers Napoleon at Waterloo.

Many previous wargames use luck of the dice to determine the results of combat, but this game instead has players choose one of their combat cards, with modifiers equivalent to dice rolling, to resolve battles. Because of this, victory is determined not by the 'random factor' of one's luck with dice, but with 'reading and bluffing'.

name: Die Nasionale Kruger-Wildtuin
description: In Die Nasionale Kruger-Wildtuin (aka The Kruger National Park) players take a tour of the Kruger National Park in South Africa, where the object is take photographs of as many animals as possible before visiting your three campsites and exiting the park.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Word In Progress
description: Word in Progress is a sort of word game which turns the methodology of building complete words, as is found in word games such as Scrabble or Boggle, on its head. In Word in Progress, players must work together to build partial words without being the player to complete an actual word, all the while attempting to discard as many of their respective points (letters) as possible before being eliminated from the round of play.

name: Goola
description:
Goola is a advanced adaptation of "Connect Four" with some twists. Players alternately drop one of their twenty "Goola" beads into one of the five slots in the Goola Tower trying to form a line of 4 or 5 beads of their color in order to accumulate points (1 point for a line of 4 and 2 points for a line of 5). The twist here is that scoring only happens after all the beads are placed. After the initial placement, each player then alternately operate one of the five mechanic valves at the bottom of the tower under each slot to make the beads drop one by one out the bottom of the tower. After each bead drops out, each player count all the points they get for forming lines of 4 or 5 beads of the same color. The player with the higher points scores the difference in points on the scoreboard. The first player to reach 8 points on the scoreboard wins. A further twist can be found in the blind-play option built in the Goola Tower. This advance play is similar to the basic game except that the bead placement is shielded from the players' sight, and the players must reply on memory to calculate where to place their beads. After all the beads are played, the lock mechanism is released allowing the beads to drop into sight and the game continues as normal.

Game components:
40 Goola beads in two colors
1 Goola tower
1 Tower base with scoreboard
2 Goola stickers
1 Rulebook

name: ABC Lotto
description:
One child alone will enjoy playing the game as a puzzle by trying to match up the small cards with the pictures on the boards. This type of play will help develop one of the basic skills necessary in learning to read.

FOR GROUP PLAY... each child takes one of the boards. The small cards are mixed up thoroughly and placed face down in the middle of the table.

The child to the left of the one who mixed the cards is the first to go and picks any card in the pile. If the card matches a section of his board, he places it over the matching illustration and has the privilege of picking the next cards also. This same player continues to pick cards until he reaches on that does not match his board. If one of the other players needs this card, he calls for it and also continues to pick and match as did the previous player. If no one needs the card picked, it is turned face down again and the child to the left of the last player is the next to go.

The play continues around the group until one child has all the sections of his board covered with the matching cards and is declared the winner.

Before playing a new game the boards are interchanged among the players.

name: Troy
description:
For 2 to 4 players played on the intersections of the board where the winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game.

In this game the players men are called Sheckles.

With all of the Sheckle belonging to all of the players you play with as many Sheckles as you like to make a set, then play with as many sets as you like to build your armies. Troy is played in ‘waves’, with points scored by catch-trapping Sheckles that are ‘in-play’ which, if not saved, make up that players next wave; So although saving is not obligatory you’ll soon regret it if you don't! Enjoy. Recommended Ages 9+

name: Die vier Jahreszeiten
description: "The Four Seasons" is a simple children's set-collection game. Twenty-eight wooden tiles with illustrations of scenes from the four seasons are arranged into a square of five on a side with the remaining tiles forming a pile in the center. Four "season children", each in a different color representing one of the seasons, are placed on the track. Players try to collect one card from each of the seasons by moving any one of the four children the number shown on the die. If a child lands on a season tile of the same color that player may keep it. The first player to collect one tile from each season wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Slumber Party
description:
One in a series of sixteen Flipsiders games designed to resemble pastel colored audio cassettes. The game contained a metal gameboard that would flip out with the snap of the wrist. A storage compartment at the top of the game would hold the magnetic pawns. A spring-loaded switch would spin the wheels of the cassette to generate random numbers and events during play. The game would hang from a blister pack on display at the store.

Every time you hit your opponent she gets closer to bedtime. The object is to stall bedtime as long as possible.

name: Caterpillar Causeway
description:
One in a series of sixteen Flipsiders games designed to resemble pastel colored audio cassettes. The game contained a metal gameboard that would flip out with the snap of the wrist. A storage compartment at the top of the game would hold the magnetic pawns. A spring-loaded switch would spin the wheels of the cassette to generate random numbers and events during play. The game would hang from a blister pack on display at the store.

Chute and Ladders (AKA Snakes and Ladders) adapted to fit the Flipsiders format.

name: Prized Pony
description:
One in a series of sixteen Flipsiders games designed to resemble pastel colored audio cassettes. The game contained a metal gameboard that would flip out with the snap of the wrist. A storage compartment at the top of the game would hold the magnetic pawns. A spring-loaded switch would spin the wheels of the cassette to generate random numbers and events during play. The game would hang from a blister pack on display at the store.

Players take turns using the right spinner to advance their board marker. When a player reaches a jump, the player must use the left spinner to determine if the jump is successful. The winner is the first player to complete all four rounds of the steeplechase.

name: Sweet and Sour: The Chinese Restaurant Game
description: A dexterity game that requires the players to use chopsticks to move small pieces around.

name: BWAH!: Gorram Plans
description:
Expansion for BWAH!! the BANG!! based card game set in the "Firefly" Universe. This expansion allows for up to 11 players as well as contains options rules and Episode cards based on the different episodes of the show. These cards have a wide range of effects. Optional rules include cards based on the shows gag reel, its cancellation by Fox and its movie deal. Rules for a 2 or 3 person game are included as well.

Expands:

BWAH!

name: BWAH!: Local Color
description:
Another expansion for BWAH!! which is based on the game BANG!! set in the "Firefly" Universe. This one includes 18 new characters and 18 new actions cards as well as rule and card clarification.

Expands:

BWAH!

name: BWAH!: This Land
description:
A very small expansion for BWAH!! which is based on the game BANG!! but set in the "Firefly" universe. Based on a short bit by one character in the first episode of the show this set add 3 characters, 2 are plastic dinos and the other is a new Wash card. Also there are a 2 new action cards, a new location and a new episode card.

Expands:

BWAH!

name: Mississippi -- The Speed Boat Race
description: A simple spin and move game on the Mississippi River. The speedboat pieces are kind of nice, but the massive, upright roulette style spinner is the highlight of the game.

name: Wildlife Bingo Game
description:
The first matching game using wildlife photos which were taken directly from DK's best selling children's books.

Classic bingo is only one of the variations which are described in the rules pamphlet, as young players are challenged to work on matching, sorting, and language skills

A perfect first game for the children...

name: Stargo
description:
From the Rules of Play:

STARGO is a fun and engaging way to introduce kids to the basic concepts of stars, galaxies and constellations. There are two ways to play, and both are based on Bingo. Version "A" uses basic number and color concepts as players search for stars on one constellation. Version "B" uses basic visual and memory skills as players enjoy traditional Bingo on a grid featuring 24 constellations.



Version A:

There are 30 large glossy cards, each featuring a constellation with numbered, colored stars (that glow in the dark!). Each player selects one. Colored and numbered stars are selected from the bag and called -- first to complete his constellation wins.

Version B:

On the flip side of the constellation cards is a traditional Bingo grid of constellations. Constellations are selected from a deck (each has information about that constellation on the back). First to complete five in a row wins.



The constellation cards feature glow in the dark stars and an orienting arrow. Combined with the included compass, they can be used to help find those constellations in the night sky. The smaller cards contain facts about the constellations and the stars within them. The rulebook also contains information about stargazing.

name: Agribizz
description: Players begin with 4,000 dollars and have the chance to make a fortune or go broke by investing in farms and farm related businesses. A property can be purchased only by landing on it and each time a player must decide whether to invest his limited funds or to hope for something better among the 28 farms and 9 businesses available along the track. Cheaper properties are easier to develop but have a smaller payoff when landed on by an opponent. (just like Monopoly). Another decision must be made regarding the 3 different kinds of crops that may be planted on each farm. Again cheaper pays off sooner but in smaller amounts. Once the crop is in a player can add farm equipment in the form of plastic "silo sections" which are piled in strict color sequence. Limited quantities of the best crops and the highest silo section adds to the decision making process. A player may mortgage a property to pay debt or to make other investments and can still collect 10% of his normal fee from a visiting opponent. Other features include taxes, becoming incorporated, luck cards which can be disastrous, selling properties to an opponent or the treasury.

name: Scrabble Junior: Wildlife
description:
From Dr. Toy

"This game incorporates the traditional Scrabble Jr. game, but is played like a crossword puzzle, featuring baby animals and wildlife found in National Parks. Kid-sized words and colorful pictures of animals make it fun to match letter tiles to words on two playful crossword grids. One side features wildlife, while the other side features the environment included is an endangered animal coloring book featuring facts about endangered wildlife."
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Zodiac Match
description: This game features 96 "domino" tiles, consisting of different pairings of the 12 zodiac symbols. Each symbol appears red and black. Twelve of the tiles have stars at one end and are "wild". 2 to 4 players play, each using a rack of 6 tiles. Tiles can be placed anywhere in the layout provided that they match the same symbol in opposite color of at least one face that has been previously played. Notches on the tiles help keep the layout securely in place. The score for a play depends on the number of matches which, in rare cases, can be as many as 6. If a player can make a match on at least one face of his tile he may play a second or third and so on up to all 6 tiles from his hand. Play ends when, after all the tiles have been drawn a player clears his rack, earning a bonus. High score wins

name: Toccato
description: Toccato is a 3-D abstract game that uses 12 poly-forms that can be made into a cube. Players must place and remove the stones to score in specific patterns.

name: Riegel
description:
Riegel, which was designed by Paul Schobesberger (Austria), is an abstract game played on wooden board with 10 rows of sliders. Each row has depressions to hold marbles. Each player is trying to get their set of marbles from one side of the board to the other, but can only move onto certain depressions and thus the sliders must be positioned properly for movement. Made by Felsberger in the same high quality as their other games.

It is not an abstract strategy game since the moves are decided by dice according to http://toy-net.ch/felsberger/spielregeln/riegel.htm .

name: Felsberger Nuggets
description: Felsberger Nuggets in an abstract game made in the same high quality wooden format as the rest of the Felsberger lineup. The game uses four colored turntables each housing up to four marbles, and players must rotate the turntables to make color matches to remove the marbles.

name: Weltkonferenz
description:
The wife of the French President is found dead in her room. Who killed her?

All players (6 male, 3 female (+ 1 m/f)) should act out their roles to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer.

name: Mord im Leuchtturm
description:
Frank Mohn was found dead in this room. Who of the other hotel gusts knows more that the others?

All players (7 male, 4 female (+ 1 m/f)) should act out their roles to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer

name: WIM
description:
"the every which way word game" (tm)

Players compete to score the most points by forming interlocking words in all directions, using square letter tiles, most of which can be used in more than one direction or as more than one letter.

WIM consists of 96 letter tiles, tile racks, and a letter bag. There is no board.

There are 19 distinct tiles which make the 26 letters plus the blank tile. Eight of the tiles are ambiguous and can be read as two different letters, depending on orientation. For example, an upside-down A is a V, and a sideways N is a Z. Three of the tiles may be used as the same letter in more than one orientation (O, S, and X). A tile may be used as different letters in different words at the same time, even in the same play.

Each letter has a different value and scores are calculated according to the letter played. Players receive bonuses for using a previously-played tile as a letter it wasn't used as previously, for changing the orientation of a word, or for using all seven tiles on their rack in a single play.

Home Page: http://www.puzzazz.com/wim

name: Seven Horses of the Redfly Sacred Circle
description: This unique product will help your child to develop a respect for and understanding of Native American life. Contents include a carrying pouch, seven horses of the RedFly Sacred Circle game, colored paper, twelve star stones, one medicine wheel, numerical playing cards, instruction sheet and other pieces. Collect one of each colored teepee place cards as you travel around the Red Fly Sacred Circle. It is a cooperative game. The game is completed as a team effort with all players participating. The game ends when the last star stone is placed.

name: Toads of Fun
description: Players move their toads around the lily pond catching flies based on matching a color and a number on the spinner to the same color and number on the lily pads. Analytical thinking skills are used when players control the bumblebee and get to consider different possible places to put the bee and what consequence each possible choice might have. This game includes six toads, 36 flies, one bee, and a board with two spinners, game board showing pond with lily pads, SPLASH spots and logs.

name: Felsberger Tara
description: Tara is the newest Felsberger game and follows in their tradition of well-made wooden dexterity games. The games uses a color-sided die used to select pieces that are manipulated on the playing surface. A blend of strategy and dexterity.

name: A History of Chess
description:
H.J.R. Murray's classic work on the history of chess includes chess variants from around the world and throughout history.

Originally published in 1913, it was recently reprinted and is now available again.

Contains history, development and the rules of nearly every Chess variant prior to 1900. A Classic!

Republished by Oxford University Press (available from Amazon et al)

name: High Iron
description: High Iron is a very early Winsome game with an extremely limited print run. It is Colorado-based train game with idea that were further and better developed in later Winsome titles.

name: Gametasia
description: GAMETASIA CARDS 71 boxed cards featuring 47 Extractors, 9 Utopians, 9 Treasure Cards, and 6 Rules Cards. 2 to 4 players.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Party Game

name: Flip & Flop
description:
The board is 8x8 in size and every player has 4 playing pieces. Object of the game is to move 2 of the 4 pieces on the opposing side of the board.

The name of the game comes from the moving mechanism of the playing pieces: they can move 1 field in all 4 directions, but they are flipped over every time when they move (I guess they "flop" when moving to the left or right side).

All playing pieces are numbered from 1-4 on one side and from 5-8 on the other side. Since the pieces are always flipped over, the value of the pieces is changing with every move and it needs much thinking in advance to find the best moves.

Another problem is, that the pieces should always look in the same direction. To assure this, each piece has 2 dots on the front and 2 on the back, but when comparing the pieces on the game-box with the ones included with this game, it is obvious, that this designing problem is not solved very well.

name: Chuckers
description: Each player's side of the board consists of 9 panels in a 3x3 grid which all start as one player's color (orange or yellow) but become the other player's color when the panel is flipped. This can be done by landing a marble on a panel, causing the panel to flip and change color. Players attempt to get 6 panels in a row of their color by quickly and repeatedly launching marbles onto the game board.

name: Action Dragon
description:
This is a game of sentence construction "cunningly educational!"

The object of the game is to reach the "circle 9" by discarding all his cards. Players advance on the board by making sentences with the Action Dragon cards.

How to play:
Each players draws a card when on their turn, to advance, the player must set on the table a series of cards that contain at least the number of cards indicated on the next circle you want to reach. This series must also include at least one card of each of the colors indicated by the triangles on the next circle. The series of cards (image) makes up a sentence that the player must say out loud.

There is a variant for youngsters.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Humor

name: The Fund-Raising Game
description:
snip from rules:

"Object: The object of this game is to set a fund raising goal and raise that amount of money. There are intervening factors, such as luck and timing, that will affect the raising of your dollar goal. However, the bottom line is cash on hand.
The game is not intended to be competitive. The main objective is to provide discussion among players on various aspects of fund raising."

The game consists of a game board, 4 tokens, 2 dice, 25 each of Risk and Opportunity cards, a pack of Fund raising Goal and Funds Balance cards, play money, Rules booklet and ANSWER KEY.

Yes, ANSWER KEY! Basically, this is a game designed to teach fund raising skills to young 'wannabe' fund raisers. So the cards have real questions on them. For instance, "15. To generate significantly more income from mail appeals, a priority would be to . . . A. Mail more times in a year B. use segmentation data to specialize appeals. C. purge lapsed donors to trim your mailing expenses."

And in case you really wanted to know, according to the answer key, the answer is . . . B
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Alphacadabra
description: Try to locate the hidden word of your opponent, as in a game of Battleship. Then try to find what is that word by naming letters, as in a game of Hangman.

name: Champion of the East
description:
Also known as 'Conquerors of the Eastern Country'.

A 2-6 player game set in feudal Eastern Japan(2-12 players if combined with Heroes of Western Japan).

Meant to appeal to fans of the many feudal multi-player games that came out in the 80s in Japan and of 'eurogame' fans wanting something quicker.

It ends up playing like a fast-paced 'History of the World'. Not in the 'multiple epoch' sense (the game does not cover multiple eras), but in the sense that attacks are done by 'expanding out' and attacking adjacent territories with newly hired units, and a placed unit is never actually moved.

Each player controls a different daimyo, each having tis own unique (and fairly important / useful) power.

There is a deck of Fate cards that give valuable bonuses and abilities to the players that get them. Players bid each turn on the right to get 1st pick of the available cards that turn.

Money is received from territories, varying in value from 1 to 3 per territory.
Gold is spent buying the 3 main types of armies can be hired to attack with, bidding for card choice, and paying to maintain the effects of 'continuing cards'

Victory is done by getting a point per territory held at the end of the game, with bonus points (or penalties) given for tea bowls placed in various territories throughout the game. The catch is that only the player who placed each tea bowl knows its value (and thereby, how important it is to get/retain control of that territory).

It's a DTP game, meaning that you need to stick the counters on your own blank counters.

This can be combined with Heroes of Western Japan to get a larger game covering all of Japan.
mechanics: Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes of Western Japan
description:
Also known as 'Heroes of the Western Country'.

A 2-6 player game set in feudal Western Japan (2-12 players if combined with Champion of the East).

Meant to appeal to fans of the many feudal multiplayer games that came out in the 80's in Japan and of 'eurogame' fans wanting something quicker.

It ends up playing like a fast-paced 'History of the World'. Not in the 'multiple epoch' sense (the game does not cover multiple eras), but in the sense that attacks are done by 'expanding out' and attacking adjacent territories with newly hired units, and a placed unit is never actually moved.

Each player controls a different daimyo, each having tis own unique (and fairly important / useful) power.

There is a deck of Fate cards that give valuable bonuses and abilities to the players that get them. Players bid each turn on the right to get 1st pick of the available cards that turn.

Money is received from territories, varying in value from 1 to 3 per territory.
Gold is spent buying the 3 main types of armies can be hired to attack with, bidding for card choice, and paying to maintain the effects of 'continuing cards'

Victory is done by getting a point per territory held at the end of the game, with bonus points (or penalties) given for tea bowls placed in various territories throughout the game. The catch is that only the player who placed each teabowl knows its value (and thereby, how important it is to get/retain control fo that territory).

It's a DTP game, meaning that you need to stick the counters on your own blank counters.

This can be combined with Champion of the East to get a larger game covering all of Japan.
mechanics: Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Flibid-e-Jib
description:
What's a Flib? What's a Jib? And why am I trying to lose all my cards again!

Flibid-e-Jib is the wacky new card game that's not only hours of fun for the whole family, but educational too! (sshh! Don't tell the kids!)

For 2-6 players age 7 and up, Flibid-e-Jib is an addictive way to make a rainy day go by quickly! Perfect for the cottage or trip.

Instructions in French and Spanish.

name: About Nothing
description:
About Nothing, The Absurd Game of Useless Trivia is the latest game from Brainy Day Games.

Here's some of the nothing you'll find inside:
- Absurd World Facts
- History of Plumbing
- 80's Cartoons
- Ancient Sports
- Crazy Inventors
- Fast Food Facts
- Sesame Street Trivia
- Word Origins
- Parts of the Body
- Elvis Knowledge

1800 Questions.
2-6 Players.
For ages 7 and up.
Lots of useless trivia.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia, Word Game

name: Housebuilder
description: The Housebuilder game is based on the reality of house building. 2-4 players may play. All players start with a 10,000 pound overdraft limit. From "Start" proceed along the board, in turn, collecting money to buy building plots and stage build your own home. Each time you pass "Start" you should select a "Builders Credit" card from the pile and collect the amount stated on the card. The first player to successfully complete a house wins the game.

name: Saxon Shore
description:
Saxon Shore simulates the warfare and politics of Britain after the Roman withdrawal in the fifth century AD. This was a time where the local Britons were beleaguered by waves of settlers from Ireland, Scotland, Scandinavia, and the European mainland. These settlers fought the Britons and one another in an attempt to establish permanent kingdoms. It was a time of economic breakdown, when the Roman coinage was replaced with a system of barter, and also a time of spiritual confusion, with the Christian church coming to dominance in an age of superstition and violence.

In Saxon Shore, two to five players struggle to become the dominant kingdom of the British Isles. A player can win by fulfilling one of several victory conditions:

1. Eliminate all other players.
2. Build four cities.
3. Control eight provinces producing resources.
4. Control any ten provinces.

name: Blackout
description: This abstract game includes 6 colored wooden discs and 6 black caps. One player hides the disks and moves things around, the other must note what has changed. This is a simple memory game with some variant options to make it more challenging for adults.

name: Tip-Top
description:
Whose turn is it to do the dishes today?
Who will take down the trash?
Who will pay for the next round?
Who is calling the mother-in-law?

Play Tip-Top to decide all of these important questions in your daily life — or compete solely for fun, of course! Each player has a pair of shoes, and starting from a distance of the players' choice, they move toward one another turn by turn, heel to toe, the distance becoming smaller with each step. Crossing your feet is fine, but cheating is prohibited! Whoever fits in the last gap wins. The loser has to...well, what was the challenge again?

name: Top
description:
More wooden fun from Steffen Spiele.

Top is a fun dexterity game where players try to trap the stick with a paddle before it drops. It sounds easier than it is, and with varying length sticks the challenge gets greater.

name: Fuchsen & Mausen
description: A first - a Steffen-Spiele game made of leather instead of wood! This is a dexterity game where players flick disks of various colored leather to try to reach certain targets.

name: Dumy Rumy
description: DUMY RUMY is a great party game and lots of fun the whole family, too. It combines equal parts of skill and luck, courage and cunning... makes addicts out of players in a single session.

name: Burn Out!
description:
Experience for yourself those "Happy Days" of roller skatin' drive in's, rock 'n' roll music, burgers - fries - malts, and best of all...impressin' your best gal and your best pals... just you and your souped-up, tricked out, really boss, totally cool, smmmoookkkinnn'...Hot Rod Car.

The legacy of America's Happy Days of Hot Rod muscle cars lives on as you and your friends run race after thrilling race. A time when 400 H.P. and smokin' tires were the "rules of the Street".

Remember to buckle-up and hang on...you're in for the ride of your life.

name: Wrestling Madness
description:
From the publisher's website:

Wrestling Madness is a wrestling board game for 2-6 players; ages 8 to adult. In an arena where only the toughest survive and the heroes are made of steel, watching is the next best thing to being in the ring. Until now! If you think you have what it takes to join the ranks of Wrestling's very best, then it is time to join the Madness. Wrestling Madness. A wrestling board game where you claw your way through the ranks of the professional wrestling circuit by wrestling tough opponents and earning cash. Travel the mad Wrestling circuit earning money and wrestling your way to the top of the wrestling world. You must earn $100,000 before getting the chance to take on the mad Wrestling Federation's Champion. The first player to defeat this champion is the new mad Wrestling champion of the world and Winner of this exciting wrestling board game.

name: Equazzle
description:
From the publisher's website:

Ages 5+. An educational award winner, Equazzle successfully combines what kids think are total opposites: Math and Fun! The 5 to 8-year-old plays Equazzle using the addition and subtraction side of the board, while the reverse side reinforces multiplication skills and introduces negative numbers to the 8+ set. The playing pieces can be used as a perpetual puzzle for youngsters starting as early as age 3.

name: Mitzvah Match
description: Match the Mitzvah cards and win! No reading required. For 1-4 players ages 4-10.

name: Showtime Presents: The Great Cable Challenge
description:
Showtime Presents: the great Cable Challenge. The Exciting New Game That Tests Your Skill (And Luck) As A Cable TV Operator!

OBJECTIVE:

Players take turns rolling a die and moving along the spaces on the board from "Franchise Hearing" to "Launch" then on to "Success" to win the game.

Players landing upon "Cable Break" spaces must draw a cable break card and immediately carry out it's instructions. Some of these are to be used only after "Launch". Upon landing on any of the four red spaces, a player must stop and end his or her turn. At his or her next turn, the direction that the
Player must take will be determined by the roll.

On the last red space on the board a player must stop and then, on each subsequent turn, roll the die continuously until reaching a combined total of 7 or 11. If 11 is exceeded the Player must wait until his or her next turn to try again. The first Player to reach the "Success" circle with no Cable Break Cards in his possession has met the Cable Challenge and wins the Game.

name: Pompiers! A Vos Lances!
description:
The building is on fire! Don't waste any time. Send your team of firefighters to the rescue! Cover the highest number of windows, balconies and doors in order to save the maximum number of people, animals and objects.
A game for ages 6 and up.

L'immeuble est en flamme ! Ne perdez pas de temps. Préparez votre équipe de pompiers pour entreprendre le sauvetage. Accédez au plus grand nombre de fenêtres, balcons et portes pour sauver de l'incendie le maximum de personnes, d'animaux et d'objets.
Pour les 6 ans et plus.

name: Leap
description: Rules are provided for five jumping and number games, four categories of jumping and number puzzles to play on the 6x6 grid. Activities with chess knights' moves and magic squares are especially interesting. A major section is devoted to Wade Philpott's "Leap Solitaire," cited in Oxford University Press' The Ins and Outs of Peg Solitaire. The 36 numbered pieces reverse to blank checkers.

name: Dezign-8
description: This concept was created 40 years ago by an architect, Bill Briggs. The original tile patterns are expanded from four to the full eight. Every combination of 1, 2, 3 and 4 paths exiting from a square, with enough multiples in a strategic mix, allows the creation of the most intricate designs. All you have to do is match the paths. A strange fact — no matter how you connect the paths, the number of separate groups will always equal the number of closed loops formed. The laser-cut, hand-inlaid acrylic tiles are framed so the 14" set can be displayed on its easel as an ever-changing work of art.

name: Poly-5
description: Nominated for the Games 100, All the shapes of 1 through 5 squares in size (polyominoes orders 1 through 5) fill a 6" tray. The multi-colored laser cut acrylic pieces serve for six games and hundreds of other puzzle shapes, as shown in the included 52-page handbook.

name: Cube Brick
description: On Games 100 list for 2003. Fifteen unique color-patterned cubes: drawing on 6 colors, each cube has a unique combination of 4 colors on its 2x2 faces. Each cube face has a different arrangement of its four colors. So there are 90 all-different faces. A wealth of figures to solve by matching the cube edges, plus super challenges of 3-D shapes with non-matched solutions. Games for beginners and experts are included.

name: Post-Time: A Horse Racing Game of Chance
description: A game of horse racing where players are attempting to amass the greatest amount of money.

name: Horsemen
description: Game about harness racing where players are trying to amass money by purchasing and then racing horses.

name: Hot Rod: The Sport Car Race
description: A very simple race game played on a roll out mat. While the playing pieces are nice, the most impressive piece of equipment is the massive upright, roulette wheel style spinner.

name: Giant Wheel Thrills 'n' Spills Horse Race Game
description: A steeplechase game played on a roll out map. The centerpiece of the game is the giant, roulette wheel style, upright spinner that is used to determine movement.

name: Show Jumping Trials
description:
Show Jumping Trials is a unique board game where players try to complete the course over the fences, jumps, and water jump, against the timer using an 8 sided die and a 6 sided die. When they have mastered that, they then try to complete the course while picking up the fewest faults.

The basic gameboard is a 12x12 grid.

name: Sheep-dog Trials
description: Sheep-dog Trials is a compact and unique little boardgame (using a 12x12 grid playing area) where players are competing with each other and a timer. Each player attempts to round up as many sheep as possible against the clock - whilst the sheep attempt to keep out of the dog's reach. The sheep can jump the fences but the dog must go through the gate! Then the roles are reversed!

name: Fairies and Rainbows
description: Fairies and Rainbows is a simple but enjoyable game for anyone who loves fairies. Try to collect the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow, but watch out for the goblins!

name: Teddy Bear and Friends
description: Teddy Bear and Friends, 100 years after the creation of the first Teddy Bear comes a new game from Shannon Boardgames that celebrates their favorite pastime, picnics! The object of the game is to try and collect the perfect picnic. Beware though as you must always keep your eye on your hamper as other Players attempt to steal your collection. "Teddy Bear and Friends" is a game that will delight both children and adults alike.

name: I-Spy
description:
I Spy! is a unique travel board game that can be enjoyed by anyone to while away the journey. The game is fun and easy to play. Players have to remain focused on the game and their surroundings to win. The unique game format ensures that your surroundings and your concentration (and a bit of luck!) will decide the winner.

If you want a bit of peace and quiet on your journey -- stay at home. But if you want to make the journey more bearable, then this is the game for you!

name: Planetarium
description: "Planetarium" is a beautifully illustrated game based on the night sky, where players have to move around the board trying to connect a string of colored constellations before their opponents do.

name: Clans and Tartans of Scotland
description: In each pack are sixty cards forming ten stunning images of Scottish Highlanders in full regalia with the Clan Tartan, Clan Crest and each Highlander complete with a brief history of their Clan. This gift can be played as a game (and it's quite a challenge!) or simply be pieced together for your visual enjoyment.

name: Property Tycoon
