If two geese meet, one has to follow the orders from the backside of the card, the other must go back to the card where the first goose came from. The player wins, whose goose first passes the last card of the spiral.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: All About Savannah
description: An exciting game for all ages about Savannah! Also includes $100 worth of coupons for local businesses!
publishers: All About Town, Inc., Windsor Publications

name: The 3 Stooges Fun House
description:
This is a children's game with a 3-D board (when the cardboard is properly assembled). The most prominent part of the board is the large slide along one side of the board.

From the box:
"Side Splitting Hi-Jinks with The 3 STOOGES in a Real Zany Fun House!"
categories: Children's Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Domorino
description:
Domorino is a color recognition and strategy game. Children create their own set of Dominoes using colored chips and domino frames and think more strategically. The first person who places all of his colored chips wins.

Age: 4+

name: Scoot!
description:
Scoot is a children's spin-and-move game. Featuring smiling children on the cover, the gameboard is a yard with a winding sidewalk up to the front door of a house. The house stands up for a 3-d game board.

Scoot on home now!

From the front cover:
"New! Fast! Different! Exciting! Fun!"

name: Cowboy Riders and Indians
description:
"COWBOY RIDERS AND INDIANS" is as fresh and exciting as a ride across the Western plains. A brightly dec. orated metal wheel spins off numbers. Four "Wild West" riders move across hostile Indian country, in an effort to reach the safety of the military fort. The printed story along the trail is exciting and results are different each time it is played.

— from an advertisement

name: Little Angels and the Fruit of the Spirit
description:
Little Angels and the Fruit of the Spirit

As players move their little angels along the brightly colored path, they will be introduced to the names and meanings of all nine Fruits of the Spirit from Galatians 5:22.

name: Parts of Speech Challenge!
description:
Parts of Speech Challenge reinforces knowledge of nouns, verbs, adjectives, adverbs, prepositions, pronouns, conjunctions and interjections!
Parts of Speech Challenge helps players master the eight basic parts of speech plus verb phrases, prepositional phrases, articles, and proper nouns. Players learn how the same word can represent different parts of speech based on how it is used in a sentence.
As they move around the board, drawing cards and reading sentences, players identify the parts of speech of selected words. All words are used in sentence context for meaningful learning.
The Reference Sheet, included, allows players to familiarize themselves with the parts of speech. Younger players can use the Reference Sheet while playing the game.
The object is to cover the most spaces on the board before one player runs out of markers. The player with the highest score wins!

name: Flink
description: Flink's unique gameplay combines the fun of shuffleboard with the skill of pool! Using the "Flink sticks", players "flink" discs to be nearest the backboard. Knock your opponent off the board, into the "gutter" and out of play! The player whose disc is closest to the backboard after flinking five discs each wins that round. The player who wins five rounds first has won the game.

name: Stress Strategies
description: Players must think of solutions to the stressful situations that they meet in the game and then discuss the results. Everyone wins in Stress Strategies by listening, sharing, and accepting the feelings and responses of all the players, and by learning healthy ways to manage stress.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: What Will You Find
description: Help Pip & Pop, Tutter and Ojo find their favorite things hidden in Bear's yard. Spin to move ahead. Land on special spaces and turn over Bush tokens to see what's hidden where. Find two of your character's favorite things and reach Bear's house first to win.

name: Double Trouble
description: Each player spins to establish their color. The 24 puzzle pieces are evenly distributed. The red player starts by trying to put the puzzle together while the person on their left is trying to spin red's color. When red is spun, the player spinning tries to put the puzzle together while the person on their left tries to spin that persons color. The first player to use all of their puzzle pieces is the winner.

name: Hic!
description: Start by preparing the cheatwell punch (recipe included). Each person turns over one of their cards in front of them trying to find a match on the board between players. When a match is spotted, Snap is called. The two players who match, race to be the first to call their opponent something in the opponent's category beginning with 'A'. The winner of the Snap does not have to drink.

name: The Secret of the Bitter Sweets
description:
(From the back of the game book)

"Invite your friends for an evening of murder and mystery."

"Raquel Bust, star of stage, screen, and the occasional trashy mini-series, has been found dead in her Art Deco dressing room just moments before she was to appear on the Poughkeepsie talk show "Can We Talk?" Who killed her? It could be one of your friends -- or it could be you!"

"Included are complete instructions, invitations, name tags, aliases, complete scripts, alibis, clues, and, of course, the Hidden Solution. The hosts are as much in the dark as the guests... until the murderer is revealed!"

name: Division Down Under
description:
From the box:

"Match wits with your friends and earn points by pairing equations with their solutions. The player with the most correct pairs wins!"
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Math

name: Feel Safe
description:
From the publisher's website:

Welcome to the Department of Homeland Security shell game. Hand over your Rights and the DHS will protect you from the bad guys. Although the Department of Homeland Security cannot actually protect you from terrorists and random acts of violence, they sure can make it look like they’re doing something (or, in the face of hurricane Katrina, maybe not). A façade of security so you can feel safe (without actually being safe).

Feel Safe, The Game of Homeland Security is a satirical board game in which players start off with ten Rights (as per the Bill of Rights) and must exchange those Rights for perceived security and safety, the first player to lose or give away all of their Rights (in the name of national security) wins the game.

name: Mulle Meck: bygger ett hus
description: A Swedish roll & move game having to do with building a house. Nicely illustrated with high-quality box and board.

name: A Deadly Game of Klew
description:
Brother Parker, a game company owner, has invited six detectives to a mystery party game. Upon arriving, the detectives find their host dead and must solve his murder.

Provided in the game are instructions for the murder mystery party as well as scripts, clues, and the solution to the mystery.

name: Greetings From the Grave
description:
Players have been invited to the reading of Ms. Lotta Bux's will. They discover that she has been murdered and must discover who among them is the murderer.

Another murder mystery party game in the series by Penny and Tom Warner. Provided in the game are player scripts, clues, a list of needed props, and the solution to the murder mystery.

name: Blox-o
description: This variant of Nine Men's Morris adds "blocking" positions to the standard board. Each time a player gets three-in-a-row, he removes a piece of his opponent, but also adds a blocking pin to the line with his three-in-a-row. This block then prevents said player from making another three-in-a-row along the same line. This additional element removes some of the simplest winning patterns from the standard game. The gameboard (from 1923) includes extra spaces for the blocking pins.

name: ¡Mézclalas!
description: Mézclalas is a children's game designed to educate native speakers of Spanish, with sounds and letters. The first to make it all around the board wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Subtraction Super Safari
description: Subtraction in the Safari is an educational game, one in a series of four, that is designed to help children learn subtraction.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: Addition in the Amazon
description: Addition in the Amazon is an educational game, one in a series of four, that is designed to help children learn addition.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: Multiplication Monsters of the Deep
description:
Multiplication Monsters Of The Deep is an educational game, one in a series of four, that is designed to help children learn multiplication.

from the publisher:

Try this fast-paced card game alternative to flashcards! Players practice multiplication facts for numbers 2 through 9. Colorful illustrations add a self-checking aspect. Great for classroom activity centers or home use. Game includes 128 laminated playing cards, interesting animal facts and multilingual instruction book. For 2–4 players, grades 2–5.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: Across the Americas
description:
From the publisher:

"Trek through North, South and Central America, then cruise the Caribbean...and boost your knowledge of world geography along the way. In this self-checking game, the maps match when the answers are correct. Includes 100 laminated playing cards."

name: Mar de Sílabas
description: This game is an educational game meant for Spanish children, involving making words out of the available syllables.

name: Thomas the Tank Engine's All Aboard Alphabet
description: All of the track letter cards are dealt out. The player with the letter A card starts by placing the card down and says "Thomas picks up an ____" and says one of the pictures on the card. The player with B follows and so on. Cards can also be used to teach the alphabet to younger children.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trains

name: Griddly Headz Football Game
description:
One of seven in the line of Griddly Headz Boardgames, Football sees a different cast of “Griddly Headz” (regular Joes) duking it out on the gridiron for ultimate supremacy.

Played on a large, two-tiered board, Griddly Headz features the chance to choose both your team and how your individual players match up against your opponent’s.

Gameplay consists of numerous dice challenges that take place when two players meet on the same play square of the board; the loser forfeits a piece of gear (represented by puzzle pieces). If a player loses all twelve pieces of gear, or one of their Griddly Headz is ejected from play, they are immediately eliminated from the game.

To win, you must score 10 touchdowns (either touchdowns or kick returns) – one point for each touchdown or kick return dice challenge won by your “regular player”, and two points for each challenge won by your “quarterback”. Points can also be gained through special cards acquired during play.

Available in Deluxe, Family, and Mini editions.

name: Pentalith
description:
Two or 4 players gather to build a monolithic tower by placing a set of unique blocks on a foundation. The first player to fail to place their block, or to think they can't place their block loses.
This game features head to head play, and team play in partnerships of 2. There are 2 sets of 24 blocks made of reclaimed wood, a base with a 5×5 grid, and two bags for each player's blocks.
The idea in placing a block is to set yourself up with as many future options as possible while trying to eliminate placement options for the opponent.
This game is an excellent tool for teaching small motor skills and spatial recognition. It can be played by children age 6 and up. It's one of those games that take 5 minutes to learn, and a lifetime to master. It offers great replayability as each game is short, and each tower you build is unique.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Team-Based Game

name: Educated Guess
description:
Object of the Game: To guess words correctly after hearing the first letter of a word, part of speech and it's definition, and to use the words in a story to score points.
Game includes three card decks of Nouns, Verbs & Adjectives, 2 special "parts of speech" dice, and a score pad.
Try collect cards by guessing the words correctly and then after gaining a certain number of cards, to then use those words in a story to gain points.

name: Board Talk
description: Board Talk is a letter-by-letter word card game that uses a board for building up one's hand. During their turns, players roll 2 dice and move around the board. The space they land on allows them to get cards (1-3), lose a card, or use a particular letter with their cards to form a word. You may end the round by calling a word if it is 4 letters or longer. Similar to gin rummy, you get the points for the word you call only if it isn't beaten by another player. If beaten, the higher player gets your points *plus* his. After the scoring, the board and cards are reset, and another round starts. The winner is the first to reach the total point goal.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Spelling

name: Heart Attack
description:
From the publisher's website: (www.heartattackgame.com)

"The board game, "HEART ATTACK,®" has been designed to serve two purposes. First, it will provide you with many hours of fun as you try to outlive your opponents by keeping yourself as healthy as possible. You will begin the game as most people begin life; with a clean bill of health. Staying healthy and risk free won't always be so easy. As the game progresses, as in life, risk factors will increase. Some are predictable, some are not. Some are good for you, some are not. You may end up in the hospital, possibly more than once. Perhaps an operation will be necessary and you may find yourself in the operating room. If successful, you continue the game. If not, you'll find yourself in the I.C.U. Many twists and turns await all the players. In any event, you'll find yourself having loads of fun as you attempt to remain healthy. Secondly, it is intended to educate all players about many of the risk factors associated with heart disease and heart attacks in an attempt to help everyone minimize their risks for having these problems. It is our belief that learning is much more effective when it's fun. Although the information presented about heart disease and heart attacks is valuable information for everyone, this game is not intended to provide medical advice to anyone. Any person who believes they are at risk for these problems, should consult a doctor for specific and individualized treatment and advice."

name: The Golden Triangle
description:
This game was developed by S. Alden Inc. in 1985 to promote Beverly Hills' Golden Triangle stores.
It features actual Beverly Hills properties, a smallish triangular board, box and cards, and high quality components: gold/silver plated metal limos and lots of nice looking money, but it cannot disguise the fact that it is simply one more roll and move Monopoly inspired board game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: One Bold Move: Battle for Tay Ninh, 1968
description:
From the website:

After the military failure of the North Vietnamese Tet offensive in January, the NVA conducted their first divisional attack in the Tay Ninh environs during a hot, monsoonal August. It was the last attempt to "spill American blood" in large quantities. Politically, the January attack was a success as the American media heavily reported it. Militarily, it had totally failed in the assigned objectives. For the August offensive, the NVA concentrated two divisions, the 5th and 9th. The 5th had grown to 15,000 men and elements of the plan called for the capture of American M113 APCs from the 10l ARVN squadron to infiltrate into the US headquarters for it's destruction. The plan also called for the divisions to be used piecemeal with the objective of killing Americans and occupying Tay Ninh City. Such an event would reap a political bonanza equal to the Tet Offensive. It was thought this would decimate US morale because War Zone C was well occupied by American troops. More important to the NVA plan was the hope that the awesome American airpower would be neutralized by the August monsoons. For the next 11 days, a hectic, fierce battle strung out the Americans and their M-48 tanks. When the NVA occupied over five city blocks of Tay Ninh, it was the worst nightmare for the US.

Game contains:
2 11x17 inch maps (which combines together)
280 counters
Player aids, charts and tables.

Scale: company and platoon level, each hex 1/2 mile, each turn one day for a total of 11 turns.

name: Idiosyncrasies
description:
The object and play of the game is simple, make your way around the game board and get to the end first. The special spinner design will tell you how many moves to take and randomly pick a Judge with every spin!
Once a Judge has been decided, and the player has moved his/her player piece the appropriate number of spaces, the Judge then picks a card and reads from the corresponding color the player lands on. The players then perform the activity on the card for the Judge, and then the Judge decides who s/he liked the best. (Remember the Judge has all the power, and can require activities be done again, if he just can't quite choose!) Those players get to move 3 free spaces on the board.

Red is Impressions
Blue is Art
Yellow is Performance

In the event that the Judge must read a Red, the players must do their best Impression of whatever is on the card. If the Judge reads an Yellow, the players must do their best Performance of whatever is on the card. When the Judge reads a Blue, the players use the sand timer and have 30 secs to Draw whatever is on the card.

By the end of game play, all players will have had the chance to Judge, show their skills in all of the categories. Hilarity results from performing the said Idiosyncrasy successfully, as well as the attempts made along the way.

The player who makes her way around the board to the end, first, wins the game. Keep in mind, Idiosyncrasies works very well with team play!
mechanics: Acting, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers, Voting
publishers: Idiosyncrasies Inc., Northern Games Co. Ltd.

name: When Titans Clash
description: Naval miniature rules for surface combat. Rules set covers the era from the Dreadnoughts of WW I through WW II on the 1/2400 scale. Rules set includes several historical scenarios and ship sheets.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Market Madne$$
description:
"Market Madne$$" the game that becomes you.

Phone Taps, Lawsuits, Tax loopholes, Political Favors, Mergers, Stocks, Lottery, Gold Bullion, Forming partnerships -- Its all here in a rare unique game with many major corporation logos -- FORD, Sony, GE, Conaco, IBM, Exxon, AT&T, ARCO.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Key to the City: A Trivia Tour of Buffalo
description:
This is a roll-and-move game where the players must answer trivia questions about the Buffalo, New York, area. There are seven "key" locations (Buffalo Zoo, Tifft Farm, etc.) where players can earn "key cards". Once four key cards have been earned, the player can proceed to City Hall, where answering a question correctly will win the game.

There are several hundred cards with two questions each.

name: Stagecoach
description: The players are Pony Express riders. They are competing against the Stagecoach Line in order to obtain a contract to carry gold shipments from the small western towns to Carson City. The players and the Stagecoach all start from the same point and move along the various trails trying to be the first to reach a town and collect the gold to take to Carson City. If the Stagecoach reaches a town first it will pick up the gold and the Pony Express riders will have to try to get to the next town before the Stagecoach. The winner will be the first player to collect three gold shipments and get them to Carson City before the Stagecoach arrives.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Race to the Planets
description: This exciting game for the whole family encourages exploration of the many intriguing worlds in our solar system. Players have fun getting to know the best "tourist" sights on each planet. Use the "secret decoder" to check your answers and collect as many planets as you can as you race family members or friends from Mercury to Pluto. (Updated 2004.)
publishers: Family Astro: Astronomical Society of the Pacific

name: Housewarming
description:
Housewarming is a simple card game for two to four players. You're trying to fill the four rooms of your house with decor, furnishings, pets, and other miscellaneous items to increase how Stylish, Comfortable and generally Cool your house is.

During the game you can Work (to earn bucks to buy stuff), Tempt Fate (to roll on the events chart), Go Shopping (to look for stuff you (or other players) may want to buy), or Rearrange Furniture (to optimize your house or get rid of stuff you don't want). Your goal is to end the game with the highest average of Style and Comfort with the lowest difference between the two.

Housewarming uses a custom card deck, an events chart, and several dice and tokens. A four-player game takes about 40 minutes to play. Although the topic isn't nearly as relevant for them as it is for a couple buying its first home, Housewarming is appropriate for mid-teens and older.

Housewarming is a free print-and-play game. It is available at http://www.invisible-city.com/play/381/housewarming
categories: Card Game, Dice, Humor, Print & Play

name: PerkyGoth
description:
PerkyGoth is a light and silly card game for two to four players. In PerkyGoth, you play cards to accumulate stuff and be seen at events that increase your Perkiness and Gothiness while having the smallest difference between the two.

To play PerkyGoth, you'll need the PerkyGoth card deck (available for free from http://www.invisible-city.com/play/371/perkygoth ) and about three six-sided dice. PerkyGoth is appropriate for early teens on up. A four-player game of PerkyGoth takes about 40 minutes.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Humor, Print & Play

name: Hi-Lo: The Lift Truck Game
description:
The box says: Created for the material handling division of Allis-Chalmers by Games For Industry, Inc. The description inside the box reads, in part:

A lift truck provides unlimited power, but if it's improperly used, that power is wasted or abused. Only the lift truck driver, the man behind the wheel, can make sure that a truck performs at its maximum capability.

As you play Hi-Lo, you'll see how expert and skillful you are at operating a lift truck ... you'll appreciate why a good operator is a key asset in industry today.

Roll the dice, go around the board, pick up 8 types of cards (design, equipment, job, power, safety, skill, bonus and upkeep), compete for Good Driver tokens, save your company money, and best of all - learn how to operate your lift truck better!

Power Grid or Industria, it may not be, but those games don't offer sample cards such "Save $89. Sideshifter - With this devise you'll be able to pick up and stack loads quickly and accurately", "You have neglected to have faulty brakes adjusted - they failed on a ramp - you dropped a load of TV sets. RETURN DESIGN CARD," and "Save $93. Don't play cowboy. Never speed, always stay alert."

name: Formulon
description:
"Formulon is designed for use in the teaching of basic inorganic chemistry to pupils aged roughly 13 to 16 years. The game package consists of a pack of 100 cards, plus a three-page instructional leaflet; 78 of the cards represent atoms or ions (H, O, etc.), 20 multipliers (two or three) while the remaining two are Mendeleef cards (jokers) that can be used to represent any other card except a multiplier. The basic idea of the game is that pupils have to use the cards to make up chemical formulas."

Taken from the book, A Handbook of Game Design, by Henry Ellington, Eric Addinall, and Fred Percival. Kogan Page, London: 1982.

name: Das Warnemündespiel
description:
A Monopoly clone set in the coastal town of Rostock-Warnemünde, Germany. As the game has been developed by a local radio station and sponsored by various Warnemünde entrepreneurs, the players have to acquire and trade company shares instead of streets.

The penalties for players ending their move on an already occupied field only increase with the number of company shares with identical colors; the concept of additional buildings such as hotels been dropped. Instead, this game features profit and loss statements that are triggered by certain fields. They change share values, resulting in players paying money into or getting money from a money pool. There are also pool cards triggering the profit and loss statements of shares of one color.
Another non-Monopoly concept is that of shortcut fields (Warnowtunnel, Scandlines ferry) that allow the players to quickly move over a section of the board for a small fee.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Sweepstakes
description: Sweepstakes is a simple game of horse racing in the 18th century. Both oval track and steeplechase racing events may be wagered upon. The game also includes a brief history of horse racing.

name: Tumble Numble
description:
The Cross-Number Game - Portable Cube Edition

A version of Scrabble with non-standard numbered dice, red rolling cup, scorepad and timer.

"THE OBJECT:
To compete for high score while placing numbered cubes in sequences that are divisible by three.

TO BEGIN:
Each player tumbles a cube.
The player with the highest value starts.
To start each round: place all eleven cubes in the Tumble Numble Tumbler,
the first player then tumbles five cubes into his hand (without looking at their values)
and passes these five cubes to the player on his left.
This occurs only at the beginning of each Round.
The remaining six cubes he tumbles upon the table and arranges as many as possible in a valid sequence.
After declaring the score, he passes the tumbler along with any cubes he was unable to use, to the player on his left.
The second player places his five cubes along with any unused cubes from the preceding player into the tumbler,
tumbles them upon the table and arranges his cubes as an extension or in cross-word fashion to the previously
played sequence.

BASIC STRATEGY
Create sequences that take best advantage of Bonus Cubes, particularly the double and triple sequence cube
so that the cube will be available to either you or your partner on succeeding plays.
Avoid making bonus cubes available to opponents.
Remember the Zero Cube freezes further play and is of considerable strategic value in this respect."

Components:
1 Tumbler cup
1 Scorepad
1, 3-min. sand timer
Rules
1 Red cube: 1, 2, (3), 4, (5), 7
1 Blue cube: 1, 2, 3, 4, 7, 8
1 Green cube: 1, 2, 3, 7, 8, 9
8 Black cubes:
0, 1, 2, 7, 8, 9
blank, 0, 1, 7, 8, 9
1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6

name: M.A.C.: Modern Armored Combat
description: Miniature rules for modern armored combat. Rules are design for playability with emphasis on keeping game play moving. Game rules include statistics on tanks from many different countries including USA, Israel, France, Germany, Britain, China and Russia. System is designed for use on 1/285 scale but can also be scaled to 10mm, 15mm and 20MM.

name: Rugby Trivia: Colin Meads
description:
Colin Meads Rugby Trivia New Zealand is a rugby board game designed for 2-6 players. It has 1,500 adult questions, 300 beginners questions and 300 childrens' questions so is great for the whole family!

How to play
Throw the die and move the number thrown along the board. Depending on what square is landed on as to whether a question is asked or not. If a question is asked players move ahead one space if correct and back 2 spaces if incorrect. There are penalty's bonus spaces and second chances.
Winner of the game is the one who gets to the finish first.

name: Country Yossi and the Shteeble-Hoppers game
description:
Mazel Tov!! You have been voted "Meshulach" (fund raiser" for your SHTEEBLE! You must visit all 8 neighborhood Schteebles (4 in outer circle and 4 in inner circle), collect pledges, and return to your Home Schteeble in the inner circle. After the first two players have returned home, both players count their money pledges and the one that has the most wins.

Players spin the spinner, move around, win money from the "Pushka," draw cards and learn loads of Yiddish! Cards include "Flatbush Shteeble celebrates a "Siyum Shas," "Stare one player in the eye and say in a high, squeeky voice 'I vant Lukshin Keegel and I vant it RIGHT NOW!' That player pays you $100", "Name all the Jewish months and get $100 from bank," and "Moishe Shmeel tied your tzizzis to your chair. Pay $100 to pushka."

Ages 5 and over.

name: World Pro Tennis Tour
description: In this roll-and-move game, players move around the board taking part in ten major world classic tennis tournaments. Players get money for placing in the tournaments, promoting tournaments, getting TV commercials and endorsements, and finishing with the best record of play. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.

name: Where's the Dough?
description:
This is primarily an educational tool to structure learning about starting and operating a business. It is not intended to be played in a single sitting, but instead paces, adds random elements, and "keeps score" over the span of a entire business or economics class. It was created by a student group at North Central College in Naperville IL ("...just 29 miles from downtown Chicago." per to game).

Students will create business goal for a cookie making firm, eventually describing marketing, financial, and operational plans. The game tests these plans through the use of randomly drawn cards that create variations and alternatives for the students to cope with and learn from.

The production value is decent, with a fully mounted folding board. The documentation included with the game is excellent. There is a teacher's manual, blank and example business plans, blank cards of all four types to allow customization, and an instruction sheet for playing the game.
publishers: North Central College, Students in Free Enterprise, Inc.

name: Resistance Is Not Futile: Warsaw 1943
description:
(From Firefight Games website)
"Resistance is not Futile" covers the Insurrection of the Warsaw Ghetto in April 1943. With most of its remaining population already having endured years of privation and growing squalor, mass deportations, and learning that soon the Nazis would be back to send the remainder to Concentration Camps, an insurrection broke out on the eve of Adolf Hitler’s birthday. Local SS commander, Jurgen Stroop, believed the troops he had on-hand would make for a quick end to this impudent act of defiance by the Jews and the Polish Home Army members who choose to rise up against the Third Reich. His underestimation of the Jewish and Polish defenders was a costly mistake, as the fight lasted for weeks and cost the Germans and their fascist allies dearly."

Firefight Games had to suspend sales of this game.

Map scale: 100 yards per inch
Counter scale: squad/platoon
Game turn: 2 or 3 days

name: Casino Six
description:
Casino Six
The ultimate game of chance.

Casino Six brings the challenge and excitement of six real casino games into you home. It's family fun for adults and older children - all in a simplified form, so even beginners can play. For more experienced players (and bold novices!) authentic Craps and Roulette layouts can be found. Games can be expanded to your liking.

Players advance through the Casino, trying their luck and testing their skill at six games in the following order:
Slots
Blackjack
Keno
Craps
Poker
Roulette

The object is to be the player who bankrupts all the others, winning all of the money.

name: Motomix
description:
Motomix is a quiz game where all aspects of the long history of motorcycles and motorcycling are covered by over 1.000 questions about bike manufacturers, legendary machines, technological developments, mechanics, sporting events, the great champions...giving you the chance to test your knowledge and discover a wealth of anecdotes !

Then you have to find the best route around the track and the best approach to tackle the different obstacles (double-hump, triple-hump, whoops, table...) in the best conditions...at several points in the race you will be able to slam across your opponents' path with a well-timed block pass and force them to reduce speed by answering correctly to the questions!

name: Fame Game
description:
From the box description:
Race to Stardom with the "Fame" gang. Based on the popular TV show.

"You've got big dreams, you want fame."

And right here is where you start playing.

You and your friends race through the N.Y. School of the Arts collecting points as you move towards graduation.

Ages 6 years to adult.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Whammy! with Tic - Tac - Toe
description:
This is a children's game.

The goal is to score points by getting strings of 3, 4, or 5 of your color in a straight line. The game comes with a board with the scoring for both variations written right on the playing surface.

name: Scrosswords
description:
From the back cover of the box:

The Fast Game of Vocabulary, Luck, & Action

Love playing with words but think word games are too slow?
Then start your mental engines and get ready for Scrosswords, the "un-bored" word game with no board, no waiting, and no end to the fun.
Each round pits one player against all others in a race to discover words in random letter tiles. When you're the Wordsmith, you roll five dice: The black dice determine how many tiles you get - from 4 to 24 - and the red die gives you a chance at a bonus category.

The timer starts as soon as you flip over your tiles. You've got 2 minutes and 30 seconds to form as many words as possible, crossword-style, and earn points for them. Meanwhile all other players - the Scavengers - are furiously writing down all the words you're missing. At the end of the round, tally up you points and see whose words are worth the most!
It takes a combination of luck, skill, and fast reflexes to score big at Scrosswords. And because every turn is different and everyone plays at once, the excitement never slows down!
publishers: Johnson Pacific Publishing, Word Origin, Inc.

name: Conquest
description:
Conquest is a strategic space exploration and conquest (naturally) game for 2-4 players. Each player starts in a system at a corner of the map and expands outward from there.

Each player represents a different spacefaring race/organization - the Terrans, the Olso Empire, the Federation (changed to the Confederation in the second edition), and the Tholians (changed to the Lothians in the second edition). Each has a different set of units they can build, with varying capabilities - ships are rated for space combat, ground (bombardment) combat, drive system, and what kind of damage they take from the various combat results.

When a star is explored a card is drawn which determines the class of the inhabitable world found there and, if inhabited, its attitude to each of the players. In addition to the attitude the value of each kind of planet varies by player.

There are three different long-range movement systems in the game - warp drive, jump drive (similar to warp drive but much less accurate), and stargates, which have to be built and carried to where you want to use them. Each player uses one of the three systems for their ships.

The second edition, in addition to changing the names of two of the races, changed some of the ship designs which were similar to Star Trek and Star Wars ships. It also changed the name of the game to The Conquest and Exploration of Space.

name: Auto-Go
description: Motor Car Race Game from the early 1930's. The game comes with a four-fold board which has early race car illustrations. The game has four cast lead race car playing pieces. This is a two to six player game . Players spin and then go around the track avoiding penalty places if they can. The game was published by H.P.Gibson & Sons.

name: Run Rabbit Run
description:
From the publisher's webpage:

This is the age old game of cat and mouse. A simple but clever two-player game where one player plays the part of a rabbit and the other, the part of two wolves.

The rabbit's job is to hop around the vegetable patch collecting carrots to take back to its burrow, without being eaten by a wolf.

The wolves' job is to sneak around the vegetable patch, to ambush and eat the rabbit.

EDIT: This game was apparently not published in 2007 as planned because of high production costs (per John Yianni on BGG).

name: Bulltricker
description:
You can download this application Bulltricker 2D, here http://www.bulltricker.com/
It's 100% FREE for WINDOWS, MAC, LINUX !

HAVE FUN !!

NEW !!! You can play online, using the Bulltricker 2D app downloadable from our site, and playing message by message through our site chat. It's 100% free (for now).
This application (Bulltricker 2D) manages the rules of the game. When you have taken your turn, you must copy the coordinates of your move which are displayed by the application, [simply click on the "COPY" button (in the application), this memorizes the coordinates in plain text], and return to the chat to send these coordinates to your opponent by doing a simple "right click" and "Paste" and "Send".

Conversely, when you receive the message of the coordinates of the move that your opposing player sent you in the chat, then "select" just the message of these coordinates (by just selecting the coordinates, that is to say from the first letter or number on the left and up to the last letter or number on the right) and doing a simple "right click" + "copy". Come back to the application, and doing a simple "right click" in the field ([______ ] [Apply]) and the coordinates will immediately be entered in this field, then you just have to click on the button "APPLY", and your opponent's move is immediately reproduced on your game (because the application manages the moves, and the coordinates of the moves).

You can play entire games for as long as possible and as many times as you want. Simply by using our chat and our 2D Bulltricker app.
It's completely free at the moment.

This 2D application for the Bulltricker game has just been launched.
It's simple and modest but perfectly playable and functional.
Everything works perfectly, so it's perfect for playing full parties!

[ Download here >> http://www.bulltricker.com/ ]
Another point, this application also allows you to play:
- 1 VS 1 : Game by Local network !
- 1 VS 1 : Game on the same central unit, in front of the same screen (1 vs 1), the display changes direction to adapt the correct direction of the pieces for the player who has the move.
- 1 VS 1 : Game by text message (chat, mail, sms) this application allows you to play remotely by exchanging a message of the coordinates of the moves played.
After playing your turn, the application generates the message to send to your opponent, with a single click, it's to copy, just paste it in the chat or email or sms.
It also allows you to insert and reproduce the coordinate message you received, with a single click, and it analyzes the coordinates of the move, and if it is correct, the application reproduces your opponent's move on your game. You may then take your turn. And so on...

This game is a mix between chess and checkers, this rules are freely available here >> http://www.bulltricker.com/ [English and French ].
Let's go over a brief overview :

>> Aim of the game : Surround the opposing King between 4 pieces (Queen or Pawn) with a minimum of one of your own pieces.

>> PIECES :
The King : can't capture/can't be captured/can't jump over pieces and no other piece can jump over the king.
The pawn : you have vertical and horizontal pieces, can capture other pieces. Moves 1 space.
The queen : again : you have vertical and horizontal pieces. May move the full length.

Everything is explained here: http://www.bulltricker.com/

Thank you for coming and checking it out!
You can play as much as you want, it's free, and it's a game that both chess players and checkers really like, because it's a great strategy game for two players.

name: Speedboat Racing
description: This game from Glevum Games of Gloucester England is a simple roll (spin) and move game similar to many of the times. It features lead racing boats. The game comes from the mid 1930's.

name: Global Air Race Game
description: Four player game. Comes with a triple-fold board that shows a map of the World. Progress around the board is determined by advantage and penalty stops. There is no indication of who the designed this game.

name: Crossroads Motel
description:
Board game based on the old British soap opera. Players take on the role of main characters from the program and attempt to make money out of running a motel.

Ages 4 and up
Each player chooses a character to represent - Meg, Sandy, Jill or David. Your objective is to promote the three staff pieces under your control to rooms marked on the quarters of the board. Along the way room improvements can take place. Room and Reception Cards may help or hender you! Try not to let the hotel's debts mount up! Have you got what it takes to run a hotel successfully?
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Equid
description:
EQUID is a captivating board game which brings you the thrill of a day at the races. Place your bets on a horse and try to make it win using a mixture of general knowledge, tactics and judgment.
EQUID takes the form of a race in which any player can move any horse without knowing who has bet on which. At the start of the game the players study the cards they have been dealt and place secret bets: either a straight win bet or a combination bet. Each player in turn answers general knowledge questions about horses, and can play a card to accelerate a horse, until two horses have crosses the finishing line.
The wide variety of cards and the color and position of the horses give the players unlimited scope for tactics and last-minute gallops to the finishing post !
The appeal of EQUID is that the game is a mixture of bluff, astute card playing, tactics and general knowledge, without forgetting an element of chance to spice up the game and create an enjoyable atmosphere and some unforgettable moments !
The game covers every aspect of a horse and its universe, with over 1100 questions about ethology, anatomy, racing, techniques, equipment, health, feeding, sporting events... to test your knowledge and bring you a wealth of interesting facts and amusing anecdotes !
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Educational, Memory, Racing, Trivia

name: The Apple Game
description: From the back of the box: "The object of The Apple Game is for you to gain control of the Apple Computer Company. You do it by amassing 51% of the company stock. You meet the challenge through increasing mastery of Applesoft BASIC language, shrewd moves, sharp business sense, and luck."

name: Teach Key Reading and Spelling
description:
1967 3M TEACH KEY Reading and Spelling. Scarce 3M EduPLAYtional game. Triangular shaped box. This game is in the same series as Egghead and Chicken.

Includes 2 packs of 24 key cards (48 total), the house board, box, and set of keys. I do not know if add-on card sets were available, although it is possible.

Players ages 5-8 insert the key into the correct missing letter hole of each word in order to correctly spell and thus unlock the word.

name: Dig!
description:
A vanity press publication from New Zealand in 2000.

From the box: Search the Egyptian sands for ancient treasures, face terrible monsters, treacherous traps and curses. Employ dastardly schemes to profit from your opponents. Steal their treasure, assassinate their guides, corrupt their bodyguards, dabble in the ancient arts of magic... But watch your back! In the desert everyone is digging for treasure. Trust no-one, not even your camel!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game

name: Polygon
description: Polygon is a four sided Chess variation similar in appearance to Helios from the same designer. Each piece has specific moves, and players attempt to capture the O piece of the opposing player. Two players play one color each on opposite sides of the board, three players play one color each, and four players play as partners.

name: XOROX
description:
The game is a variation of TicTacToe. Players play six games and score points. There are 16 ceramic tiles one inch square. 4 black with “X”, 4 black with “XO”, 4 white with “X” and 4 white with “XO”. There are no tiles with just “O”. Players score points by making a line of three tiles of same color (25 pts), 3 Xs or 3 XOs in a line of two colors (50 pts), 3 Xs or 3 XOs of same color in a line (100 pts).

The game is in a pasteboard box about 4½ inches square and ½ inch thick. The rules are on the outside bottom of the box. The 3x3 square game board included is a piece of cardboard about 4 inches square. The center square of the board has a note that it is not to be used for the first play of a game. The game has 8 ceramic tiles (1 inch square) for each player.

Game box lists copyright as being held by CowoC, Inc. and the back of the box states that the distributor is The Good Ideas Co., PO Box 3512 Madison, WI 53704

name: Drop Weasel
description:
Founded in BGG thread http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/1105433#1105433 Drop Weasel is a game created ad hoc at dark:thirty.

Can you be the best weasel? Compete for mice, rats, and other rodents, as well as fish, frogs, and birds' eggs! You assign dice to food sources, but what will they roll? Can you keep enough dice in play to react to opponents and win?

Components include a food control map, player mats, and different colored dice for each player.

name: Hartei
description: This a party game from Spiel Spass. There are several unusual German words (eg. Deo-Verachter)players have to find out. One player has to act or to draw and the other ones have to find out what that should be.

name: Happy, Happy Birthday
description: Turn a crank on a birthday cake which will play music and spin to award the player a small plastic prize. The box reads "You can tell it's Mattel..it sounds swell!" and "The musical spinner makes you a winner!"

name: Magic Midway
description: Based on the NBC television show. A spinner features characters Cuckoo Kiley, Bonnie Lee, Boom-Boom Bailey, The Ringmaster and Mr. Hocus-Pocus. Players move around a board featuring circus acts.

name: Mr. Celsius: Centigrade Thermometer Game
description:
Mr. Celsius is a game of mathematics involving addition of positive and negative numbers on the metric thermometer. Easier or more difficult games may be played using the OPTIONAL PLAY.

Ages 8 to Adult.

The object of the game is to be the first player to reach +100C or -100C (on the board). Players accomplish this by throwing the dice, calculating their score, and moving their marble marker when appropriate.

The game is normally played starting at 0C and using both the positive and negative scales. Variants include using only the positive, or only the negative scales, starting at 90 and racing to zero or starting at 0C and racing to -100C.

The rules include a handy conversion chart, and some formulae to aid in playing, as well as providing the
means to receive Bonus Points.

The game is copyright Communication Concept, Inc. 1976
Mishawaka, Indiana 46544

name: Squeeze
description: Players spin the Lucky Spinner and travel a carnival-themed board to win enough Prize Cards to to enter the Boardwalk and get to finish first.

name: Rules for the Conduction of Colonial Period Skirmish Wargames in Miniature 1850 to 1900
description:
Fast-paced, personalized combat during the heyday of colonial empires. Relive the Zulu assault at Rorke's Drift, the Charge of the 21st Lancers at Omdurman (with young Winston Churchill at your right), and many other exciting colonial battles. Games represent the critical point in one sector of a general engagement, or a clash between small parties of scouts. The colonial period is remarkable for the variety of actions that can be reproduced. With these rules, actions from the familiar British North-West Frontier and African wars, and from the unfamiliar French oerations in Madigascar or Russian siege of Geok Tepe can all be fought.

Each player must plot every action to be performed by the miniature figure which represents him on the playing table. Rules cover anything from Melee combat to falling off of a horse. A pair of percentile dice are required and must be purchased separately.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Franken-Quartett
description:
This card game features major cities in Franconia, a German region rich in history and (only) politically part of Bavaria. Cities include Nürnberg, Würzburg, Bayreuth, Bamberg, and Rothenburg, among others.

The object of the game is to collect melds of cities by winning cards from your opponent in classical quartet showdowns.

Franken-Quartett is a variant of a Quartett game, with a splash of Top Trumps thrown in. Each player has 5 cards of different towns. each card has informations about population, size, founding year, et c. One active player say a category and 'most' or 'fewest', and both players simultaneously play one card. both reveal their cards, and the player with the card in the chosen category that is the declared 'most' or 'fewest' gets both cards. The aim is to collect four cards of one city -- one Quartett.

The player with three Quartetts wins.

name: Burst
description: 2 Players compete as they construct a sphere using magnetic tiles. Each player gets 10 Hexagons and 6 Pentagons. You roll a die and can only play a piece of the color that you roll. The goal is to get rid of all your tiles first. But remember, 2 tiles of the same color are not allowed to touch.

name: Clone!
description: Players build a structure by adding magnetic polyhedral tiles. The tiles can only be connected to the shape and color that they match. It's okay to flip or turn the structure but if it falls apart then you lose!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Lingo
description: Card is drawn. Player puts marker on same picture on his or her individual board. Cards continue be drawn until one player wins with five markers in a row (vertically, horizontally or diagonally). Educational value comes from reading the word (in a language not native to the player) which corresponds with the picture.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Äffchen
description:
Many different fruit cards lie spread on the table. The object is to find certain fruits and their correct color. By asking questions one moves closer the goal.

---

Viele verschiedene Früchtekarten liegen ausgebreitet auf dem Tisch. Es gilt, bestimmte Früchte und deren richtige Farbe zu finden. Durch Fragen rückt man dem Ziel näher.

name: Bambou
description:
This game is derived from the climbing competitions of the Bambous, who always played in teams of three in championships in old bamboo groves. The crew which was gathered at the top first won the won the golden bamboo sheet.
Players roll dice to move upward and need to find the best strategy to make use of the irregular growth of the bamboo. When two opposing pieces are at the same height, they have to duel by dice to determine who can go up and who has to go back down.


Dieses Spiel ist abgeleitet von den Kletterwettbewerben der Bambous, die immer in Mannschaften zu dritt in alten Bambushainen durchgeführt wurden. Dabei gewann die Mannschaft das goldene Bambusblatt, die als erste im Blätterdach versammelt war.

name: 5 Minuten Denk mal
description:
"5 Minuten Denk mal" (maybe "5 minutes of thinking") is a traditional german paper & pencil game that might be called "categories game" in the US. This one is a special variation with 85 double sided small cards giving 170 possible categories. It can be played by 8 players or 8 teams.

In each of the 6 rounds played 6 cards where used giving 6 new categories. Also one small card will used giving the first letter for each category. Players have to find clues on each category starting with the drawn letter while the sandtimer is running for 5 minutes. There are categories like "capital city", "island", "cartoon character", "color", "or "insect". If a player could make a clue for each category he is allowed to stop the actual round and all other players have to stop writing too.

Each of the 6 rounds will be scored seperately. Players will get a higher score for each answer if they have found a unique clue (10 points), if two players have the same answer there will be only 2 points, only 1 point if there are more than 2 players with the same clue.
Each player(or team) also can use a joker once per game that will doubled there score of that round.
The game belongs to a series of (at least) 6 games called "Fröhliche Freizeit" - packed in small but beautiful bookcase boxes similar to the wellknown 3M card games.

Game components
85 small double sided category ards
27 letter cards
8 joker cards
1 5 minute sand timer
1 scorepad
1 rules sheet


"5 Minuten Denkmal" lehnt sich in seinem Reglement an das klassische "Stadt-Land-Fluß"-Spiel an. Es reicht jedoch in den behandelten Wissensgebieten weit über dieses hinaus.

In 5 Minuten Denkmal, dem modernen Stadt-, Land-, Fluß-Spiel ohne Grenzen, hat jeder Spieler oder jedes Spielerteam in dem 6 Runden umfassenden Spielablauf die Möglichkeit, einmal in einer Runde den Joker zu setzen und so seine Punktezahl für die betreffende Runde zu verdoppeln.

Kleines Buchkasetten Spiel aus der Serie "Fröhliche Freizeit" die aus mindestens 6 Spielen besteht.

name: Addition Bingo
description: Addition Bingo is a children's educational game, made to teach children the very basics of addition.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number, Party Game

name: Leksis
description:
Description from the back of the box:

Leksis is a literary game, where you construct your own crossword puzzles. Again and again.

You can play alone or with others, and you decide for yourself how hard it should be.

Leksis contains 240 letter-pieces. A game where you can play with word puzzles in any language.

name: Palabras Ocultas
description:
A game in Scattergories's line, published in 1990 by Borras Plana S.A en España. The players (or teams) have to write many words that begin with the corresponding letter and of the category of the indicated letter, before the sand timer runs out. It has 24 topics and different letters. Play for 12 turns.

---

Un juego en la línea de Scattergories, publicado en 1990 por Borras Plana S.A in Spain. Los jugadores (o equipos) han de escribir la mayor cantidad de palabras que empiecen por la letra correspondiente y de la categoría de la carta indicada, en el tiempo que marca un reloj de arena. Tiene 24 temas y letras diferentes. Se juega en 12 turnos.

name: African-American Discovery
description:
Publisher:

African-American Discovery is a trivia board game that helps you learn and review facts about significant African-Americans, African-American history, and African-American culture.

The object of the game is to score points by discovering the other players' famous names before your name is discovered, by answering history questions from the Fact-Finder cards, and by winning points on various squares on the board.

The game is won when there is only one player left. However, in a game in which a time limit is set, the player with the highest score wins.

name: Little Bo Peep
description:
Little Bo Peep has lost her sheep and you must spin and move to find them...

Play starts with four sheep of each player's respective color on the board, plus a black sheep in the middle. Regular sheep may be picked up in passing. The black sheep may only be picked up when you have all four of your own sheep and must be landed on by exact count. The player to successfully claim his own four sheep plus the black sheep wins.

The game has no copyright date, but pre-dates the use of zip codes in U.S. addresses.

name: The Time Tunnel Card Game
description: Deck of cards with 4 suits of 1-13 representing 4 eras and two "time tunnel" cards and randomizing spinner directing travelers to each of the 4 eras. Various games could be played as variations of rummy, trick taking etc. Issued to take advantage of Time Tunnel television series which did not turn out as popular as hoped.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: CraCa
description:
CraCa is a fast paced game of chance that combines the excitement of Casino craps and the challenge of strategic card play.

The game also allows you an opportunity to learn the basic rules of real Casino crap.

CraCa has all the fun and excitement of real Casino action. It can be played with two to eight players, singly or as partners. It is played and enjoyed by beginners, as well as advanced players of Casino craps.

name: All About Charlottesville: Albemarle County, VA
description:
To complete the game, you need to collect a number of items on a list that you receive at the beginning of the game.

You first go to the bank to get money, then you go to the different locations to get the items you need to complete the list.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Imperial Guard
description:
Imperial Guard is published with ziplock rules. They offer fast playing for Napoleonic era battles with 15 mm or 25 mm Airfix (or similar) miniatures.

A quick reference combat table speeds up the game play. A 20-digit percentile die is required, but must be purchased separately.

From the introduction:

"The Napoleonic wargame! It conjures up images of fire-belching artillery. massed infantry columns, daring cavalry charges, all with a special color and pageantry unmatched in other historical periods.

These are rules for miniature wargamers who prefer Napoleonic combat in that grand style. There is little skirmishing here except for those seemingly isolated incidents that link into the long chain of battle."

name: Blondie Goes to Leisureland
description: This 1940 game was given to children whose parents bought an appliance from Westinghouse. Players spin and move the around a fold-out paper board featuring comic strip characters Blondie and Dagwood, purchasing appliances such as a sandwich grill and a water heater before finally reaching Leisureland (a home full of electric appliances).

name: The Bicentennial Game
description:
The Bicentennial Game
1776-1976
"Experience the Birth of Our Nation"

This game was published in 1976 by Doc Roc Enterprises. This game appears to be a teaching aid, as there is little to no strategy, and focuses on highlighting the people, places, and facts of the American Revolutionary War.

It is a roll-and-move game, with a board divided into three sections: a left circular track, a right snake-like track, and a middle track that is a straight-away to the victory space on top. Each space on the board has a bit of trivia that I assume is intended to be read aloud when a player lands on it.

The flow of the game is as follows:

Section I, People
Players roll and move on the right side of the board, landing on spaces that describe the major players of the war. Some spaces require you to draw a card, which could move you forward or backward. The object is to get to the end of the Section I path.

Section II, The Original 13 Colonies
Once they reach the end of Section I, players roll and move on the left side of the board, landing on spaces that represent the 13 colonies. If a player lands on a colony that they have not previously landed, they mark on a piece of paper that they have "collected" this colony. Players will continue on the circular path until they have "collected" all 13 colonies, which will allow them to move to Section III.

Section III, The American Character
A player rolls and moves up the center path towards the top of the board. The player must roll exactly to land on the last space, The Bell Tower, in order to win.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Los ovnis atacan
description:
You must stop the ovnis and save the Earth by being the first player to arrive at the M marker with your pawn.

One of the Feber Juegos Cassette format games.

name: Theodore Tugboat Cargo Game
description:
Based on the CBC network children's television show.

From Back Cover
"Welcome to The Big Harbor, where Theodore The Tugboat and his friends spend their busy days. Young players more their tugboats from port to port, hoping to be the first to collect 4 different colored chips. Watch out where you land though; just when you think you've won, you lose a ship and have to start again."

The game has two forms of play, one without cards (younger children) and one with chance cards (older children).
To play the game you move your tugboat around the board based on a dice roll. Depending on where you land you either collect a colored disk (cargo), lose a colored disk (cargo), or nothing happens. The winner is the first player to get one of each colored disk and make it back to the beginning for the board.
In the older child version you can also receive chance cards, depending on where you land. The cards allow the player to move to specific locations, move extra spaces, take extra turns, or lose turns.

Rules in English and French.
categories: Children's Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Nautical
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: CityProGame Düsseldorf
description:
Using the detailed street map of Düsseldorf, which is set out in four colors, each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the center as possible.

Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four ‘places worth seeing’ are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.

name: InQUIZitive
description:
From the box:

The action and fun begin with the first roll of the die as you accept the exciting challenge to become the first to graduate from InQUIZitive University.

Clues Make It Different! Strategy Makes It Fun!

At last, a quiz game in which every member of the family can compete on an equal level. Clues are the key, eliminating the frustration of almost knowing an answer -- giving less knowledgeable or younger players a fair opportunity to think out a correct response. So every player has a chance to win!

name: Mijn!
description: Game about the auction of vegetables (!). Players move around the board with a die that doesn't have numbers but vegetables marked on. Whenever a player is on an auction space, an auction is triggered. The auction is done in a similar way as in The Merchants of Amsterdam, meaning that players have to hit a spring driven auction clock to place a bid and win the auction. The object is to buy your vegetables cheap (during an auction) and to sell them with profit (whenever one is one a vegetable space of a sort that one has bought). I suspect this light Dutch bidding game with a high dose of luck (due to the die) was released in the early '90s.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Revolver
description:
From the publishers web site:

Showdown in the street! With Revolver, you and an opponent can mimic the gunfights of the old west, facing off one-on-one, guns blazing, bullets flying, and victory or death the only escape.

Using your two six-guns, each with its own special "bullets" deck, and your own deck of 27-cards, you can play out these fights quickly and easily -- most games are over in 10 to 15 minutes. Revolver is a great filler game to pass the time as you wait for the rest of your game group to arrive.

You will need three different colors of card stock (or only white card stock if you use the colored card backs included in the download file), a printer, scissors, and an opponent to play this game.

Game design by Philip Reed.
Illustrated by John Kovalic.
For 2 players.

name: Pedal Power
description: This game was released in England and is part of a small range of compact games that are quick to play (Quikky Games). Pedal Power is a cycling game in a compact plastic box that can pop open with the game rules and board appearing on the inside of the plastic box (being part of the packaging). This gives the impression that this is a traveling game. The closed box measures 23x13cms. Each player receives 1 colored counter (available colors are red, yellow, white and blue). There are also 4 dice in two colors (red & blue) but the dice don't contain the traditional 1 to 6 numbers but range from 0 to 4 and also includes a cross on one side. The gameboard is a cycling track in an oval shape. Different kind of races can be played on the track: sprint, time trial, chase, keirin or a points race. The mechanism is purely rolling dice thus the luck factor is rather high here.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jeu du Tour de Belgique Cycliste
description: This very simple cycling game from Belgium and produced in the early '50s uses a 37x28cm paper map. The game was released a s a promotional game for table-oil. On the map there is a drawing of Belgium with 50 spaces on 50 different towns or cities, this forms the track. Each player controls a team of 2 cyclists, movement is determined by spinning a paper cartwheel that has the numbers 1 to 6 on it (this replaces a die). The winner is the player who reaches the finish (in Brussels) first.

name: Spellbound
description:
Each player, in turn, must construct a word using the eight cards dealt to that individual. A wind-up timer ticks off loudly as an digital readout counts down from nine to zero. A bell sounds when a minute has passed. A player scores for constructing word of three letters or longer. A bonus is scored if the word length of the bonus card is reached. The game is over when the last of the fifteen bonus cards is claimed. The highest score wins.

The plastic molded gameboard is packaged in a massive 26” x 26” x 5 ½” box. The game is endorsed by Jerry Lewis.

name: Gemeinsam Vorn
description: This game is quite unique since it was made in the D.D.R. (East Germany) in 1978. Unsurprisingly it has quite a sober design and a social-communist theme (team spirit, supporting the team undoubtedly stands for supporting the society here). It's title 'Gemeinsam vorn' means 'together ahead' or 'Leading together' in English. The track on the 47x33cm board looks orthogonal. Each player controls a team of 2 cyclists, the movement is done by rolling 2 dice. Tactics are quite simple and limited to deciding which cyclist a player will move. The track has bonus fields (green or red boxes) resulting in a bonus. The winner of the game is the one who wins the team classification (and not the individual winner!

name: Davitamon Wielerspel
description: This game based upon the Davitamon-Quick Step cycling team in 2003, is a simple roll & move game. The board has 60x35cms. dimensions with a track of 67 boxes on it. Players move their cyclist (either 1 or 2 cyclists each), which looks closely to the ones used in 'Démarrage', by rolling a die. The rules contain 2 different versions of the game. In the basic game the winner is just the first cyclist who crosses the finish line first. In the more advanced rules the winner is the one who scores most points in the intermediate sprints.
publishers: Chefaro Nederland bv, Imagebooks Publishers bv

name: Shoo!
description:
A pure luck game in which players collect strawberries for the birds. Remember to watch out for opponents with a scarecrow!

This game is No. 450 in the Waddingtons line and is for children 5 and up. Rules in English and French.

name: Mit 1000 Mark über Land und Meer
description:
This game is played on a political map of Europe. Starting point for all players is Brussels in Belgium. From there, 6 routes of equal length lead to 6 destinations: Edinburgh, Helsinki, Athens, Istanbul, Palermo and Gibraltar.

Object of the game is to be the first player reaching one of the destination towns. Each player has a starting capital of 1000 Deutsche Mark. Towns on the way are stopovers, where the means of transportations to the next town must be fixed. Moreover, a chance card must be drawn, which indicates, if the travel goes on normally, of if additional luggage or passengers must be taken on.

Walking by foot is slow, but the cheapest means of transportation. Faster movement is desired (bicycle, car, train and airplane), but costs rise drastically when using them. If a player runs out of money, he is eliminated from the game.

name: Royal Commission: Special Friends Edition
description:
In the mythical land of Xanada, the auditor general discovered that 250 million dollars of public funds had been paid out to political cronies for questionable or imaginary work. Government record keeping was found to be in a shambles. The king in his wisdom called a Royal Commission to investigate the problem.

As a player, you are implicated in the scandal and will be called to testify. In this gracious kingdom, you have little to fear. You cannot go to jail, nor will you be asked to give any of the money back. None the less, as good citizens, you will be expected to participate in the Royal Commission.

name: Vélodrome
description: This French cycling game dates back to the 1930's (exact release-date unknown). It's a wooden box of 18x38cm. that should be clapped open to play. Inside there is an oval vélodrome. There are 8 wooden cyclists (each forming a team). Movement is decided by a die. Players should decide how many laps the race will be. The winner is the one who crosses the line first in the final lap.

name: Sport Cycling Game
description: This magnetic small traveling game was broad out by Super Accord, a company from Hong-Kong (now China) somewhere in the '90s. It's a plastic box (8,5x8,5cm.)that can be clapped open. There are four different magnets that are used as pawns (one for each player) and a 6mm. die. The rules are very easy, movement of the magnets is determined by the die, some boxes on the track can cause bad luck (resulting for example in skipping one or two turns.

name: Potvertoeren: Tour de Chance
description: This Dutch cycling game from 1965 was enclosed in the Dutch weekly magazine, called Revue. The gameboard, which is made from glossy magazine paper, has a 'board' of 38 x 35 cm. The game also contains several tokens, which you had to cut out from the magazine. There is a green and yellow jersey, the polkadot mountain jersey, a tour-caravan token and several 1 to 3 peaked mountain tokens. You need also a die and a number of chips or matches, whatever you like. The paper gameboard has the Tour de France route of 1965 printed on it. At the start, every player gets some chips as starting money. After a stage is finished, the tour caravan pawn moves to the next stage. Every stage has a number printed on, this is important for the dice rolling. You need to roll that number for winning the stage. Since this fame is purely based on dice rolling, the rules are very simple. You can earn or lose chips depending on how the dice rolls. The game ends when the tour caravan reaches the final stage in Paris. The player who has the most chips at this point wins the game.

name: Le jeux des sept équipes
description: This French cycling card game contains 42 cards (6*9cm. size) divided over 7 teams. The teams are Festina, US Postal, Credit Agricole, BigMat, Once, Orbea and Cannondale (the last 2 are mountain bike teams). Each team has specialist, for example a climber (grimpeur), sprinter, team leader, attacker, rouleur or helper. Each card has a photo of a real professional cyclist on it, making this a collectors item for cyclist lovers.

name: Truth, Dare or Damnation!
description:
Description from Khepher Games website:
"The party game where you're damned if you do, and even more damned if you don't! Players decide to answer the truth on the purple dice or act out the dare on the blue dice. If they fail, the black die reveals the penalty."

The game comes with two purple truth dice, two blue dare dice and a black die with dares that must be carried out if the truth or dare are not completed to the satisfaction of the rest of the players. All dice are six-sided and have text on them. The dice of the same colour combine to give an instruction, such as "Spank or grope ... An inanimate object".

The game doesn't actually specify an objective or how to win, but presumably the aim is to have the least embarrassing results after rolling ...

Amusingly, the game comes with the warning, "Not to be played with alcohol".

name: Cosmic Dice
description:
In ancient Greece (Hellas) there was a very popular dice game with the name Cosmic Dice.
At first at the Orpheus period was only three cosmic dice.
At the Homeric period there were four dice.
At last there were totally twelve dice, one for each one of the 12 Greek Gods.

The game comes with 12 cosmic dices and the explanation for predicting your future according to the ancient Greek philosophers.

Cosmic Dice has the following items:
1. A colorful grid.
2. 12 dice, each with ancient Greek scripts on each side.
3. A small book.
4. Many other items.

The full game which will be issued in the next version will have 25 "cosmic dice" and much more information about the ancient philosophy of fortune telling.

The new version will have 200 cosmic dice.

There is another game also Cosmic Runar Dice which is different and has the runic lettering and numbering.

name: Thomas the Tank Engine's Whistle Stop Surprise Card Game
description: A combination of a game and a puzzle. The game is a go fish type matching game, but the card backs also form a 2 foot by 4 foot puzzle. Play the game and then turn the cards over to make the puzzle.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Puzzle, Trains

name: Starchec
description:
Starchec is actually a 2-games box with 2 different games in it. Common to both games is the use of 6-sided chess-die showing the 6 chess symbols: knight, bishop, rook, pawn, queen and king. Each turn, the die is rolled and allows 1 playing piece to make a chess move according to the roll of the die.

Starchec-1, Wettlauf um die Sterne (race around the stars):


2-4 players can play. Each player has 1 "saucer" and 1 "meteor". Object of the game is to be the first player, who brings his saucer to the finish line. Meteors are used to block opponent saucer; they can only be moved, when a king is rolled, but the can be placed everywhere on the board then. If a saucer captures another saucer, the 2 involved saucers just change places.Starchec-2, Spiel im Weltall (game in outer space):


This game is played on a normal chessboard. Each of the 2 players has 8 tokens, which are placed on two opposing sides of the board. Winner of the game is the player, who brings all 8 tokens on the opposing side of the board first. Captures result in an exchange of positions again, but it's also allowed to "capture" own pieces, if a player does not want to move any of his tokens.

name: The Imp Game
description:
For years, players of fantasy games have stormed the dungeons and strongholds of evil sorcerers, warlords, and just plain bad guys as heroes: knights, wizards, druids, paladins, and more. Heroically they have braved the darkest pits, the foulest creatures, and the most perilous of quests.

This, however, is not such a game.

Welcome to The Imp Game! Rather than taking on the role of one of these namby-pamby heroes, players in the Imp Game take on a much more entertaining role: that of the common, dungeon imp! Servants of a wannabe dark and quasi-evil overlord, players scour the world in search of items of power, foil the plots of “evil” Adventurers, and clean out the dungeons whenever needed, getting themselves into mess after mess with the only way out is to help each other!

The Imp Game is a wonderfully hilarious game for 2 to 5 players of all ages. The Imp Game features a powerful "Failure" mechanic that captures the feeling of inept but stupidly lucky sidekicks, ensuring that success is inevitable, but who succeeds at what?

name: HappyAnimals
description:
HI! I am the Pig and I am HAPPY near the Farm and near the Water. If I stop on other places... I become SAD! When Happy I can draw the YELLOW HAPPY NUMBERS, and when Sad I can draw the PURPLE SAD NUMBERS!

MOOO! I am the Cow and I am HAPPY near the Farm and near the Grass: On these places I can draw THREE HAPPY NUMBERS and if i draw a "+", then I can sum them! With 5 + 4, I can move up to 9 squares!

Who will be an HAPPY ANIMAL?
Who will arrive first? Maybe someone will stop on a square to stay happy and draw the HAPPY NUMBERS, higher than the SAD NUMBERS!
The choice is yours: always run till the last step or stay happy and win!

HAPPYANIMALS is a COMPLETE GAME
for 2-18 players, 5 years and up. Contents:
- 18 Cards with the characteristics of all Animals
- 18 Counters of the Animals, The Happy Numbers and the Sad Numbers
- 1 Board representing the race map with the Farm, the Woods, the Grass, the Water...
- 1 Rule sheet easy (draw and move) and one with addictions, subtractions, multiplications and divisions.
- And... 2 wooden PUSH PUPPETS!

All the 18 wooden push puppets are available:
Pig, Cow, Lion, Donkey, Elephant, Dog, Cat, Giraffe, Gazzelle, Husky, Leopard, Green Dog, Bear, Sheep, Monkey, Bamby, Horse, Zebra.

Push puppets are wonderful handmade and hand-painted animals that when "Happy" stands on their base, when "Sad" flop on their legs!

HAPPYANIMALS will be premiered as prototype at EssenFair 06, Stand SilToys booth number 9-19 and at stand Angelo Porazzi Games booth number 9-28.
categories: Animals, Educational, Humor, Math, Miniatures, Number, Party Game, Racing
mechanics: Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Rockets Away: Sensational Space Travel Game
description: In this classic game from the 1950s, players take turns launching rockets at a board containing futuristic space settlements and various celestial objects, such as planets, stars, and a sun. Launching occurs by placing the rockets in rocket launcher attached to a space station and then dropping the rockets on the board from above. Players score points or lose points based on where the rockets land. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
