Rules, Problems and Suggestions to Players, and also in a boxed version (publisher unknown). The book version was reprinted in Sid Sackson's game column in Strategy & Tactics #21, from which all this information is taken.

name: Brincolor
description: An abstract jumping and movement game. Game features 21 round discs (7 in each of 3 colors - red, white and yellow) and a hexagonal shaped board featuring 61 circles in those same three colors.

name: Zards
description:
Zards puts a twist on the trick-taking card game. When a player takes the trick, he is allowed to cast a spell to manipulate the rules governing the rest of the round (when possible). The further the game progresses, the more spells become available.

The game is played from a unique deck of 84 cards ordered by three characteristics: rank, set, and suit. The rank corresponds with the card's spell level. As players increase their score and achieve new levels, more spells open up to them.

At the start of each round, players split the 13 cards dealt to them into a wand of 10 cards and a bag of 3 cards. The wand determines which cards are played during the round, while the bag is a selection of pre-determined spells to cast during the round. Spells are only cast by a player taking the trick.

Zards is unique to other trick-taking games:
* Zards is adjustable to play 3 to 6 players without the need to add or remove cards from the deck.
* By not dealing out the entire deck, the ability to accurately count cards is reduced, providing more comfort for novices playing against experts.
* Players can manipulate the rules for the round with a selection of over 20 spells.
* Each round allows the player in last place the advantage of playing first. Though, maintaining the lead depends on how cards are played and spells are cast.

name: Colony Ten
description:
A very simple trick taking trump card game with attractive card art. Apparently a French production but no further manufacturing or dating material available.

From the box:

Many light years hence in a lost galaxy, chaos reigns supreme. An evil alliance of priests and merchants hold dominion over a world of burnt out desolate beings; the dregs of the spaceways seeking refuge from the turmoil around, and finding only colony ten. Now you are the only hope left. So take the cards and wield the ultimate source of power.

name: Elder Earth
description:
A very simple trick taking trump card game with attractive card art. Apparently a French production but no further manufacturing or dating material available.

From the box:

Before the time when the oceans swallowed the land, was an age of wonder. When dragons and dwarves [sic] waged titanic battles with the creatures of the void. When the struggle for power between light and dark hung in the balance. Now you are the only hope left. So take the cards and weild the ultimate source of power.

name: Robo Legion
description:
A very basic trick taking trump card game with very attractive art. Apparently made in France, but with no other manufacturing or dating information available.

From the box:

Ten centuries ago the old time ended when Earth's cities were laid waste in the war that ended all wars. Leaving only mans' final creation, the Robo Legion to fight on until this day. Now you are the only hope left, so take the cards and weild the ultimate source of power.

name: Principal Baseball Game
description: Baseball boardgame locally issues in Chicago Il.

name: Tom Seaver Electric Baseball game
description: Baseball game featuring an electric pitching arm. Local NY steel company issued after the NY Mets won the World Series.

name: Whiz Baseball
description:
Players spin a spinning peg on the baseball diamond shaped game board. The board has locations markered for hits and outs. If the peg lands on an out, then the batter is out. There are 4 Stands that represent hits. Hit 1 for a single, 2 for a double, 3 for a triple and hit all four for a home run.

And there was also this non-electric entry, from 1945 -- Whiz Baseball. The artwork and yellow box are rather reminiscent of that for Senior Model 66-B. The red bits seen on the gameboard at right are not lightbulbs, but wooden pegs. A small top placed on the inclined lower sixth of the board was spun with the fingers, and the pegs it knocked over and the holes in which it landed determined the result of each play -- similar to Milton Bradley's much smaller 1957 version of Swat Baseball. (Source)

name: Psychic Baseball
description:
Depression era Parker Brothers Baseball boardgame. Players use cards for batters and pitchers to generate results.

Full color board with pegs to marker baserunners and score.

name: Sticks and Stones
description: A simple, charming, but intriguingly challenging game from "Cafe Montana" in Caracas, Venezuela. The exact origin of the game is unknown, but it is probably native Indian. Object: Each player tries to guess the total number of sticks held in all the players' hands. Scoring is done with stones. Simple, but bluff and bravado play a big part in winning.

name: Realms: Knights vs. Demons
description:
From the publisher:

Sir Thomus spurred his warhorse as he and the other knights of his order charged the demons. The foul stench of their foe flowed over him as his trusted mount screamed in terror as the two slammed into the ranks of hell. Dark, foul blood flew as the knight's lance bit deep into one of the hell spawned thing, but even as he and the other knights crushed their foes under the hooves of the war horses, still more of the demons poured through the magical gateway.

"Would it ever end?" Sir Thomus said to himself as he fought deeper into the army of hell, trying in vain to reach the dark wizard that stood before the gateway to hell.

Realms is the newest Mini-game from Bad Baby Productions. Take the side of the bright human nations or the foul demon hoards, as the two battle for control of the world. A fast paced fantasy game of warfare, spells, magical items and mighty beasts, all will be under you control as you battle your foe. Can you out last, out fight and out maneuver your enemy, or will you fall to their sharp edged sword.

This game requires Realms: Elves & Orcs to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Kwiz
description:
In Kwiz: The Game of 100 Questions, the object is to answer correctly as many questions printed on the cards as possible. the WINNER is he who gains the greatest net score according to the rules.

This game dates from the 1930s.

name: SHORTS n' BRIEFS
description:
From the publisher:

SHORTS n' BRIEFS is an exciting and cranially challenging board game that tests your knowledge of common (and sometimes not so common) short forms and abbreviations.

Players move along the board by correctly identifying the full name of a given short form or abbreviation. For example, what do the letters IBM or BMW stand for? A clue is provided for each question. Be the first player to get your SHORTS n' BRIEFS into the laundry basket and YOU WIN!

It's easy - except watch out for the obstacles along the way that will make your quest an even greater challenge.

name: Trap-A-Check
description: Trap-A-Check is an abstract strategy game played inside a hexagon with 8 rings per side (yellow and red). The objective is to get the rings into certain formations to trap the opponent.

name: Chronicles of Aurum
description:
Each player commands a small army of units consisting of a knight, two archers, two pikemen, three infantry and four militia. The players choose one of ten maps on which to play. Each map uses a square grid to regulate movement.

Players adjust the counters on each unit to ten strength points. The players then place the units on the map. In turn, each player will move any and all units. When the units are within range of the enemy, they may engage in combat.

Damage done to the defending unit is determined by the lining up the strength points of the units involved on the Combat Wheel and reading the results.

name: Psychedelic No.9
description: There is no date on this but judging from the name and graphics, you can assume late 1960's to early 1970's. In this two player game, each player has either a red or blue card 3 1/2 in by 4 1/2 in. Each player in turn chooses one of 9 op-art puzzle pieces and places it on his/her card. The object is to find 3 pieces and only 3 pieces that will cover his card. If a player has 3 pieces on his card that don't completely cover it, he must return a piece to the "Pot" before taking another. Interestingly, it is not important to establish any relationship between the wild patterns on the pieces. Comes in a plastic case with an attached hang card.

name: Americana
description: Americana is a game of chance, played upon a board. Chips or counters and an ordinary pack of playing cards are essential to the game. By obtaining certain cards or combinations of cards (based upon traditional poker hands), the players try to obtain for themselves the greatest possible number of chips from the spaces on the board where they are placed at the start or during the play of each hand.

name: Missoula-opoly
description:
Missoula-opoly is another variant of the real estate acquiring game, Monopoly. Instead of buying properties in Atlantic City, players of Missoula-opoly compete to buy properties and businesses in Missoula, Montana.

The game was originally created as a fund raiser for Missoula Strings on Tour. The center of the board features artwork by Monte Dolack.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Exklusiv
description:
Each player represents a newspaper with an editor and two reporters at their disposal. With these workers, a player must bring the paper to the top. In the game, this is represented by a pyramid. Whomever gets the figure for their paper to the top of the pyramid is the winner.


Jeder Spieler vertritt eine Zeitung und hat dafür einen Redakteur und zwei Reporter zur Verfügung. Mit diesen Mitarbeitern soll er nun Spitzenleistungen erbringen. Im Spiel steht für diese Spitzenleistung eine Pyramide. Wer seine Figuren geschickt einsetzt, kann als erster oben sein.

name: Exagon
description:
Two or three players seek to overtake and defend the majority of the board space. This is easier, the more opposing pieces one can capture.


Zwei oder drei Spieler versuchen die Mehrzahl der Gebiete auf dem Spielplan zu erobern und zu verteidigen. Dies fällt umso leichter, je mehr Gegner man gefangennehmen kann.

name: Aussie Rules Super Fishin Adventure
description:
Players learn to recognize several varieties of sea creatures as they explore the sea in search of fish to bring to market. Over 20 different varieties of fish can be caught as players try to bring them to port for sale.

Players can buy new and better ships as they earn money.

Players must remember the locations of the good fishing spots on the modular board in order to win in this easy-to-learn game.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Educational, Exploration, Memory, Nautical
mechanics: Memory, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Intervenção na América Latina
description:
"Intervention in Latin America" is a Brazilian wargame dealing with the US and Soviet influence in Latin America during the Cold War.

More info about the game can be found at:
http://www.riachuelogames.com.br/america.htm

Rules are in Portuguese.

name: Reveal
description: Reveal is a jumping strategy game for two players. The 6x6 gameboard and 24 two-sided playing pieces are used in an Othello-reminding but quite different game idea. You win the game when only your color shows on the board, even if your turn has not ended and if neutral pieces remain. This game is available on its own and also playable with Kadon's Six-by-Six game system set.

name: Pseudo-Coup
description: Pseudo-Coup is another Sudoku-based game. Probably the most beautiful one made. The acrylic nine by nine grid includes laser-cut pieces in nine colors. This allows standard Sudoku to be played with colors instead of numbers (much more pleasing to the eye), and also includes rules for games with up to nine players based on square grids, triangular grids, and more.

name: Hmm...
description: Hmm... is a positional strategy game from Kadon. On a turn, players can move pieces in directions the start facing or to adjacent spaces., and the goal is to get 4-in-line first. The game is somewhat similar to Gipf though not as advanced. It is available on its own or playable with Kadon's Six-by-Six game set.

name: Der Goldene Schuss
description:
A German game based on one the most popular game shows on German television in the 1960s of the same title. The game includes a board, two plastic crossbows, pawns, dice, three plastic balls and a plastic figurine, as well as a cardboard with holes in it. Apparently, the player moves along the board by rolling dice. If he lands on a field with an apple or bulls-eye he has to shoot an arrow through the appropriate hole on the cardboard component. The player that reaches the bulls-eye in the center of the board first, wins.

(game number assigned by Noris: 626/2450)

name: Warum nicht?
description: A German question & answer game. (Assigned game number from Spear Spiele: 16352 or 96352)

name: Sew You Want To Be A Quilter
description:
The game is comprised of a Game Board, eight colored "Spools of Thread" (which are the game playing pieces), a single die (to control game flow), 3,000 quilting and sewing trivia "Question / Answer Cards" (6 questions and answers per card with a total of 500 cards, click on the Sample Questions spool to the left for an example, there are 1,000 questions and they change daily, 3 new questions per day so come back each day and test your knowledge), and 200 "Perk" and "Quirk" cards which bestow benefits or penalties respectively.

The goal of the game is to visit each of the four quilt stores located on the game board (Barnyard Quilts, Heavenly Quiltworks, Windmill Quilts and Riverview Quilts), as well as an additional number of locations decided upon by the game players. The duration of the game can be lengthened or shortened depending on the total number of locations that the players decide must be visited, however, at a minimum the players must visit all four of the quilt stores to win the game.

Home Page: http://www.sewyouwanttobeaquilter.com

name: Masakado chronicle
description:
The game was published in Command Magazine Japan Basic #1.

The samurai Taira no Masakado (平将門) rebelled in 939 against central government of Kyoto. His life is detailed in the Shōmonki (将門記).
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taira_no_Masakado
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tengy%C5%8D_no_Ran

name: Crucible of Courage
description:
Crucible of Courage introduces Richard Berg’s long-awaited Civil War Tactical System, The Rifled-Musket Game System

Crucible of Courage emphasizes the limits of command, training, and discipline, all in the light of what soldiers will do despite what their leaders want. Yes, all the weapons are present, including artillery, but the fun is in getting your men to use them in the most effective way. See why most Civil War combat was close-range firefights … or maybe you can find a way to change that!

Crucible of Courage includes five scenarios, all historical battles with their own maps and counters for the actual units, each a different view on the tactical details of the American Civil War.

Crucible of Courage scenarios:

1st Manassas (Virginia, July 21, 1861, the opening moments of the battle, Burnside’s 2nd RI vs The Louisiana Tigers)
Athens (Missouri, August 5, 1861, local militia, street-fighting, and hollowed logs as cannon)
James Island (SC, June 3, 1862, the Union’s initial attempt to attack Charleston by land)
Chickamauga (Georgia, September 18, 1862; Wilder's Brigade, armed with repeateres, holds the bridge against two brigades from Lidell's Division.
James Island, (SC, July 16 1863, the 54th Massachusetts Colored Regiment gets its baptism under fire

Crucible of Courage is designed for quick learning and easy play, a system that has almost unlimited possibilities. Game rules are short, but there are lots of charts and tables to cover every aspect of battle at this micro level. Playing time is 2-4 hours for any scenario.

name: Funny Things Happen
description:
A pretty simple board game, the object of which is to leave your home and get to work by taking advantage of good squares and avoiding bad hazard squares. The game box features some very nice seaside postcard style illustrations on both the box and the game board.

Looks like it could be a variant on Chutes and Ladders

name: Blondie Hurry Scurry Game
description:
In this 1966 Transogram game - Blondie, The Hurry Scurry Game which is based on the long running Blondie cartoon strip. Blondie and Dagwood figures dance their way around the board following Arthur Murray style dance pattern footprints.
Game comes with a spinner and cardboard figures of the characters. Game has both English and French translations of the rules.

name: Magilla Gorilla
description:
This is a spin and move game based on the 1964 cartoon show of the same name. In Magilla Gorilla, the protagonist spent his time languishing in the front display window of Mr. Peebles' pet shop, eating bananas and being a drain on the businessman's finances. Mr. Peebles marked down Magilla's price considerably, but Magilla was invariably only purchased for a short time, typically by some thieves who needed a gorilla to break into a bank or by an advertising company looking for a mascot for their new product. The customers always ended up returning Magilla, forcing Mr. Peebles to return their money. Magilla ended each episode with his catchphrase, "We'll try again next week."

The object of the game is to acquire Parrots, Cats and Monkeys which help to get you to the finish line instead of being returned to Mr. Peeples.

name: Tongue Tanglers
description:
Tongue Tanglers™ is a hilarious tongue-twister party game for up to 10 players. We don’t give you tongue-twisters to say - you create them for the your opponents from a set of cards.

Simple to play but tough to say, each player draws a card and places it into any position on any other player’s word pad. That player must now say their new tongue-twister as many times as they can in 10 seconds. Each successful read scores a point, but any mistake (and they’re usually funny!) ends the turn. So read slowly, or read fast, one mistake will be your last!

Tongue Tanglers includes card tray, 10 word pads, scoring markers, timer, instructions, and cards containing over 900 words specially selected for hours of hilarious party fun. 2-10 players, ages 8 to adult.

name: La Mer
description: Game about sea life. French author of the game Alain Bombard, worked as an oceanographic specialist in Monaco and did many expeditions including documentaries with Jacques Cousteau. This game is based upon his expeditions and tries to make people clear that the sea covers 71% of the earth and that it's health is important to us. The game has 25 cards and 4 pawns. It's a hard to find collectors game that covers fauna, flora, navigation and secrets of the sea.

name: Food Fight
description:
Chuck ducked under the flying burger as he made his way to his seat. The Jocks were at it again, he said to himself, sitting down next to the other geeks. Just then a milk shake flew overhead and exploded high over the Preppie's table. With a howl the Cheerleader leaped up and started screaming about how hard it was to get chocolate out of cashmere. Then it begun, the food started to fly between the tables, Jocks throwing chips and cola cans while the Preppies laid in with hot dogs and yogurt cups. Soon the whole cafeteria as a mess of flying food and gangs of students dodging and thrown their lunch.

Chuck sat lower in his chair, trying to avoid being hit and continued to eat his PB&J. That's when the bagel hit the fan, and he was hit with a cup of soap. Now it was war Chuck said to himself as he gathered up food of his own to throw.

This is food Fight, a fun, fast game of insanity. Can your team of teenagers out fight their dreaded and hated foes as the food flies and the fun begins.

One of Bad Baby's many Mini-game, Food Fight will allow you to make a mess and still have fun.

name: Conjurer
description:
Julia watched as her foe summoned a Hydra with a flourish and a puff of green smoke. Jarrird had always been a bit of a show off Julia thought as she watched the many-headed beast slither about on the ground before its new master.

No matter she smiled, her enemy could be as showy as he wanted to be, it would not stop her from crushing him under her boot heel. Knowing the Hydra would still be a bit dazed from its master's summoning spell, and thus vulnerable, Julia quickly sent her Goblins in to kill it. The small green warriors each drew their short sword and rushed the larger creature, each yelling a shrill battle cry as they charged. Julia knew the little green Goblins would have no chance against the many heads of the Hydra, but she hoped to at least hurt it a little bit so her Minotaur could finish the job. Once his last defender had been taken care of, well Jarrird would be next.

This is Conjurer, a new Mini-game from Bad Baby Productions. Play a skilled wizard as they battle other spell casters in a duel of summoning. Each magician has the skill to summon various monsters to their aid, monsters they then may send into battle in a desperate attempt to kill their foe before they themselves are dragged down. Skill, cunning and a little bit of luck is need to be a successful conjurer and thus master over all those that would stand against you.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Space Armada
description:
Ensign Jones grabbed a handrail as the federation missile slammed into the aft hull of the ship. The explosion rocked the ship he and the others were encased in, shacking it like some small child playing with a toy.

"Damn", he thought as he pulled himself along the passage tube, "Another hit like that and we might not survive this engagement." With the gravity turned off for battle stations, Jones found it hard to reach his station. Still he managed to make his way down the tube towards the beam weapon's controls. The captain wanted to make a quick pass on the federation carrier before it could launch all of its fighters. Jones thought it was a suicidal run at best, but the captain had been lucky so far and she might just pull it off, might Jones thought as the next missile hit home?

This is Space Armada, the newest Mini-game from Bad Baby Productions. Across our solar system, in the distant future, battle two mighty space fleets. The imperialistic Federation means to bring the whole of system under their sway. Meanwhile the Colonial Fleets, each a small, independent fleet in its own right have banded together to stop this move by the Federation. The fate of the human race now lies in your hands as you command one of those fleets. Will the Federation bring order and law to the solar system, or will the independent colonies and mining outposts remain free.

Space Armada is a fast past game of space fleet battles, wages across the solar system. Players will need to be decisive in their game play, all the while trying to protect their fleet's ships, waiting for the right moment to strike.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Dennis the Menace
description: This game from Standard Toycraft represents the Original TV show by this name. The TV show starred Jay North as Dennis, with first Joseph Kearns, who died in 1962 and then Gale Gordon as Mr. Wilson. The object of the game is catch Dennis as he moves around the neighborhood. Players take the part of Dennis' friends Margaret and Tommy and his mom and dad Henry and Alice in this roll and move effort to catch Dennis.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: BWAH!: Still Flyin'
description: An expasion for BWAH! The game BWAH! is based on the game BANG! re-themed for the "Firefly" universe created by Joss Whedon. Not a standalone game, "Only a hoe-tze duh pee goo would try to play with only these cards." This expansion includes 9 more characters and 9 more cards. The characters cards feature some minor characters in the TV series including a Reaver character. In addition, two new symbols affecting game play are introduced.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Criterium Degli Assi
description: Italian cycling game that was released by a small publisher from Milan in the 1940's. Although the game mechanics are very straightforward, the game board features very nice graphics, especially considering the age of the game.

name: Le Guidon d'Or
description: Each player has one cyclist. At each turn the player rolls the dice and move his or her cyclist. The board has 63 squares, the kilometer-mark squares double your throw. The game is like The Game of Goose. The first player who lands exactly on space 63 wins the game.

name: Itzuli Mitzuli
description: Beautiful and very rare cycling game produced in the Basque area of Spain in the 1970s, with an important nationalist vindication component. There are six boards representing the seven territories (Behe Nafarra and Xiberua share a board) vindicated by Basque nationalism. The rules are in Euskara (Basque), Breton, Spanish, Catalan and French. The components of the game are quite geometrical: triangular wooden pegs represent the riders and the graphics on the cards are quite abstract.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Les plus Beaux Tableaux du Monde
description: Educational card game by Nathan about painters. The game contains 48 cards with lots of info about paintings and painters on it.

name: Minéraux et Roches
description: Educational card game with an archeology theme that appeared in the '80s about rocks and minerals. Game contains 48 cards with lots of info on it.

name: Tous pour un Maillot
description: French cycling boardgame that appeared in the '80s or early '90s. The green gameboard has France on it with a road that represents the Tour de France. The game has wonderful metal cyclists that in 4 different colors, each for a player. There also is a cyclist with a yellow jersey to represent the leader and a rider with a blue cap to represent the leader in the Dauphiné Liberé race. The game has roll and move mechanics and it comes with 2 dice.

name: Quel est ce bruit?
description: Quel est ce bruit? (What is this noise?) is an educational game for learning French (intended for those whose native language is French). It consists of 6 boards of various scenes (e.g. camping scene). Using a cassette tape, you would play sounds/words and place disks as you identified these.

name: Minus 13
description:
Minus 13 is easiest described as a multi-player shut the box. Players take turns rolling 3 dice and removing colored chips from hexagonal pyramid that is made from six triangular parts. The players total up the numbers on the dice and remove the colored chip that sits on the corresponding number. If there is no chip left on that number then the player takes any number of chips from numbers that add up to the total of the roll. When a 13 is rolled the player must take chip that sits on top of the pyramid that is worth negative 13 points. If a player is unable to take chips that add up to his or her number (ie. another 13 is rolled) then they must pass one of their colored chips to the person on their left. In this way the "minus 13" chip can be passed on.

At the end of the game, each player rolls dice to determine how many points each colored chip is worth. The player holding the "minus 13" chip subtracts the appropriate amount of points and the person with the most points wins.

name: The Games of GODZ
description:
Subtitled "The Chameleon of Games", this is a game system for playing any of the 11 different games for which rules are supplied. Introduction text:

"The Games of GODZ is a unique and highly versatile game tool rather than a game in itself... the board is interpreted or subdivided in four different ways to allow the employment of different mathematical systems. Virtually all strategy game sin existence employ some method of mathematical logic thereby making it apparent "the Games of GODZ" is capable of utilizing many systems as the basis for a vast number of games.

The blocks are generally considered to be people and are therefore colored according to the four major races of the world. A block has an opening in one of its faces. This is used to indicate masculinity or femininity, depending on how it is placed on the board."

General rules explain different moves (where units move a number of squares equal to their value), "trick moves" (where units combine, merge, split, switch or piggyback), takes (capturing or converting the enemy), etc.. Specific rules tell which areas of the board are in play and what moves or takes are allowed. A deck of cards is used with some of the games.

Some games are mainly "movement" games, where the players have to move pieces into enemy or objective spaces, while others are "capture" games, where player have to kill all or specific enemy pieces. An interesting game in the set is "Cry", specifically for three players. One player plays with two other players, who are playing a different game, to score points by thwarting captures by either player - in effect, becoming a peacekeeper.

Game components:

- one board of 144 squares, divided into many colors and associations.
- 124 plastic blocks: 4 sets of 31 blocks each in red, white, yellow and black. Each set is made up of 16 "ones" (blocks are 1 cubic unit or 1x1x1), 8 "twos" (1x1x2), 4 "fours" (2x2x1), 2 "eights" (2x2x2) and 1 "sixteen" (2x2x4).
144 playing cards: 4 sets of 36 cards each marked in the same colors as the blocks (but not actually so colored) and with an associated letter (G for Brown, O for Red, D for White, and Z for Yellow). Cards are present in the same numbers as with the blocks, with five spares added to make 36 in a set.
- one booklet of 14 pages of general rules and specific rules, as well as rules on how to play Chess and Checkers with the game set.
- one sheet of directions on how to set up the first of the 11 games.

name: Coca-Cola Mini-Fußball
description:
Two player soccer game, comes packed in what looks like a Coca Cola can.. Each player has one plastic field player and tries to score goals. The first player to reach 10 points, wins.

Contents:
2 plastic soccer players
2 balls
1 soccer pitch (green mat with markings)
rules

name: Hustled History
description: This is a party game where the players are telling a story and adding 'mystery' words. It is, according to the directions, "A Laughable Round Party Game". It contains instructions and about 100 cards used during the storytelling of the game.

name: Six by Six
description: Six by Six is a game system from Kadon with a wooden board and four unique sets of pieces. The game has replaced Leap, an earlier Kadon game, but also is now greatly expandable to include several other games as included. These include maze games, maze solitaires, math gambits, and x-in-row designs. A very nice upgrade and nice new system for intriguing abstracts.

name: Boston T-Party
description: Boston T-Party is a limited edition game (only 100 made) and puzzle set from Kadon. The set includes 11 polyforms in unique shapes and three different colors. These can make four different t-shaped puzzles and numerous other figures. Like most Kadon polyform sets, the included guidebook includes many alternatives for use and game play.

name: Zatrikion
description:
Byzantium is the name given to both the state and the culture of the Hellenic Empire in the middle ages. Both the state and the inhabitants always called themselves Hellenes/Roman, as did most of their neighbors. Western Europeans, who had their own Roman Empire called them Orientals or Greeks (Hellenes). Byzantion was the ancient name of the capital city and Byzantines after the former name of the Empire's capital city, Constantinople.

Zatrikion is the game of Byzantine chess. This chess has seven variations according to the more ancient board game of "Pessoi".

These versions have all the known pawns of the modern chess ("Mad Queen" was the first name) and in some variations there are many other pawns connecting to the philosophy of the Byzantine era.

Played with Byzantine Greek era letters for 2 players as the modern chess.
In some versions are three dices with the ancient shapes of Byzantium era and in this version the highest roll starts the game.

Zatrikion has the following items:
1. Seven colorful Boards (Grids).
2. The pawns of each player with different color. In Byzantium era the colors was the veneti (red color) and the greens (green color). These were the political parties in Byzantium era.
3. Three dices with shapes.
4. Other material.
5. A book with some information for this game along with photos from the Byzantine era.

This board game will be soon in a new version.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Educational, Medieval, Memory, Religious

name: Hi-Ho! Color Go-Round
description: It's learning fun the Golden way as children match color dominoes along a spiraling color path. Color recognition and matching skills are reinforced. For ages 3 and up.

name: Spell-A-Puzzle
description: Shuffle all the tiles and give 5 to each player. Place all the remaining tiles in the center face down. Players race to find letters that match their words and the player who finishes all of their words first is the winner. For ages 4 and up.

name: Atlantaopoly
description:
Atlantaopoly is a game concerned with business trade in Atlanta. The object of the game is to accumulate as much wealth as possible through the purchase, trade, and development of businesses.

Board game spaces include Turner Broadcasting System, Friends of Zoo Atlanta, Atlanta History Center, The Carter Presidential Center, and Georgia-Pacific.

Players may improve their businesses by building high-rises (two, three, four, and five-story buildings) and eventually sky scapers.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: I Love v. Ribbeck
description:
" A game based on the ballad by Theodor Fontane. The garden is set up and the pears are distributed, depending on the number of players pears are put onto the tree, always at one side, or a player hands on pears to be put up. Pears must be taken with one hand and always from the same side, and be put onto a branch of the three. Depending on the variant, one harvests pears that fall from the unused side, and may keep them or give them away. The player with the most valuable pears after a preset number of rounds wins the game. Ballad printed in the rules.

Dexterity and tactical game * 2 or more players * no age given * Designer: Reinhold Wittig * Graphics: Karin und Reinhold Wittig * Edition Perlhuhn, Germany, 2005 *** Edition Perlhuhn * www.perlhuhn.de "

From www.spielen.at 2006/11/31

name: Peepul Pals
description: Card driven movement game for children. Based on the "Peepul Pals" line of books and dolls published by Whitman in the 1960's

name: Fun Fair Game
description: Players race around the State Fair ground stopping at attractions to collect prizes. Be the first player to collect 6 different prizes and you win.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bozo the Clown Circus Game
description:
Spin and move children's game. Based on the TV show Bozo the Clown. The board shows Bozo in the Circus,under the big top.

Climb the ladder, go across the high wire, if you fall there is a safety net, as you race to the finish line.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Yogi Bear: Go Fly a Kite Game
description: Spin and Move Children's game. Game Board featuring the animated characters of Yogi Bear, Boo-Boo Bear, Mr. Ranger, Quickdraw McGraw, Huckleberry Hound and others Flying kites.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Big Payoff
description: A football board game that is designed to be played while watching actual games on TV. Players place bets on the board indicating what play they think the offensive or defensive will make in the actual game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Real-time, Sports

name: The AlphaPets Game
description: This is a memory game where each player is trying to find and build the alphabet made of puzzle pieces of their chosen color.

name: Wichita Scene
description:
Get ready to experience the Wichita Scene! Live and work at an exciting pace, make and break deals, buy and sell property, finance and liquidate businesses!

You'll get to establish proper connections with the planning director, influence the board of realtors, confront a Labor Leader and deal with the Downtown Revitalization Committee.

You may have thought Wichita doesn't have a scene... well, that may be true. But now, YOU can live the dream!

name: The Bee Safe or Bee Sorry Game
description:
The Bee Safe or Be Sorry Game helps kids be aware of dangers. It features "Stinger" and "Buzzie".

The age recommendation is 4 and up.

The players are represented by playing pieces which are shapes, a square, a circle, a triangle, and a rectangle. There are Honeycomb cards, Stinging Bee cards, Safety First cards, Buzzie Bee cards, Safehouse cards, Stranger Cards, and a spinner.

Players start with three Honeycomb cards and move about the board drawing the other cards. The other cards have situations on them that are to be read and then directions to either move (forwards or backwards) and/or draw/lose Honeycomb cards. The situations all have to do with safety.

Th winner is the first to reach the hive first or obtain 15 Honeycomb cards!
publishers: Tee Pee Toys, Jessup Paper Box Co.

name: Kick-O-Mania
description:
Kick-o-Mania is a dexterity soccer/football game played on a large 4x7 foot playing field. The figures are fully positionable and controlled by your actions.

Rules and a full range of figures and game accessories are available in stores or through the website http://www.kick-o-mania.com

name: Dungeon Dwellers' Fantasy Boardgame
description:
From the publisher:

An entirely new concept in the RPG-boardgame hybrid genre. A d20 based boardgame equally as usable as an occasional distraction or full fledged campaign.

Some features of the boardgame:

d20 ensures a familiar basis and a quality rules set
32 page rule book containing 6 core races, 12 core classes, and 52 unique special abilities
60 full color folding miniatures for your characters, usable for this boardgame or any other purpose
A starter dungeon to get everything started, including full color maps and unique monsters with folding miniatures of their own
Beautiful illustrations by V. Shane, Sacrosanct Games, and Octavirate Entertainment

name: Shell Out
description: The game is played on a hexagon board composed of 6 blue triangle fields known as Playing Fields. The Playing Fields are divided by rows of red playing spots running toward the center of the board known as Alleys. These Alleys may be traveled from one end to another in a single move if desired. In each game there are 30 shells divided into groups of 5, each group has a different color. There are also 6 counters numbered 5,10,15,20,25 and 50. At the beginning each player draws a counter, looks at it and then places it beneath one of his shells so that no opponent knows under which shell the counter is. . The object of the game is to move a shell into the SHELL OUT area of an opponent. You may attempt to capture a shell of your opponent. If you are next to a opponents shell you simply jump on it. Most shells have nothing under them and simply result in your losing your shell. If you find the shell with the scoring marker under it you score it. The hand is over when someone moves a loaded shell unto the opponents SHELL OUT area.

name: Achtung Panzer: Company Level Combat on the Eastern Front 1941-1945
description: A company level game of World War II combat. First in a new series by L2 Design group. The first game includes four geomorphic maps, while other games in the planned series include one on Berlin 1945 and one on Stalingrad which will feature historical terrain.

name: The National Bicycle Game
description: Early 20th century roll and move Bicycle race game. The colorful board represents a 100 mile race. Published in Australia.

name: Tour de France
description:
A very different type of roll and move game.

The board has been replaced by two rolled paper bands in plastic boxes. The Bikes with riders sit on top.

Dice are rolled to determine how far your rider goes, but instead of moving the rider across a board, you simply turn the rollers to advance the roll (which serves as the tracks).

name: Vier Länder Tour
description: Roll and move bicycle race game set in the Alps. Austrian publisher.

name: Hold the Phone
description: All players must hold hands to make Tommy the telephone talk. Tommy tells you what picture to find by making silly sounds. When Tommy says Time's Up, the person with the most discs wins.

name: Tummenspelet
description:
Children´s game featuring Tummen (The Thumb), the character from the books of Inger Sandberg. Players roll the die and pick pieces from the box. Pieces have different colors on either end, e.g. yellow/blue pieces, red/green pieces. Each player is trying to make the longest row by connecting ends of the same color. If the die shows the Tummen side the player make take any piece, even from an opponent. This is where the puppets are used: The puppet is put on the player´s thumb and pointed at the piece the player wants. Longest row of pieces wins.

Contents:
49 puzzle pieces
Die w/ labels
4 thumb puppets
Rules

4 years and up
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Vi i femman
description:
Themed on a Swedish TV-quiz for school kids, this game pits 2-4 players or teams against each other. Players answer questions and perform tricky tasks with a time limit. Score markers are moved on a track, and some spaces on the track will trigger a die roll that decides whether players score positive or negative points. This adds a considerable random element.

Contents:
Scoring track
4 pawns
4 White boards
4 pencils and erasers
330 cards
10 topic cards
10 topic markers
Die
Timer
4 puzzles
1 plastic stand

10 years and up
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time, Trivia

name: Kauf bei Mir
description:
From the promotional packaging inside of Zitadelle, viewable in Image 138790.

We need bread, meat, salt, fruit, dishes, and many more things for our household. We can find these wares in five stores, or we can buy them in the countryside. A new game that combines a lotto game with the ideals of a dice game.

name: Teufelsrad
description:
From the promotional packaging inside of Zitadelle, viewable in Image 138790.

An interesting and varied board game. Like in the game Halma, players must get their pieces into an opposite field. However, the way to get there is over a turntable that one is allowed to turn one quarter, so long as there is another piece in the goal. That is how the fortune of the party will most change.

Game rules:

This game can be played with up to 4 players.
Each player gets 10 meeples, of which 6 are
to be moved into the opposite destination spaces
of the same color.

The starting player is determined by chance.
The meeples can jump over other meeples of the same
or any other color to get to the destination
spaces (jumping is done like in the Halma game).

Every time a player gets one of his meeples on a
destination space, the turntable gets turned a quarter
turn to the right.

This provides for variety in the gameplay, because
every turn changes the position of the meeples
for every player.

The winner is the player, who is the first to get 6
meeples on the destination spaces.

The 4 remaining meeples are without importance for the
outcome of the game.


Note: This game is played without a die.
publishers: Otto Maier Verlag, Verlag Volk und Bild

name: Jugandoconpalabras
description:
A bilingual word game that uses a game board representing various rooms in a middle school.

The goal is to be the first player to complete proper Spanish sentences in each of eight rooms.

The objectives of this board game are twofold:

1. To teach bilingual students proper Spanish sentence structure.

2. The game also introduces students to the challenges they will face upon entering middle school.

name: Scarney Dice
description:
The Scarney Dice set includes 5 special Scarney dice(each d6 contains a 1,3,4,6 and "dead" on 2 opposite sides), a dice cup, chips and 80 page rule book describing more than 40 different dice games that may be played with these dice.

Some of the games include:

Scarney Put and Take Dice
Scarney Duplicate Jackpots
Scarney 21 Up and Down

name: Today with Dave Garroway
description:
Simple spin-and-move game distinguished only by presentation. The pawns are lead figures designed to resemble television cameras. The backdrop to the gameboard has pop-up figures giving the gameboard a 3-D effect. The game comes with a xylophone that must be played or the participant who misses the cue is penalized. The first to reach the finish space is the winner.

An unusual place on the GameBoard is the Station Break Area which is represented by clock symbols. If you land on or pass over one of these Station Breaks you must ring the TIME SIGNAL TONES to properly identify the network. If you fail to do so you must move your camera back 15 spaces.

name: Future Tank
description:
From the back of the rule book:

FUTURE TANK

Future tank is a two-player board game pitting players against each other with tank armies of their own choosing!

Players have four different types of tanks to choose from in which to build their armies:

1) Fast-Assault Tanks: Quick, highly maneuverable and able to outflank any other tank with cutting precision.

2) Light-Assault Tanks: Fast, but more heavily armored and more heavily weaponed. It can pack a solid punch.

3) Heavy-Assault Tanks: Slow, but carry the biggest gun!

4) Missile Tanks: Slow and heavily armored. Able to kill from a distance.

Rules are easy-to-read and play-action can let you start blasting away in the first turn! Terrain features are optional and six scenarios are included.

Average Play Time: 20-40 Minutes."

Played on a chess board, this games uses either the photocopied "counters" from the book, or minis of your choosing. You will also need a D4, D6, D8 and D12. A basic move and attack format. Lighter moves further and heaver shoots further. Each tank has a diagram showing its armor amounts (think SFB shields) and has ratings for movement, firing ranges and weapon damage.

name: The $64,000 Question
description:
THE $64,000 QUESTION is a board game based on the UK version of the TV Game Show. The aim of the game is to work along a question path answering questions and enter 'the isolator' to answer the $64,000 question. The first player to get the $64,000 question correct is the winner.

Questions are categorized into 10 subject areas which are selected by the roll of a 10 sided die. An additional category is provided when playing with younger players.

name: Risks and Rhymes
description:
Purple Ronnie's Groovy Game of RISKS AND RHYMES is an adult game involving moving around a board, making up poems, acting and drinking (preferably alcoholic beverages)

There are two decks of cards:
the first represents different character types (i.e.slob, sex goddess, mummy's boy ...)
the second comprises risks and rhymes. Risk cards involve acting out whatever is written on the card. The rhyme cards contain a short poem to which the final line needs to be added.

Players move round the board as per the roll of a die. The space they land on determines what action they need to perform:
- Borrow a character card from another player
- Miss a turn
- take a Risk and Rhymes card for themselves or another player
- Roll again
- Give a character card to another player

All risks and rhymes must be performed in the style of the character card in play at the time with a successful performance resulting in winning of that character card. The winner is the player who, at the end of the game, has collected the most character cards.

name: Disaster!
description:
DISASTER! is for ages 8 and up, 2 to 4 players with an average playing time 15 - 30 minutes.
Learn about natural disasters and how they affect the U.S, including how scientists rank the strengths of the different disasters. Learn which geographic areas are at risk and how the seasons affect a disaster's occurrence. Tornadoes, earthquakes, hurricanes, floods, wildfires... are just a few of the disasters that you'll face in this game. Game includes: Deck of 59 full color board Disaster & Defense playing cards, full-color game board featuring map of US, 15 color territory marker pieces.

Each card contains facts and information about specific historical disasters. In DISASTER!, you want to control territories of the US that are worth different points. You gain territories by playing disaster cards against your opponent's territories, like a hurricane against Florida. But your opponent might have a defense... like The National Hurricane Center... To block you. Each game last 16 turns, with each turn a different season. Many disasters can only be played during certain seasons. At end of the last turn , add up your points for the territories you control, the player with the highest points wins!

name: Confucianism and the Succession Crisis of the Wanli Emperor, 1587
description:
From Description:

Confucianism and the Succession Crisis of the Wanli Emperor, 1587 seeks to introduce undergraduate students to the suppleness and power of Confucian thought as applied to issues of governance during the Ming dynasty. The game is set in the Hanlin Academy. Most students are members of the Grand Secretariat of the Hanlin Academy, the body of top-ranking graduates of the civil service examination who serve as advisers to the Wanli emperor. Some Grand Secretaries are Confucian "purists,” who hold that tradition obliges the emperor to name his first-born son as successor; others, in support of the most senior of the Grand Secretaries, maintain that it is within the emperor’s right to choose his successor; and still others, as they decide this matter among many issues confronting the empire, continue to scrutinize the teachings of Confucianism for guidance. The game unfolds amidst the secrecy and intrigue within the walls of the Forbidden City, as scholars struggle to apply Confucian precepts to a dynasty in peril.
mechanics: Simulation, Storytelling, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Känner du Pippi Långstrump
description:
Children´s trivia game about Pippi Longstocking and friends.

Each player receives eight tiles with pictures from the books. Players lay them on the table in front of them and memorize the order of the pictures. Then they turn their tiles face-down. Players are then ready to take turns rolling the die and moving on the board.

If they land on a red spot, the game master picks up a red card and reads a quote from a story. The text is associated with one of the pictures on the players´ tiles. The first player to turn up the right tile gets a freckle painted in her face - a make-up stick is included in the game! As you know, Pippi is proud of her freckles.

If they land on a yellow spot, they get one freckle.

If they land on a green spot, the player answers a question from a card. If correct, the player gets one gold coin.

The first player to land on one of the blue spots gets the coin that was placed their before game start. No new coins are added during the game.

The first player to reach the finish gets three coins. The winner is the player with most points (total of freckles and coins!).

Age 5 years and up. Children will need someone to read the cards.

name: Town Hall
description:
This is an early tile-placement game. The equipment consists of 80 hexagonal wooden tiles - 10 house tiles for each player, 1 town hall tile, and 39 road tiles of various configurations.

Players play a road tile of their choice each turn in an effort to create empty spaces with exactly three neighbors, in which they can place their houses. The object is place all of one's house tiles and then the town hall tile.

A slightly altered version was published (probably in the 1960s) by Whitman, with cardboard tiles.

name: Terrific Tagada
description: A racing game for children (3+ years). 6 different cardboard animals and riders are included in the box. They are folded in the middle and a string passed through them and tied to a chair or table. Players then jolt the string up and down so that their animal moves and try to reach the goal first.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Racing

name: Aquamemo
description: A waterproof memory game for children (4+ years) to play in the tub. Find the pairs from all the fish floating in the water.

name: Mystery Star
description: A card game for children (9+ years). Players have to guess who the Mystery Star is by asking the right questions and paying attention to the questions the others make.

name: Batabille
description:
A card game for children (6+ years).

From the publisher: "Game of competition and speed.
Round like marbles, the cards follow one another at a hellish rate. Good reflex and observation are necessary to win this fast contest!"
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Hi! Hi! Hi!
description:
A board game for children (6+ years).

From the publisher:

"A memory and strategy game.
Brave Little Imps cross the dangerous Enchanted Forest. But beware of the horrible Witches. The imps have to evade their evil spells in order to reach Wonderland !"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Piranhas
description:
A board game for children (5+ years).

From the publisher:

"A terrific fishing game. 18 fish swim leisurely in the water. Which fisherman will catch the most piranhas?"

name: Defining a Nation: India on the Eve of Independence, 1945
description:
From description: Defining a Nation: India on the Eve of Independence,1945 is set at Simla, in the foothills of the Himalayas, where the British viceroy has invited leaders of various religious and political constituencies to work out the future of Britain’s largest colony. Will the British transfer power to the Indian National Congress, which claims to speak for all Indians? Or will a separate Muslim state—Pakistan—be carved out of India to be ruled by Muslims, as the Muslim League proposes? And what will happen to the vulnerable minorities—such as the Sikhs and untouchables—or the hundreds of princely states? As British authority wanes, smoldering tensions among Hindus, Muslims, and Sikhs increasingly flare into violent riots that threaten to ignite all India. Towering above it all is the frail but formidable figure of Gandhi, whom some revere as an apostle of non-violence and others regard as a conniving Hindu politician. Students struggle to reconcile religious identity with nation building—perhaps the most intractable and important issue of the modern world. Texts include the literature of Hindu revival (Chatterjee, Tagore and Tilak); the Koran and the literature of Islamic nationalism (Iqbal); and the writings of Ambedkar, Nehru, Jinnah, and Gandhi.

As in other Reacting to the Past games, participants are given secret role sheets with victory objectives. Debate and negotiation are the major mechanics used in this game.
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Henry VIII and the Reformation Parliament
description: From Description: Henry VIII and the Reformation Parliament transforms students into lords and commoners and members of the English parliament during the tumultuous years of 1529-1536. Cardinal Wolsey has just been dismissed as lord chancellor for failing to obtain from the pope the divorce king Henry is seeking from Catherine of Aragon, his wife of twenty years. Thomas More is named as Wolsey’s replacement. More presides over a newly summoned parliament, which the king hopes will somehow find the legal means to annul his marriage to Catherine, thus allowing him to proceed with his plans to marry Anne Boleyn and have by her a male heir. But will parliament find the means, and will it be satisfied with solving the king’s marital and dynastic problems? There are some in parliament who wish to use the royal divorce, as well as the rising anti-clericalism in the land, to effect a split from Rome and a conversion of England from Catholicism to Protestantism. Other members oppose the divorce, oppose making the king head of the English church, and, most of all, oppose this new, heretical creed filtering in from the continent. More is their leader, for as long as he can survive. Thomas Cromwell leads the king’s party. One problem is that the king is ambivalent about the reform effort unleashed by his so called “great matter,” and so the conservatives are free to prosecute reformers as heretics, while the reformers are free to prosecute conservatives as traitors. Conservatives are liable to this charge because their frustration at home tempts them to consider petitioning the king of Spain and Holy Roman Emperor to invade England on behalf of Catholic Europe. The game reaches its dramatic climax around the trial of Anne Boleyn, staged as a grand contest between opposing parties, which parties actually are multiple and fluid. All roles are individualized and most are historically based. At issue is the clash of four contending ideas: medieval Catholicism, Lutheranism, Renaissance humanism, and Machiavellian statecraft. Students read works representative of all traditions.
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Simulation, Voting

name: Cry Havoc
description:
Each player has two dice to move around the board which has an Inside and Outside track. A dice on the Inside track must be moved before one on the Outside track. Dice on the Inside track move the number of spaces rolled and try to get back to the Outside track. Dice on the Outside track have more interesting movement options -- (a) move the number rolled, (b) roll 2,3,4,5 and move to that space on the Outside track if it is empty, (c) match a number showing on an opponents dice and take it's place while moving it to the Inside track, (d) roll one less than a number showing on another dice and move to the space just in front of that dice, (e) roll one more than a a number showing on another dice and move to the space just behind that dice. Any move that causes one to land on an opponent's dice, moves that dice to the Inside track.
The game goal is to land one's dice on one's GOAL space on the Oustside track. Each time a player scores a goal, he moves the scoring cube one stage on the scoring track towards his High Stage. The scoring track is in the shape of an X. The four tips of the X are the High Stage for each player. The center of the X is the Zero Stage. If another player scores first, a second scoring player would move the scoring cube back to the Zero Stage. From the Zero Stage, a player would win by scoring 3 consecutive goals.
There is also a short version of the game where the scoring cube is not used and the first player to 3 goals wins.

name: Dungeon Tricks
description: 4 player Trick Taking card game with a Fantasy Dungeon-Crawl Theme. There are 4 Suits: Treasures, Monsters, Heroes, and Traps. Monsters Trump Treasures, Heroes Trump Monsters, and Traps Trump Heroes. Players score after all tricks are taken. Treasures & Heroes are Positive. Monsters & Traps are Negative. Highest total positive score wins the round. Win 2 rounds to win the game. Some cards have extra Trump taking Ability. A complete copy of the Rules is available for free at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/DUT.html

name: Propertunity
description:
Players are property developers seeking to achieve the pre-determined victory conditions by aquiring property and selling at a profit. Income is gained from holding properties and getting rent,but along the way disasters can befall the struggling developer and there are the ever-present expenses to be paid. The winner is the first to achieve the pre-arranged victory conditions; these are agreed by the players and range from playing for a time limit to holding x number of properties and x amount of cash; thus the game length is variable based on the time avaiable.

The game is produced and published privately.

Home Page: http://www.Propertunity.com

name: Think Negative! The Aids Prevention Game
description:
A standard roll and move trivia game with questions and open thought issues discussing Aids, sexual health, contraceptives, and so on.

Available in English, French, and German.

name: Spilungo
description:
Very simple children game. Players draw tiles and place them to complete the teddy bear body. The player who first completes the teddy bear wins.
Recommended age is 4+.

name: Den Store Klassekamp
description:
It's the first day of school, and children are trying to get into the classroom as late as possible so that they will get the seats in the back (farther away from the teacher).

This is a roll-and-move dice game. Each player gets a secret objective card stating the desired seat for each child; at the end of the game, each player scores points only for the kids that are seated according to his/her objective card (the seats in the back being more valuable than the seats in the front).

name: Silverado
description: In this simultaneous action selection game you compete to enlarge the Wild West township of Silverado. You can move your family members into the new businesses that have been built but your opponents may call upon bandits or Indians to thwart your plans. Disputes are often decided by shoot-outs. Each year on Thanksgiving Day the citizens of Silverado compete (via blind bid) and the most reputable move closer (on the scoring track) to discovering the mine.

name: Washington Scene
description:
A Washington D. C.-themed, Monopoly-style game.

From the publisher:

"Persuade the President; influence a Senator; hire a Lobbyist; and retain a prestigious Law Firm to help you avoid government regulations."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Call Kelly
description: Call Kelly is a promotional game based on the Temp Service Industry. It was created by Games for Industry in Cooperation with the people of Kelly Girl Temp. Services.

name: Heidi Elevator Game
description: Simple game based on the popular HEIDI "pocketbook doll" as seen on television at the time. Most likely used as an advertisement tool to promote the doll itself. Roll and Move.

name: Stamp Collectors Game
description:
Publisher's description:

"The Stamp Collectors Game has a value beyond that of an ordinary game because it is played with real stamps. Enjoy the excitement and suspense of completing your own authentic stamp collection by auctioning and trading with your fellow players."

Components include: board, 6 pawns, a die, 60 real stamps, 1 Stamp Vault Packet, 6 Stamp Album Cards, 20 Traders Certificates, and $2,140,000 in play money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Houston Scene
description:
A Houston-themed, Monopoly-style game.

From the publisher:

"Wheel and deal in the Oil Industry, persuade a Developer, join the Proper Club--all part of the Houston Scene."

The object of Houston Scene game is to accumulate wealth. A player buys
Ownership Cards representing various properties and businesses. A player
may develop his acquisitions once he has made a "deal" with some of the Power Groups that control business in Houston. The game ends when all the players are bankrupt except one, or at a predetermined time
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Groovy Games, John N. Hansen Co., Inc.

name: Soul Influence
description:
From the publisher's website:
"Take on the role of a recruiter for Heaven or Hell in this card game of soul acquisition! Souls come under your influence during the last four acts of their lives. If you can influence them to take Good or Evil actions, you nudge them closer to joining your employer in Heaven or Hell. Most souls come to you with one foot in Heaven or Hell, so take that into consideration when deciding which souls to go after. Special Sunday School version included!"

Available for free download at: http://www.wilcotgroup.com/free/index.html

name: Double-Entendre
description:
From the publisher's website:
"It's the battle of the puns! Two clever teams battle it out for the title of "PunMeisters" in this Pun-Ultimate game of witticisms. For those people that treat English as their second language, this is the game for you! A topic is drawn and teams try to create as many puns as they can within a time limit. The "Dueling Puns" round pits the teams in a back-and-forth escalation of puns!"

Available for free download at: http://www.wilcotgroup.com/free/index.html

name: Hexadelic
description:
The Hexadelic equipment consists of 68 diamond-shaped tiles, 14 triangular tiles, 6 tile racks, and a board. The board is divided into triangles which are grouped into hexagons of various colors.

Each player has a hand of diamond tiles and plays one on each turn, in such a way as to match the tile and board colors (the triangles making up each diamond tile may be the same color or two different colors). Triangular tiles may be drawn and used to complete hexagons. Completing a hexagon (by any means) scores points based on the hexagon's color.

name: Cowoga
description:
COWOGA (pronounced CO-WOE'-GA) stands for "COmpetitive WOrd GAme" and may be played by any number of players. Recommended for ages 8 to adult.

The equipment consists of one standard 6 sided die, and red and blue dice that have six letters on each of the six sides of each die.

Each of the colored dice are rolled in conjunction with the standard die which determine two of the letters that must be in the words you form with them.

name: Philip Marlowe Game
description: Game about the paperback novel fictional Private Eye from the 1940's who eventually becomes a TV series in the late 1950's. The Philip Marlowe Game from Transogram requires you to be the first to solve the crime in order to win. Game has both dice and spinner and is in the same vein as Clue.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Players and Playwrights
description: Board Game with a Shakespeare Theme. Each player takes the role of a Theater Troupe during the English Renaissance. A Special deck with suites of cards for Actors, Playwrights, Plays, Dramatic Devices, Stage Props, Troupes, and Theaters is used to stage performances and earn gold. The most profitable Troupe wins. Complete rule set is available for free at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/PAP.html

name: Tour de Suisse
description:
This roll & move board game follows exactly the stages of the 1935 Tour de Suisse: Zurich - St.Moritz - Lugano - Luzern - Genève - Bern - Olten - Zurich. The 6-sided die contains symbols that are explained on the game board.

This is a promotional game for a store in Olten. The 1935 edition of the Tour de Suisse had a stage finish in Olten, which was not common (it happened again in 1948, and there we had to wait until the 1970s to find another stage finish in Olten). Having a stage finish in town is a good excuse to make a cycling game, especially if you have a bike shop.

name: The Bike Race Game
description: This cute children cycling game was produced in New-York by the Master Toy Corporation. It featured a small board with wholes in it(29x29cm) with 4 cyclists. The cyclist were pinned on a pawn that allowed it to put it in the wholes on the track of the cyclist (each cyclist had it's own separate track) on the board. What makes it original is that movement was not determined by dice but by a spinning device.

name: Fiabe e Pedali
description: One of several games released in Italy by Corriere dei Piccoli . Fiabe e Pedali (released in June 1962) is considered the weirdest of them. This game is translated as “Fables and Pedals”. The rules start with: “Since France is the country of fables, we have thought of a game that unites sport to the fascination of fables”. Like many cycling games this one is also based on the famous Tour de France, it featured simplistic role and move mechanics.

name: Jeu du Kangourou
description: A spring-loaded dexterity game where the goal of the game is to try to put as many objects on the Kangaroo before it jumps and shakes of the objects. It is aimed at children starting from age 4.

name: Les As de la Route
description: Simple role & move cycling game that was released in Paris to promote the Tour de France edition of 1935.

name: Trotti
description: Italian vintage soccer game from the '60s or '70s. It featured a board with a football pitch and two teams: the national teams from Italy (in blue outfit) and West-Germany (white outfit).

name: Mighty Mouse Playhouse Rescue Game
description: This game is based on the Mighty Mouse cartoon and is a simple roll and move game. Mighty Mouse tries to save characters like Heckle & Jeckle and The Terry Bears from the clutches of the villain "Oil Can Harry".

name: Mr. Doodle's Dog
description:
The game board comes with tokens representing the players, a fancy DOG piece representing the dog of course and a set of rings that represent the bones that the dog picks up. The rules seem to favor the dog. That's how it should be.

The dog involved is a rascal, and prone to stealing and burying bones. The official rules describe him as being "clever." Translation: this dog will steal you blind.
The object of the game is to catch this clever dog before he returns to his dog house with his loot ... or bones.

name: It's about time
description:
The game is based on the TV series by the same name which starred Jack Mullaney and Frank Aletter as astronauts, who after breaking the speed of light, accidently travel back in time to prehistoric Earth. Unable to return, they make friends with the "natives" played by Imogene Coca as "Shadd" and Joe E. Ross ("OOH, OOH" - Officer Tooty from 'Car 54, Where Are You?' fame) as "Gronk".

Halfway through the one-season run, the plot was reversed in an attempt to bolster the show's ratings. The two astronauts, who had traveled back in time, now found a way to return to 1966 and took the stone-age family with them - so the rest of the run played out with Gronk, Shadd, et al trying to adjust to life in 1966-era NYC.

This is a simple roll and move game similar to many of the times.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: My Favorite Martian
description:
The My Favorite Martian Game is based on a television show by the same name from the early 1960's starring Bill Bixby as "Tim" and Ray Walston as alien "Uncle Martin" who has just crashed into earth.

Game includes four Martian figures on two "Brain Waves," one "Earth" disk, one metal holder, four plastic markers, four plastic scoring picks, two dice and 24 cards. Also included is a fold-out game board which has large image of Earth at center and comical images of Uncle Martin and various other items.
categories: Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Howzat
description: Howzat is an unusual game designed to master the four fundamental operations of Arithmetic i.e. (+, -, x, /), while playing. Each player competes to play out all of his tiles and to win. While doing so his/her basic skills in arithmetic are sharpened. Howzat is uncomplicated... yet it is fascinating and a challenge for the whole family to enjoy together!

name: Tessaron
description:
From Publisher:

"The goal is simple: control every stack on the board.
The higher your stacks, the greater your reach. But to use that reach, you must unstack your pieces, and unstacking may release an opponent's piece that will be used against you. Pieces can move across the entire board in one turn, so you must think globally as well as locally. Tessaron is a different game every time you play. The tide can turn at any moment, so you will have to stay on your toes. The rules are easy to learn, but it could take a lifetime to develop a winning strategy!"

name: Point of No Return
description:
Point of No Return is a simple spaceship combat game. The game is played with counters on a hex grid. Movement alternates between players, one ship at a time. Combat is resolved simultaneously.

A simple record is maintained for each ship, e.g.:
Brazil (South American Warship) : 20 hull points, 2 Launchers, 2 Lasers, 2 Computers

Features include:


Abstracted inertial movement
Ship design
Fuel consumption
Missiles
Repair Facilities
1 scenario

name: Derby
description: Belgian Soccer game released in the '80s. It was based upon the now legendary derby matches between Standard Liege and the defunct Club Liège (Club Luik).

name: Nothing but the Truth
description:
From the box:
"Our latest travel game with a mirth provoking twist"

This is a kind of Treasure Hunt. The box contains twelve 'Teaser' cards and twelve 'Key' cards. The Key cards bear a list of words, and for each word there is a related trivia question that may be true or false, and a 'next' word that is to be found on one of the other Key cards. The Teaser cards bear a single unique printed word, each to be found on a different one of the Key cards, and space to write in eleven more. The Key cards are distributed around the playing area (maybe a room, a garden, or larger area) and the players travel between them, following their chain of words. Points are awarded for both speed of completion, and accuracy in answering the trivia questions.

The Teaser cards are in fact double-sided, with a different word on each side, allowing two rounds. The box states that additional Teaser cards can be bought, as replacements or to increase the number of players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia

name: Topper
description:
"The object of the game is for each player to cover all the circular openings in his section with Topper pieces. EVERY PLAYER PLAYS ON EACH SPIN.
If the color black appears in the section of the player who has just turned the spinner, he can demand that one of the other players remove a Topper piece. from this section as a penalty."

name: Substitute Golf
description: The game of SUBSTITUTE GOLF is comprised of 9 beautifully lithographed Boards (10"x22") representing the 9 holes of the indoor course. 7 disks representing Driver, Brassie, Cleek, Mid-Iron, Mashie, Niblick and Putter, 2 spinning blocks, 4 ball markers and Score Pads. Spinning those 7 disks give results as to the distance and direction that the ball has gone. Using the putter disk then decides if the putt has gone into the hole. The directions include ways for 8 or as many as 16 players to compete in a tournament with the winner getting some kind of prize that the host provides.

name: Strategy Seven "The Board Game"
description:
Strategy Seven is a new, single and multi-player "puzzle board game" that will put your logical deduction and memory skills to the test. With millions of variations, you will never have to play the same game twice!

Strategy Seven can be played as a single or multi-player game. It is a unique game that can be tailored to increase the level of difficulty to suit the player/s. Each game includes three Code discs ranging in difficulty from level 1 to level 3. There are additional "Collectors" Code discs available (from level 3 to level 7).

You can increase or decrease the difficulty of each game by choosing various ways of setting up the board. The markers can all be placed on the board with the colored sides facing up to play an easier game. For a more challenging game, the markers can be placed on the board with the numbered sides facing up.

The objective of the game is to re-arrange moving pieces, by rotating the center code disc, to enable you to move desired components to their correct locations.

Home Page: http://www.stencils.co.za/Strategy.htm
categories: Deduction, Educational, Math, Memory, Number, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Memory, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: The Life of Paul
description: Follow Paul on his three missionary Journeys. Test your knowledge and learn more about the Bible as you reinforce positive Christian values and provide lots of fun for all. Third in the Bible Journeys series. Ages 8 and up. Includes game board, playing pieces, and question cards.

name: Uncle Sam at War with Spain
description:
Game published in 1897 by the Rhode Island Game Company.

The object of the game is to capture with the small discs or men the ships and territory of the opposing player.

The game board features spots for Admiral Dewey, Admiral Sampson, Admiral Cavery and Admiral Motijo and spaces for Torpedo, Short on Coal, Out of ammunition and Mines. The board is divided with each side in possession of half at the beginning. Object of the game is to take over all of the opposing men

The game board also features drawings of famous ships that actually took part in the War. American Cruisers; Vesurtux, Olympia & Brooklyn along with Battleships; Massachusetts, Oregon and Iowa.

Players have 10 men and a Flagman who move depending on a spin, but once a piece crosses into the other players territory that piece is moved either left or right depending on whether or not the roll was odd or even. When a man stops on a square marked Mine, Torpedo or Out of Ammunition in an enemy territory he must return to his side of the board.

name: Trade
description:
TRADE is a game made by Artray of Montclair, NJ in 1933. The game comes with 4 puzzles of 16 pieces each. The puzzle pieces are shuffled together and then dealt out to the players. Each player then turns up picture side and assembles as many pieces as possible of each puzzle, the object being to complete the picture of which the player has the most pieces.

The player to the left then selects a piece from another player and trades one of his own for that piece. Each player in turn does that until one player completes a puzzle.

Score as follows; Each player other than the winner scores for each piece of the puzzle completed while the winner scores 25 points for completing the puzzle.

After a puzzle is done mix the pieces up again and begin a new hand. 50 or 100 points needed to win the game.

name: The Game of Rival Doctors
description:
Old Mr. Holmes of Homesville, a very rich man living about 20 miles from the Village of Spruceville, having taken suddenly ill sends his colored boy (I know that this is politically incorrect but the rules do in fact state that and for completeness I have included it) Tom to the village to summon a doctor. Several Doctors head for Homesville and the game is based on their journey.

Each player takes one piece to represent a doctor. Each player spins the indicator in turn and beginning at the Doctor's Office heads forward toward Homesville.
