The object is to arrive there by exact count. Along the way the Doctors will be affected by squares that they land on. "Doctor meets Mr Smith who hurt himself. Doctor and Mr.Smith must both go back to the office." or "Doctor finds he has lost his medicine and must return to the Eight Mile House to look for it" or "Doctor's horse runs away and Doctor must return to Mr. Jones' residence" or "Doctor's carriage breaks down and he must return to the Blacksmiths Shop for repairs". The Doctor who arrives at the Homesville site first by exact roll wins the game.

name: French Start
description:
Simple dice rolling mechanic, roll the dice, answer vocabulary question, if you get the answer right, continue moving. Depending on the space you land on, there are different categories of questions. If you get a right answer, you collect that category card, if you collect all six, get to the finish space to win.

Object of the game is to help teach French vocabulary, the words are fairly basic, so it is for someone just learning French.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Rolly Poker
description:
A combination of standard Poker bidding and bluffing rules with a dexterity game. The box plastic inlay holds a tilted cardboard surface in which wooden pegs are placed - these serve as obstacles for a glass marble, which is flicked from one of four starting points to roll down the surface and land in one of five numbered target pockets.

One player tries to reach a certain score determined by cards - the other players may or may not believe that he will be successful.

The cards are printed in English and French - the cheap produced instruction sheet in the German edition leaves much of the game's rules obscured.

name: Comic Book Heroes
description:
The blue color of your cape leaves an azure streak across the city skyline as you fly above the buildings on patrol. It has been a peaceful night over all, only one bank robbery, and that you stopped with the help of Kid Zip. The explosion rolling out of the building below you then breaks the silence. You watch with your super eyesight as the green color smoke rolls out of the window of one of Sonic Lab’s windows. You watch as Doctor Death leaps into the air from that very window, a beaker of the hyper explosive, chemical Y, tightly held in his armed fist. You thought he was still in jail, serving a 300-year sentence for his last attempt at destroying the city. With a sigh you dive into the coming fight, sure it will be another long night ahead. Who said being a super hero was all capes and fun.

Comic Book Heroes is a multi player card game where you take on the role of either a super powered hero or one of their many villainous foes. Streaking through the skies in your hyper jet boots, or crash through brink walls with your super strong muscles. All the thrills, excitement and goofy fun of classic comics are here within Comic Book Heroes. Struggle with and aid other players as they battle each other to see who will be the hero supreme.

So let the cosmic beams fuel your dreams of glory, the mutant genes turn you into a freak with a heart of gold or allow sinister plots to fill you with a destiny for glory and dominance of all mankind. Play Comic Book Heroes and live the adventure.

Each set comes with two characters, a hero and a villain with 18 cards for each. The set also comes with 18 common cards and 18 new common cards only available with that set, for a total of 72 cards per set.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Politics by Other Means
description:
A free Engle Matrix Game posted on the Hamster Press website. The publisher's description:

"Welcome to the honorable society of war gamers. Our hobby has a long and noble past. Ever since Robert Lewis Stevenson (Treasure Island) and HG Wells (War of the Worlds) played games with toy soldiers in the 1890's, grown men have been reliving make believe glory in made up wars."

"'Politics by other means...' is a simple war game suitable for children and adults. It is not tied to one historical period. It covers all wars from Summeria to Star Wars. All you need to play are a few figures, some six-sided dice and a table of toy terrain to make a battle field. The game is played by each player, one at a time, moving and shooting. Everyone going ends the turn."

name: Living Landscapes
description:
1/15/2007: The Living Earth Games website appears live, and Living Landscapes is available directly from the publisher as well as from a specific retailer in the UK: http://www.eco-logicbooks.com/index.cfm?fa=book_details&;book_id=995

Previously:

Living Earth Games is a now defunct game company that made ecologically aware games printed in 100% recycled materials. The company appears to have been on the web until 2004. The following information was on their website concerning Living Landscapes.

Living landscapes introduces in a playful way into the sometimes abstract relationships between the human needs and what you find in a rural landscape. Color frames around some card images distinguish the red human needs cards (food, shelter, climate regulation…) and the green cards that distinguish important landscape elements from the rest of the set. Laying down families of 3 or more cards (we give lists of examples), the players build up the design of a landscape and they can exchange cards between families.The game ends with a set of card families laid down as a draft landscape design.

name: Youri's Pea
description:
Living Earth Games is a now defunct game company that made ecologically aware games printed in 100% recycled materials. The company appears to have been on the web until 2004. The following information was on their website concerning Living Landscapes.

At each stage of their growth, plants like to have good soil, good air, the right water, and sun to thrive. In seven stages of the life cycle of this pea plant, the players bring together these four elements for steady growth, laying pieces in the outer puzzle when rolling the special figure die. Meanwhile, the wildlife in and around the garden can be a help or a threat: does the beetle eat the snail, sparing the pea plant; does the dove find enough grains or eat the peas?

Makes plant demands and growth easily understandable for toddlers and bigger children. Also for teens and adults in teaching situations.

name: It's Raining
description:
Living Earth Games is a now defunct game company that made ecologically aware games printed in 100% recycled materials. The company appears to have been on the web until 2004. The following information was on their website concerning Living Landscapes.

A game exploring the Water Cycle; each player represents a water droplet making it's way over the landscape, to the sea and into the air, interacting with the environment as it does so.

name: Aufgepaßt im Verkehr!
description:
Road safety educational game.

One of 16 cards is drawn - with typical traffic situations seen from a bike-riding kid's perspective, but with empty roads (no other vehicles or traffic signs, depending on the type of card),
then a small cut-out car or a policeman or a traffic sign or -light is placed onto the card, thus creating a typical situation where the question for the kid is: May I ride further or do I have to stop?

All players then secretly deploy a white (go) or black (stop) chip. The chips are revealed, then every player explains his choice. Finally the back of the card is revealed to learn which answer is right (the cut-outs are coded to easily find the correct solution). Correct answers win a yellow chip. The player with the most chips receives a cardboard biker medal.

As ten different vehicles (e.g. with different turn signals)/ten traffic signs can be placed on each card the game contains a sum of 160 different situations.

name: The Fess Parker Trail Blazers Game
description: Game based on the TV show "The Daniel Boone Show" starring Fess Parker. Roll and Move game.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Voyager Space Card Game
description:
’Voyager’ is an educational card game involving scientific satellites developed for use in schools with children aged 9 to 13 years. The idea of the game is to improve pupils’ knowledge about the large number of scientific satellites there are in space in a fun way, while also practicing number skills.

This game is currently out of print.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Math, Space Exploration

name: Oz Quest
description: Oz Quest is a free game by Warp Spawn Games and is the third in Lloyd's Oz Trilogy series. Based on the WarpQuest game system. Each player takes the role of a child visitor to the Wondrous World of Oz.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: La Gerusalemme Liberata
description:
"La Gerusalemme Liberata" is a simple boardgame with paper miniatures that represent the two factions involved: Tho Holy Crusade and the Arab.

The map board is the City of Jerusalem with strong wall perimeter.

Mechanics are similar to a chess game, where miniatures "eat" other miniatures according to rules which are used to determine which is stronger.

The game is for children, because the game has elemental strategy and a few simple rules.

name: Look Out Below
description:
From the box:

'RAISE THE FIREMAN AS HIGH AS HE WILL GO
IN THE BALANCING GAME CALLED ...
LOOK OUT BELOW'

'Raise the fireman on his ladders - higher and higher and higher! Then, try to lower him down to earn points. But, if the ladders start swaying and the fireman falls ... you better LOOK OUT BELOW!'

Box measures 13" x 17" x 4".

The game consists of a molded plastic, bucket-carrying fireman about 8" high who stands on a platform which accepts plastic ladders that are inserted from below. There are six colorful 8" long ladders, restricting the how far the fireman can be raised. A large circular plastic fire net 12" in diameter is used to catch the falling fireman. A colorful spinner directs gameplay.

Points are scored for raising and lowering the fireman (i.e. adding & then removing ladders) without causing him to fall (10 points per ladder). The fireman must be balanced by holding the bottom ladder ONLY. Points are also scored if the player holding the net catches the falling fireman (50 points).

The first player to reach 150 points is the winner.

name: Firehouse Mouse
description:
From the box:

'IT'S A 5 ALARM FUN FILLED RIOT!

Lickety-split! Quick! Quick!
Before the mouse comes down the stick!'

'IDEA OF THE GAME - The object is to get 4 of the same cards before the mouse slides down the pole. This is done by drawing & passing cards just as fast as you can. Watch the mouse and try to guess which number he will point to when he lands because cards of that number become "wild".'

Box measures 12" x 22" x 2".

The 22" high firehouse backdrop (thick die cut card with period illustrations) is supported by a plastic base (which also serves as the spinner) and a red plastic roof; a metal rod connects the plastic roof to the center of the spinner. A plastic mouse attached to a small doughnut shaped piece of plastic is slid onto the top of the metal rod and positioned to commence each round.

The spinner is used to designate 'wild' cards and to keep track of scores and round number. Players are dealt 5 cards; these are made of thick cardstock and are numbered 1-12, with 4 of each number. The mouse is nudged and set on its way. Players attempt to get as many of the same cards as they can by drawing & passing before the mouse reaches the spinner base. Only 5 cards may be held at any time.

When the mouse reaches the spinner below, cards are compared. The segment which is occupied by the nose of the mouse becomes 'wild', so players can use cards of this number to enhance their hand. The winner of the hand is the player with the highest number of identical cards, or the holder of the best cards if 2 or more players have an identical number of similar cards.

After 12 rounds of play, the WINNER is the player who has won the most hands.
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Que Pasa
description:
A proprietary card game based on the standard social card game known in books as "I Doubt It," but more popularly as "Bulls**t." It was created by a college business professor in Alva, Okla., in the early 1990s and marketed by his startup company.

The deck consists of 72 cards in 14 denominations. Each denomination, numbered 1 to 14, depicts a leisure activity, such as "Golfing" or "Shopping." As in "I Doubt It," the object is to shed all your cards. Players announce in turn that they are discarding a certain number of cards in a certain denomination, always having the option to bluff. The other players can challenge. Anyone losing a challenge must take all the discards.

Unlike "I Doubt It," the game requires players in turn to play cards in the same denomination rather than increasing denominations. (In other words, if Player 1 plays "Hunting" cards and goes unchallenged, the Player 2 must either play "Hunting" cards or pass.) The denomination changes after a challenge -- or if all players pass, at which point the discard pile is retired and started anew. The game also includes a denomination of wild cards (1, "Anything Goes"), and one denomination (13, "Fooling Around") that can only be played as part of a bluff.

Once a player sheds all his cards, he scores the point total of all cards remaining in his opponents' hands. The game ends at 100 points. The game also offers rules for couples to play in partnerships.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Three Dimensional Dominoes
description:
From The Box...

Three Dimensional Dominoes

> 45 triangular dominoes, each with sectional numbers to be matched up as in conventional dominoes, but wait till you see the challenging differences.

> Six exciting "3-D" domino charts included.

>One Interesting "Solitaire" domino game chart included

Note: "3-D" dominoes was created and designed by mathematical experts following a specific formula. You will find the games most effective and more challenging when played on the design charts inside, whether for multiple or solitaire play.

> Full simple directions and charts inside box.

name: Realms: Total War
description:
The sounds of horns and the cries of men as they rush to battle, these sounds of war have been heard about the mighty Realms for ages. Now the battle of the many races has exploded into total war, a war to see who will rule the many lands of mighty Realms.

Realms, Total War, is the newest expansion for the Realms system. Now you can expand your Realms struggles with more tactical considerations, more magic, more troops and more fun. So gather a gang of friends together and have a few hours of glorious war, excitement and gaming fun.

Note that Realms, Total War, is not a complete game, and requires that you have one or more copies of the Realms games.

This game requires Realms: Elves & Orcs to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: AcaMania
description:
AcaMania was designed by three national champion Academic Decathletes, with artwork by Tipatat Chennavasin. Players must race from the "pit" to the national competition, contending with four kinds of curriculum-related challenges--both creative and academic--along the way.

To make it around the board to the National Competition, teams of Decathletes must master five categories of game cards, ranging from the creative to the intellectual to the simply outrageous. Depending on what cards they draw, players could be required to change events from the curriculum, mimic philosophical figures, hum the music pieces, sketch artworks, answer true/false questions, unscramble important phrases and much, much more.

name: Syzigy
description:
This chess-like game is played on a round board consisting of 157 circular spaces, connecting both circularly (around the board) and radially (from the outside to the center). The outer rings connect all the way around circularly, but the inner rings have gaps, requiring more complex routes to navigate.
Each player has 7 Sages, 4 Stouts, and 4 Royals (one of which is the Czar). The Sages move 5 circles, and may only capture Royals/Czars. The Stouts move 4, and may only capture Sages, and the Royals/Czars move only 3, but may capture Stouts and Sages.
Capturing requires landing on an appropriate opponent piece. To win, you must capture your opponent's Czar, or all of either his Sages or Stouts.

name: Family Affair
description: The Family Affair Game is based on a television show of the same name that was on the air in the late 1960's. The show starred Brian Keith as Uncle Bill Davis, Sebastion Cabot as the butler Mr. French, and the three orphaned kids, Cissy (Kathy Garver), Jody (Johnnie Whitaker) and Buffy (Anissa Jones - she died a couple of years after the show went off the air of a drug over-dose). This was a dice rolling game and had 4 cardboard cutout pieces each in 4 different colors. What you rolled with the dice determined which area you looked at to determine what happened to you.

name: FlipFlash
description:
From the box insert:

FlipFlash: The Spellbinding Game is a fast-paced extravaganza for two to twenty players incorporating 44 wooden, handcrafted tiles. The object of this team sport is to create words by reeking havoc on opponents with feverish energy. Guaranteed to be the most competitive and demanding game you've ever played. And as each box is individually handcrafted, FlipFlash should well be deemed a choice piece of furniture.
FlipFlash comes in two variety of boxes and tiles: black and brown. Individually hand-painted FlipFlash has 144 wooden tiles in three colors. FlipFlash is suitable for those 10 years of age and over."

name: Are You Phrazy? Holiday Carols Edition
description:
In this version of Are You Phrazy?, players won’t be shouting out lyrics from Rudolph The Red-nosed Reindeer, White Christmas, or even Blue Christmas. They must SING them. Fast and loud. In fact, there’ll be no silent night in any little town when this devilishly divine game gets cranking. Each card features the song title from which the lyric originated. Customers will flock from afar to purchase such a unique holiday game.

For ages 8 and up. 4 to 12 singers. (Item #: GTL0602)

name: Flail and Wail
description:
The rhythm's gonna getcha in this beat-the-beat game.

Who knew you could learn rhythm while laughing? New Flail and Wail offers musical laughs and more. Best of all, players who might think they can’t keep a beat, let alone keep up, will have a riot clapping along, shouting with the song, waving, pointing and, well, Flailing. Each player passes the beat around by shouting a Wail sound and making a Flail move – first theirs and then another player’s. As the music speeds up, someone is going to mess up and that’s when Miss Dee Beat, the cranky music teacher, steps in. You’ll be in trouble when she gives you a dreaded treble (clef). Be the one with the fewest trebles and win. Game includes a fab CD featuring 50 original tunes to shout with and shake at. The game’s patented Magic Maraca rocks the dice.

Ages 8 and up. 3 to 8 players.

Copy of Home Page on Internet Archive: https://web.archive.org/web/20060323170503/http://gottalaffgames.com/FlailNwail.html
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Music, Party Game

name: I Know!: Gospel Word Match Game
description:
"What is the Word of Wisdom? What is a Bishopric? What is Repentance? Do you know the answers? If you do, raise your hand. If you don’t, you’ll soon be able to say “I Know!” in this fun new game for the whole family.
Four Games in One! Younger children will love playing the Match Game. Older kids will have fun with the Fill in the Blank or Guess Who games. Even adults can get in on the fun by acting out the questions in the Guess Who I Am game. Where can you find hours of fun for everyone? I Know!
"

name: Space Fleet: Warp One
description:
Space Fleet - Warp One is a tactical starship combat boardgame. The tactical level uses counters or miniatures to represent individual starships in combat. The playing area is a hex sheet that you supply. Players design starships on paper then take these designs into combat. Once in the tactical simulator the players take turns moving and firing their starships. Combat is resolved quickly and simply with two six sided dice. "

Download PDF at : Space Fleet - Warp One
Rules available at: Space Fleet - Warp One

A simple tactical space combat game, with a small set of ship design rules included. Almost like a minimalist Starfire.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Det 5 Element
description: Card game from Denmark. Set contains 60 cards, 1-13 in four suites corresponding to four elemental forces (fire, sun, moon, water) plus 8 Tornado cards. Instructions are in Danish, so remaining mechanics are unclear.

name: Lake Winnipesaukee: Follow the Mount
description:
Lake Winnipesaukee is a Monopoly clone with a few small changes.

Players race around Lake Winnipesaukee, hoping to be the first to land on a piece of lake real estate. When a lot is owned, rent can be collected. The amount of rent depends on what is built on the lot. If you own just one lot of a three lot group, you can build a picnic area. If you own two, you can build camp grounds. Finally, if you own all three lots, you can build lodges, which rake in the most rent.

Random lots around the lake contain actions, rather than lots for sale. Any fees incurred by these lots are placed into the center of the lake, to be collected by the lucky player who lands on the correct lot.

Play continues in this fashion until one player emerges as the only left with cash.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Wall Street The Board Game
description:
The objective of WALL STREET is to make money through the trading of stocks, futures, gold and securities. The first player to double the initial amount of money that they started with is the winner of the game. An optional approach is to set a given time of play and the player who has the greatest amount of wealth is the winner.

Game consists playing board, market guides, portfolio sheets, money, pawns, dice and stock, futures, gold & securities cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: The Great Safari
description:
This game is a trick-taking game published in 2000. A variant of hearts, this game has 59 cards divided into 5 suits.
The "endangered suit" acts like the heart suit in "Hearts", but are worth two points per card taken rather than one. In addition, the "Zoo" is a sideboard that the dealer can swap cards after the endangered suit has been declared but before the round starts.
Many of the cards have additional rules text that affect the game in various ways.
Play four hands (for four players); the player with the lowest score wins.

name: Minz, Maunz und Bello
description:
What's going on in the kitchen ?

The little kittens awake on the couch and are hungry. They're looking for their food. It's on the other side of the kitchen, but Bello, the dog is lying on his carpet and keeps an eye on the cup full of food (playing chips). Don't let Bello get you...

A great game for kids. Start with one of five kittens on the couch, roll two dice - one moves the kitten (1-5 + Special BLACK spot for moving the cup of food), the other Bello, the dog. So, Bello is like a community character, each player moves.

Moving is allowed horizontal or vertical only, the same for eating from the cup. When the BLACK spot is on the kitten dice, it allows almost free placement of the cup of food. If Bello the dog, catches one of the kittens, he throws it back to the couch or onto the chair in the corner of the room.

name: Get In That Tub
description: The game involves running a device down a plastic strip. That device would then speak phrases giving reasons for not taking a bath. Stuff like " I can't swim" or "I don't feel good". These excuses would then govern your movement around the board. Object of the game was to get all of your pieces into the plastic bathtub which came with the game.

name: New Frontier Game
description: Game from 1962 that is similar to Monopoly and that is critical of the Kennedy Administration. It has deeds, Community Chest Cards called Black Jacks and Chance Cards called High Jacks. The game comes in an envelope and had this comment on the front: "NEW FRONTIER the game no one can win. A reverse twist on a favorite family game"

name: A Visit To Mother Goose
description: Listed on the box as a game for little people. This game featured very unique player pieces. Each piece was shaped like a little boy and a little girl either staring up into space or singing. The pieces were made out of some kind of plaster. If handled with some degree of care the pieces lasted, although they did have a tendency to flake their paint.

name: The Undersea World Game
description: Game for pre-school children which requires kids to spin a spinner and then match the spin to different fish. (This is not a roll and move game but because their is no choice of spinner I had to chose roll and Move for Mechanics of the game.)

name: I Dood It
description: Game based on Red Skelton's radio personalities. The game plays similar to Blitz.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Quiz Show
description:
A collection of three outrageous activities designed to test your retro pop-culture knowledge.

Includes 3 games:

1. Slangshot -- guess a common word from slang clues and phrases.

2. Spit-It-Out -- describe specific words or phrases without using the word itself.

3. Triviology -- test your knowledge of the last five decades.

name: Calgary Stampede: The Game
description:
This game was developed to relive the experience of the Calgary Stampede. The interactive game allows players to take part in a wild horse race, chuck wagon races, and frontier casino games. You can win Stampede raffle draws, and bet your money against other players to build your winnings. You also get to participate in bull riding, steer wrestling, calf roping and barrel racing. The one with the most money at the end of the game wins.

Game contents include:

6 playing pieces
4 chuck wagons
8 wild horses
2 spinners
Dice
56 stampede cards
Stampede dollars
Rules

name: Lady Lovely Locks And The Pixietails: Seek & Peek Game
description:
Lady Lovely Locks And The Pixietails: Seek & Peek Game is a memory game for children. It includes paper dolls, a gameboard, a spinner, tokens, disks, and a rule sheet.

Each player picks a paper doll at the beginning of the game. The paper dolls are each in different colors, has drawings of three Pixietail creatures, and has three cut-out portions wherein Pixietail tokens may be inserted. The object of the game is to be the first player to collect all three Pixietail tokens to insert in her paper doll and find the Castle disk.

Players take turns with the Spinner to determine the area in the gameboard where she may select face-down Pink disks. If the other side of the disk she picked up has a Pixietail image of the matching color and design (not yet collected), she takes a similar Pixietail token and inserts it in one of the cut-out sections. She then returns the disks face-down in the same location in the gameboard where she picked them before. If a non-matching disk was selected, it is also returned to the same location face-down and play passes to the next player.

If a player's doll collects all three Pixietail tokens, that player then picks only Violet disks in her succeeding turns. If the Castle is then selected from the Violet disks, that player wins the game. If the "Duchess RavenWaves" was selected from one of the disks, that player must remove one Pixietail token from her doll. She then again is demoted to select Pink tokens only until she again completes all her Pixietail tokens.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Match Ball
description:
Match Ball is a simulation game of a Tennis match competition. You can emulate your favorite tennis players with this game. I designed the game as a simulation where you can reproduce all the movements and strikes a professional player can do in a match! You can play as a single player match or doubles.

You have one counter representing you in the court and must move around the field to send the ball to the other side while re-positioning yourself in the best way that you can to cover your side and catch the returning strike from the other player.

You have all the possible strikes in a tennis match that can be done: Serves, Forehand, Backhand, passing shots, lobs, smashes, etc...

The components are:
- Tennis court (Grass)
- Rulebook
- Strike Rule (To be printed in transparency)
- Balls and players counters
- Markers
- Action cards

You will need to provide with 4 dice: 2 color d6, 1 white d6 and a 1d4.

This is my first attempt to design a game. I came up with the idea when creating the geeklist 1:1 scale Sports boardgames that lists games of sports.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: My Homes and Places
description:
A therapeutic game for counselors, teachers, and children designed to help kids recognize dangerous situations in supposedly a more fun and less upsetting atmosphere (a game). It helps kids recognize when someone may approaching them inappropriately, taking advantage of them, or other possible dangers they could encounter.

There are question cards for each of the locations depicted on the board: homes, school, church, courthouse, clubhouse, fantasy castle, and haunted house. For example, at the haunted house, the questions are about scary things, at the church they focus on God and religious differences.

name: The Wine Connoisseur
description: A trivia game based on the wine industry; you would need to know quite a bit about wine and the wine industry in order to do well in this game. It comes in a nice red square box with gold fancy lettering.

name: Mighty Heroes On The Scene
description: Mighty Heroes On The Scene was based on a short lived cartoon series from the times. Join the Strong Man, the Rope Man, Cuckoo Man, Tornado Man and Diaper Man as they battle crime. Villains beware as these Mighty Heroes battle evil everywhere. Roll and Move.

name: Whooops
description: This differs from the Whitman Game of the same name produced in the same year (1968). This is a somewhat dexterity game where players need to balance on small plastic bowls. Probably too dangerous for todays market. At the time though Aurora called it a NEW GENERATION GAME.

name: Center Court College Basketball
description:
Quick-playing but detailed simulations of college basketball. Instant download, print and play game.

Features Easy to set up & play: Just shuffle the action cards and play. (If you want to keep score, enter the player and team names onto the provided score sheet

All play derived from 100 "action cards": Each card is 2-sided. 3 trips through one side of the cards equals one half of play. This length of playing time varies according to each team's pace rating.

Statistically accurate: Every college team from the 2005-2006 season, along with the players, are rated in every possible statistical category.

ALL college teams represented: Now you can simulate games between Division 1, 2, and 3 teams.

Each team and player rated in several categories: Every statistic you would expect to be covered is here. 2 and 3 point shooting, free throw shooting, rebounding (offensive and defensive), assists, steals, blocks, turnovers, and fouls.

Keep score as you play and compile stats

Even play games between divisions: Match up a division I team against a division II team with simple formulas.

Optional injury system

Exclusive "pace" ratings: One problem I've found with other basketball sims is the lack of realistic scores. Some teams regularly score 100+ points a game, others barely break 60. With the pace system, you will see the scores of your games closely reflect the team's actual output.

Realistic foul system: Another shortcoming with other hoop sims is the lack of realistic foul distribution. Although the highest fouled/fouling players are often correct, the rate at which a team draws fouls is often incorrect. In Center Court, each team draws fouls based on their actual performance.

Game Contents

Complete rule book, including a detailed description of a partial sample game, useful as a tutorial.

Set of action cards, ready for printing

Score sheet

Foul chart

Team cards, divided by division/conference. Each conference is printed on one separate .pdf file, all organized within division.

name: Let's Play 14!: College Baseball
description:
Quick-playing but detailed simulations of college baseball. Instant download, print and play game.

Features Easy to set up & play: Just shuffle the action cards and play. (If you want to keep score, enter the player and team names onto the provided score sheet

All play derived from 100 "action cards": Each card is 2-sided.

Statistically accurate: Every college team from the 2005-2006 season, along with the players, are rated in every major statistical category.

All division I college teams represented.

Each team and player rated in several categories: Every statistic you would expect to be covered is here. Batting average, singles, doubles, triples, home runs, stolen base attempts, stolen base success percentage, opponent's batting average, strikeout & walk frequency and team error ratings are all here.

Keep score as you play and compile stats

All players listed by position, with usage chart included. This enable you to replay games where the players appear in realistic fashion.

Optional injury system

Exclusive "control" ratings: One problem I've found with other baseball sims is the lack of realistic batter/pitcher interaction. With the control system, you will see the great hitter outperform the mediocre pitcher (and vice-versa) in a more consistent manner.

The game engine drives the action. Players will even attempt to steal bases without your input. Of course, you can always call the shots if you prefer.

Game contents
complete rule book, including a detailed description of a partial sample game, useful as a tutorial.

Set of action cards, ready for printing

Score sheet

Out chart & extras chart

Team cards, divided by division/conference. Each conference is printed on one separate .pdf file, all organized within division.

FAQ

What do the team cards look like?

Depending on the roster size, anywhere from about half a page (8-1/2X11") to almost a full page. The tops of the cards are in the team's school colors. All data is organized into color-coded colums for easy reading.

Can I edit the team/player data?

Sure, if you wish to do so. I may release a semi-automated editor for excel if there is any interest in such.

Can I set lineups, call plays, make substitutions, etc?
You set your lineups and make substitutions. There are a few provisions for calling special plays, such as bunting, hit-and-run, and playing the infield "in". The game being a self-contained simulation, it needs little user input. Having played other basetball games which feature individual player cards, setting of lineups, keeping track of stamina, etc., I wanted something that would yield even more realistic results with less work on the user's part.

name: Long Tater! Professional Baseball
description:
Quick-playing but detailed simulations of professional baseball. Instant download, print and play game.

Features Easy to set up & play: Just shuffle the action cards and play. (If you want to keep score, enter the player and team names onto the provided score sheet

All play derived from 100 "action cards": Each card is 2-sided.

Statistically accurate: All big league from the 2005-2006 season, along with the players, are rated in every major statistical category.

Each team and player rated in several categories: Every statistic you would expect to be covered is here, including innovative batter/pitcher match-up ratings, strikeouts, walks, wild pitches, balks, hit batsmen, singles, doubles, triples, homers, double plays, errors and more.

Keep score as you play and compile stats. The game can handle most managerial situations if you wish. Of course you can still call the shots if you wish. Have the game engine determine when to steal a base while calling for the hit-and-run yourself.

name: Invite Womens College Golf
description:
Quick-playing but detailed simulations of college golf. Instant download, print and play game.

Features Easy to set up & play: Just shuffle the action cards and play. (If you want to keep score, enter the player and team names onto the provided score sheet

All play derived from 100 "action cards": Each card is 2-sided.

Statistically accurate: All squads from the 2005-2006 season, along with the players, are rated by the use of every single match score..

Weather system alters player performances, from gusting wind to drizzling rain and hard greens.

Events chart can alter certain players scores. Every woman golfer who appeared in at least 3 matches is represented. The game plays quickly, but with realistic results. Full tournaments of 3 rounds can be simulated in about an hour. Set your starting lineup and tee off. Accept the invite!

name: The New Howard H. Jones Collegiate Football Game
description:
This football game was created By Howard H. Jones who was not only the President of the Municipal Service Corp., Ltd. which produced the game but also the Coach of the Southern California 1931 National Championship team.

Kickoff's, Field Goals and Punts use a special mechanical device that kicks the ball.

On Offense the player chooses one of 8 possible plays to call and then spins an arrow which stops on letters. Then the defense spins the arrow and gets a letter result. The result of these two spins determines what happens to the ball.

As an aside here is a couple of words of advice from the head coach about football strategy from the times.

Question: With 4th down and a foot in a scoreless tie shall I attempt to make the foot or punt the ball. ANSWER from COACH: You should have really punted on 3rd down. By all means PUNT, failure to make a 1st down would put your opponent in good position to score.

Question: Is it safe to attempt a forward pass while still within ones own 40 yard line. ANSWER: Usually it isn't. There are times when this play is worked with success. One can only depend on ones own judgment.

Question: With the score 9 to 7 against me with 3 minutes to go in the game and the ball on my opponents 28 yard line what play would you use? ANSWER: A wide end run to get the ball in the center of the field on 1st down and then I would try a place kick on 2nd down

name: Knowwhere
description:
From the Publishers website:

Knowwhere is an educational card game that seeks to provide both fun and learning to children and adults alike. Based upon a traditional "pairs" format, the aim of the game is to match country to capital city, but can be played on many levels to suit all ages.

Knowwhere is made up of 37 Country Cards, 37 Capital Cards, and 4 Cards which have the same Country and Capital name and count as a pair in their own right. Each pack is also supplied with 6 Answer Cards

name: Wise Up
description:
From the Publisher's Website:

The action packed board game helping children understand and face the challenging dilemmas of everyday life in a fun but responsible way. Topics include stranger danger, road safety, bullying, racism, first aid and many more.

For ages 5 and up.

name: Laramie
description: The game Laramie was based on the television show of the same name that aired between 1959 and 1962. That show starred John Smith as Slim Sherman, Robert Fuller (eventually of Wagon Train fame) as Jess Harper , Hoagy Carmichael as Jonesy and Spring Byington as Miss Daisy. The show was about two brothers and a drifter trying to run a stage coach stop for the Greater Central Overland Mail Company. The game itself is a simple roll and move game with the object being to get the mail through while overcoming obstacles like Indians and Bandits.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Shhh!... Mom's Asleep
description:
It's afternoon and Mom is having a nap with Baby.

She has left a list of chores for us to do. We want to help Mom out. There are many useful tools around the house we must match to their chores.

Careful, though, not to wake Mom & Baby before the chores get done. Maybe the dog barks, maybe someone knocks over pots and pans, maybe we kids get into a noisy fight... We have to figure out how to deal with these events.

Expect story-telling, discussion, imagination, logic, working as a team and learning about practical things around the Home. And learning to be good is important as well!
Contents:
1 gameboard
36 cards
rules

name: Seekers of the Sacred Icons
description:
Barbarians have stolen four containers each with a special parchment revealing the secrets to gaining Truth, Beauty, Compassion and Freedom. However, each container cannot be opened without knowing the secret code.

Each code is different and kept by the Ten Guardians of the Codes. The ruthless, brutal barbarians have captured and imprisoned the Ten Guardians in the vain hope of extracting the secret codes...

The Sacred Icons and Guardians are somewhere in the Walled City controlled by the barbarians. We, the Seekers, enter this city in search of the Sacred Icons and the Guardians so that the Icons can be restored to their four spiritual power centers.

The task will be difficult and not for the faint-hearted. Locked doors and nasty barbarians await as we quietly do our search.
Contents:
1 gameboard
4 pawns
4 spiritual power indicators
4 seeker cards
9 locked doors
11 barbarians
4 icon containers
10 guardians of the codes
8 keys
rules

name: Bullwinkle Travel Adventure Game
description: Simple roll and move game based on cartoon show from the times. The Rocky and Bullwinkle Show featured Rocket "Rocky" J. Squirrel, a flying squirrel, and his best friend Bullwinkle J. Moose, a dim-witted but good-natured moose who both lived in Frostbite Falls, Minnesota. The scheming villains in most episodes were the fiendish, but inept, agents of the fictitious nation of Pottsylvania: Boris Badenov and Natasha Fatale.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: What's That Song?
description: What's That Song is a lively and entertaining game, featuring over 700 song titles, for two or more players or teams. Spin the needle to determine the decade. Select a song title from that decade 50s 60s 70s 80s or old faves and sing a clue from the song title. Singing, facial expressions and body movements are all encouraged to help your team guess the song title. Points are awarded for the correct answer.

name: Self-Concept Game
description: This is a game used to help kids build their self-esteem. Developed by a PhD in kids psychology.

name: Shift
description: You bid cards and play similarly to a trump style game. the high trump card overrides all others and takes the trick. that is until the Shift card is played, then the low trump takes the trick. Timing the shift to the low trump is key to winning.

name: Chaingun
description:
As far as I know this is the only set of miniatures rules specifically dealing with air-to-air combat between helicopters, though air-to-ground and ground-to-air combat is also covered. The rules are intended for use with 1/300th scale miniatures and the other game scales are as follows:

1 model = 1 aircraft, vehicle, infantry platoon
1 turn = 10-15 seconds
1" = 100 yards

Each turn the player picks the speed and altitude for each helicopter they control, which determines how far they will move, how much they may turn and their chance of crashing into the ground, if flying too fast and too low. Combat is resolved using the usual die rolls and tables, with the different makes of helicopter being able to take different amounts of damage before they are eliminated.

The majority of the rule book is taken up with the helicopter data sheets and there are no less than 46 of them. Ground elements are detailed generically. There are also five sample scenarios.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement

name: Gauntlet
description:
Summary of Rules (from Instructions)

Gauntlet is a role-playing board game in which players (often referred to in their game role as Travelers) battle their way through a maze of hazardous tunnels and monsters.

Gauntlet may be played in four different versions: the Race Game, the Treasure Game, the Hunter Game, or the Tournament Game. The object in each is to be the first player to have his or her traveler cross from one side of the board to the other. When one player does, on the following turn the Gauntlet will begin to collapse, starting with the innermost square and proceeding outward by "rings" with each turn until the entire board has collapsed. If no other players make it across the Gauntlet before the entire board has fallen, the first player wins the game. If any other player makes it across to tie the first player, the tied player who has accumulated the most points wins the game.

name: Fridolins Himmelsreise
description:
An old game from the series "Fridolin-Spiele in der Tüte", cheap games in a paper bag instead of a box.

Obviously (there are board, dice and small airplanes in it) it`s a dice-rolling game for children, where each player has to move his airplane one round through the sky (its subtitle is: "Ein Wettfliegen durch die Sternenwelt", so it`s a race-game).

name: Hit n' Run
description: Simple game something like a pin ball machine. Ball is hit and goes into holes that represent hits, balls, strikes and outs. When that happens players move around the bases. Object is to score more runs than your opponent. Game comes with base runners for both the red and the blue teams.

name: Pacific Crisis
description:
This wargame involves a (so far) hypothetical Australian invasion of Fiji in response to a hypothetical coup by the Fijian military in December 2006.

This game can be downloaded from http://www.mikekreuzer.com/dtp.htm

Components
1 map
27 counters
21 markers
1 7-page rulebook

Player must supply 2 six sided dice.

name: OrdMix
description:
A memory based card placement game. All cards are placed face down on the table beside the board. Turn and pick correct card for placement in order building sentences. If wrong color is drawn, the card is returned face down and the turn passes to next player.

Swedish version.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Memory, Word Game

name: TriHop
description:
You place 8 of your 10 stones alternately on a field of the board of your choice, not on the border.
In the game you take a Trihop with one of your stones to move it around.
The destination of the game is to place all 8 of my stones in my own destination-area on the border.

name: Clue Me In!
description:
From the publisher:

The game where the answer lies in the clues!

It's a race against the timer to get your team to shout out the right words... and as the timer ticks, your score goes down. Sounds easy... perhaps... except you can't speak to them. All you can do is write down five clues.

Give the right clues and maybe they'll get the right answer. But a bad clue will send them off on a wild goose chase! Tick, tick, tick, tick, BANG!

name: Bussy
description:
This card game contains:
• 72 cards (36 with a blue back and 36 with a red back)
• A rulebook

Every card displays three numbers from 1 to 6 (vertically arranged), in six possible colors.
Players are dealt six cards each, and at their turn they can draw a new card and discard an unwanted one (discarded cards may be picked by other players).
Goal of the game is to make winning hands, using the first, second or third line of the numbers: you can win with six numbers of the same color, or six same numbers, or a flush.

There are two variants of the game.
• The “quick” one (named “Bussy”) has an action/dexterity factor: the player who wants a discarded card must be the fastest to grab it.
• The strategic one (named “Bussy Money”) uses poker chips and bets. And the player who wants a discarded card must bid some chips on it and win the auction. It is also possible to “bluff” a winning hand, hoping that nobody will want to see it…
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Number
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Boom or Bust
description:
A Game of Money, Stocks , Shares & Wealth

This interactive game includes a 60 Min VHS Video cassette. The object of the game is to accrue as much wealth in shares and money withing 60 Minutes running time of the Boom or Bust video.

name: Linguathèque
description:
The game is comprised of eight, ten or twelve card decks depending on which language is being presented. A deck is made up of 65 to 75 cards, with each card bearing one or more words, semi-sentences, verbs, pronouns, adjectives, etc. The phonetic pronunciation is written in the mother tongue beneath the words or sentences of the foreign language. The center of the card bears the translation of the text in your mother tongue.

The object of the game is to form complete sentences having at least a subject, a verb, and an object - and making sense. Points are awarded based on the number of cards used in creation of each phrase or sentence.

name: Bugs & Looops
description:
Players program a simple Turing Machine, also known as a State Machine. One cube, called the pointer is positioned opposite a line of 7 other cubes, called the tape. For each state that the pointer/tape is in, a player writes an instruction changing the state, and moving the pointer. Points are scored for the number of times the pointer moves, unless the pointer moves past the end of the tape (a bug) or gets trapped in an endless cycle of instructions (a loop).

The rulebook contains the instructions for a more complex version (Time-Sharing) and 4 simpler games, designed to introduce the concepts in the base game for younger players.

name: Safari
description: Selchow & Righter produced this simple children's game. Use dice and special cards to BIG GAME HUNT.

name: Swim Quest
description: Swim Quest was conceived as a board game that could be incorporated into swimming practices. It is designed to be constructed from waterproof materials, including a dry-erase board for keeping score. A spinner governs how many spaces the players move their pieces around a conventional track. The pieces are in thematic shapes: diver, freestyle, stopwatch, and pair of fins. Spaces on the board contain instructions for swimming activities, to be performed by the player who lands on the space (e.g., "4 laps, freestyle"). Some spaces have other instructions, such as "Go back 1 space" or "Do 20 crunches." Swim Quest has been awarded US Patent number 7125016B1.

name: Doraemon Mao Xian Wang
description:
Doraemon Mao Xian Wang directly translates as Doraemon Adventure King. This made-in-Hong-Kong board game uses the popular Japanese cartoon, Doraemon, as its theme.

Doraemon is a lovable cat-robot from the 22nd century, who is sent back in time to present-day Japan to help Nobita, a pitiful school kid who is best described as a loser. Doraemon wears a magical pouch on his tummy from which he produces the most amazing gadgets to help Nobita, but Nobita somehow always manages to misuse them.

The game belongs to the large family of 'Millionaire' clones, which is itself derived from Monopoly. Players take on the role of one of four characters from the cartoon series: Doraemon; Nobita; Shizuka (Nobita's girlfriend); and Dorami (Doraemon's sister). Each player has a nifty miniature figurine to move around the track. Dice-rolls move the figurines and players earn or spend money according to where they land. Instead of properties, players land on adventures which they can 'purchase' and other players landing there in future have to pay the owner of the adventure. There are also chance cards.

The manufacturer, Sun Hing Toys, makes several other Doraemon-themed board games.

name: AD2222
description: A set of miniatures rules covering sci-fi fighter combat, in the well regarded Peter Pig rule sets range designed by the RFCM Team. There is a supporting set of miniatures.

name: Q-Fighter
description:
Take your one-man fighter into Q-space and engage your opponent head on in a duel to the death. Two players, each using one of the two enclosed play books, try to maneuver each other into their own firing arcs using the easy to use movement charts given on each page. As you and your opponent move, you flip to a new page, which shows your new position and sensor displays.

The game uses a system similar to that used in the Ace of Aces series of games; players simultaneously choose a direction to move and these choices are cross-referenced to determine which page each turns to. The ships normally can only move to one of their three forward spaces or stay in place, but by spending shield points a ship can move directly sideways. If a player has the opponent within their firing arc they can choose to fire; shots remove more shield points at close range and ships can only fire every other turn. When a ship is out of shield points the opponent wins. Optional rules allow for the possibility that moving and firing will sometimes fail.

The end of the rulebook mentions several related products: Q-Fighter DT (more detailed rules), Kree Tech (a wallet-sized version), and Fringe Wars, a card-based expansion which added campaign rules. However, it is unclear if any of these were ever published.

name: Elsie's Milkman Game
description:
This game was manufactured as a promotional item for Bordens Dairy

Object of the game is to unload/deliver the contents of their delivery truck to residences or the Supermarket and be the first to return to the Dairy.

Each player takes 1 Truck card and places small product cards representing assorted dairy products in their respective spaces.

Colored pawns represent the trucks as they move about the board making deliveries.

Dice rolls determine movement.

Each residence has symbols representing a delivery request. Landing exactly on a doorstep allows for product delivery and once all products have been delivered to that residence the order can not be duplicated. Any player may unload at the supermarket.

Players must observe street direction arrows and may only go in the direction or directions indicated.

There are also special instruction cards that effect game play.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Destination Delhi!
description:
Destination Delhi! is a roll-and-move game where players are taxi drivers collecting fares around Delhi. The game board is a map of Delhi featuring 10 different tourist attractions and players draw destination cards telling them where they must move to next. The attractions are:

Rashtrapthi Bhawan
Red Fort
Bahai Temple
Connaught Place
India Gate
Jama Masjid
Janter Manter
Lodi Gardens
Qurb Minar
Raj Ghat
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mister Whiskers and the Wrigleybottom Jewel Robbery
description:
A game in the same vein as 'Mad Libs':

A chosen player becomes the narrator, who reads the 'crime story'. When the narrator comes to a blank in the text, the active player (which may include the narrator) draws a card from the deck and quickly reads it aloud.

The cards contain words which tend toward absurdist relationships with the rest of the text of the story. Some of the cards are worth points to the player who drew them.

The game also features 30 blank cards, for you to supply the names of friends, etc.

The winner is the player with the most points (which were gained from random card draw). The game is therefore entirely random as presented.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Nine Months & Counting
description: Players travel along a track with squares representing the 40 weeks of pregnancy. To advance, they must complete a task such as answering a pregnancy-related trivia question, unscrambling a baby name, or drawing a pregnancy-related item. Complete the game to receive a brand-new baby.

name: Fluctuat
description:
The game is played selling and buying highly coveted items like stones, stamps, and cheese. The object is to collect the most money.

This is a free print and play game from Neroludic. Currently only available in French.

name: Cloud Wars
description:
Vermix roared as the zeppelin’s cannons blasted into him, the great dragon screaming in terrible pain as the cannon ball smashed into his armored hide. Any other dragon might have been blow from the skies with such a volley of lead shot, but Vermix was no weakling, but rather one of the true kings of the skies. The wizards of Tor thought they could take the dragon lord’s territory without much of a fight from the might red dragon, but these wizards were fools, for Vermix never surrendered and had yet to lose a battle for control of the clouds that he called home.

This is Cloud Wars', yet another Mini-Game from Bad Baby Production. In Cloud Wars, you and other players take on the role of mighty air ships, eagle riders and lords of cloud castles as you battle for control of the skies above a fantasy world. The first expansion for the Dragon Wars game, now players can lead forces of wizard forged zeppelins and marshal squadrons of might eagle riders. Fully compatible with Dragon War, have fun and battle for the skies.

Using a fast turn based system; the combat is swift, the excitement nail biting and the strategy intense. Do you dare enter the world of dragons, wizards and cannons…
mechanics: Action Points, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Schley at Santiago Bay
description:
From an article in "The Games We Played" by Margaret Hofer.

Schley at Santiago Bay is one of a series of patriotic games inspired by the Spanish-American War. 'Schley at Santiago Bay' celebrated war hero Winfield Scott Schley while teaching players facts about the recent war. Schley, hardly a household name today, was the U.S. Navy commodore in command of the Flying Squadron during the victorious battle at Santiago. An investigation conducted 2 years after the publication of the game found Schley guilty of negligence and misconduct during the battle.

name: Bare It All
description: A more risque adult party game where the player's witty answers on statement cards drive the fun.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Oh God, You're Getting Married
description: A party game meant to enliven any adult get-together as participants inject humor into answers on statement cards. Chicago Tribune Honorable Mention.

name: Bottoms Up
description:
How freaky are your friends?
What tacky talents do they possess?
Can they work as a team to meet any cheeky challenge?
Find out this and more with this hilarious adult party game
Includes instructions for non-drinking play


The teams take turns rolling the die and moving the appropriate number of spaces. Team members must take turns rolling on behalf of the team. The challenge categories are Truth or Bare, Perverted Pictures, Sexy Charades and Dirty Tricks. If a team lands on Bottoms Up!, everyone has to down their entire drink. The team may then roll again and continue their turn. Remember, everyone will have a good time if everyone remains safe. Please drink responsibly. There are non-drinking instructions as well. The game contents include everything you need to play except the beverages. Let’s toast to Bottoms Up! Bottoms Up Party Board Game is manufactured by Topco Sales under a license from Hustler Product.

name: Lanko
description:
In this Polish game the players try to get into the middle of the board. Moving and capturing are like in checkers, however there are some interesting twists: Players can move over their own stone to built a defense more carefully. In the middle of the Board there is an area where the same stones can be played by both partners to create momentum. And the objective is not necessary to eliminate the opponent, but the game can also be won by reaching certain spots on the board.

Home Page: http://lanko.com.pl/
Home Page (at publisher): http://www.bambusspiele.de/spiele/lanko/e_lanko_fr.htm

name: Choose or Lose
description: "'Touch n’ Feel, Kiss, Get Naked!' Always good advice. This daring stripping game will make any party memorable! Includes 3 dice, rule sheet and a storage tin."

name: Get Your Rocks Off
description: "Sexy moves and seductive strategies! Travel a rocky path and act, draw or interact sexually with another player! Includes game board, rule sheet, 2 dice, 24 playing pieces, pencil and pad."

name: Sex Connects
description: "'Horny minds think alike!' Do they? Are your thoughts as horny as your partner’s? This lusty word association game lets you find out. Includes 52 game cards, 8 writing pads, 8 pencils, 2 dice, electronic timer and rule sheet."
categories: Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Bloomie's: The Game
description: Each player starts with $1630 and uses the dice to travel around the gameboard buying property. The properties represent Bloomingdale’s department stores around the United States. Houses and hotels from Monopoly are replaced with little and big brown bags. Players can play until all but one player is bankrupt or the richest player is determined to be the winner after a one-hour time limit.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: ALLSAFE: The Food Hygiene Board Game
description: A board game that can be used by food hygiene trainers to teach different aspects of food hygiene, including personal hygiene, microbiological hazards, physical hazards, chemical hazards, food safety facts, Environmental Health Officers and court action regarding business owners, food handlers and consumers.

name: Joint Efforts: Primary Edition
description:
Designed by Lancashire County Council’s School and Community Partnerships Team and Youth and Community Service this game was created to help parents, youth workers and other to learn how to deal with drugs.

The board represents the players' school and local community where they encounter situations or questions that challenge their knowledge of substances in the areas of law, personal and professional safety, health and safety, decision making and others.

The winner is the first player who reaches home and answered most questions correctly.

Home Page: http://www.lancsngfl.ac.uk/lses/index.php?category_id=17

name: Cross Purposes
description: Outmaneuver your opponent's tiles as you race to home territory.

name: Beowulf: Skirmish at Heorot
description:
This is a skirmish game set in the Dark Ages and based on the Beowulf poems.

One player controls the monster Grendel, the other player takes control of Beowulf and his 14 geats (=his warriors).

The setting is Heorot - the hall of the Danish king Hrothgar.

Success of the actions is determined by 6-sided dice. There are different victory conditions for both sides, you can score major or minor victories.

The game appeared in Battlegames #4 as a free insert.

name: Baseball's Board Game
description: This easy-to-learn game for two players features a baseball-diamond board design and includes two dice, chips that represent players, a scoreboard to keep track of runs and outs, and a statistical sheet to follow up singles, doubles, triples and other plays. It is based on aspects of the baseball game played around the world. The game consists of odd innings (five, seven or nine), and championships can be played by preliminary rounds. Baseball’s Board Game is endorsed by Carlos Lee, Star Game player in 2005 and 2006, MLB Home Run Derby 2005, and current star of the Houston Astros.

name: Vakantie Quiz
description:
Vakantie Quiz is a Dutch Quiz game about traveling through Europe.

Depending on the city, the players try to answer a question from different categories.

He, who first answers questions in the different categories correctly is the winner

name: Action Front! Hakko Ichiu
description:
December 1941: The Japanese, having crippled the US Pacific Fleet, run rampant through the Southern Pacific. Island after island, city after city, fall in one of the most remarkably executed plans in military history. The second ACTION FRONT! game, Hakko Ichiu, pits Japanese SNLF and paratroopers against US and European troops in battles from Wake Island to Malaya.

In a small series with Action Front! Watchtower.

name: Loose Lips
description:
From the Patch Products Press Release:

Loose Lips™ is more than a drawing game, more than an acting game and more than a talking game. It's all three games in one.

When you play Loose Lips, you'll give clues by talking in some rounds and acting or drawing in other rounds. Your goal is to get your teammates to guess the answer without letting forbidden similar words slip off their lips. If they guess the right word, your team scores. But if your team has loose lips and says the forbidden words, the other team scores.

Here's an example: If the answer is Hawk and the forbidden Lip Slips are Bird and Buzzard, you'll have to give clues to get your team to say Hawk without saying the similar forbidden words—Bird or Buzzard. And you only have 60 seconds! This fast-paced party game will keep your teammates' lips moving while you talk, act or draw your way through each word.

Loose Lips is played with 4 or more players in 2 teams, ages 12 to adult

name: Silly'Ables
description:
From the publisher's website:

Silly'ables is a hilarious word game for 2 to 8 teams, ages 12 to adult. Each team when it’s their turn rolls a die, and by that roll, they’ll know whether they’re trying to solve a one, two, or three syllable word.

There are 500 playing cards in the game, each with a die representation from one to six. If a team tosses a 1 or 4 they will try to solve a one syllable word, toss a 2 or 5 they will try to solve a two syllable word, and finally if they toss a 3 or 6 they will try to solve a three syllable word. On each card there are random pictures of a red die, which are (all play) cards and the remaining picture of dies are in white (for that team only) cards.

Each team will choose their partner to either be the giver or receiver of clues, and will alternate roles each time. No team member can be a giver or receiver more than once in a row. The giver of the clues can draw, do gestures, or give one word clues to get their partner to guess the target word. NO talking other than one word clues!

There are three special symbols that might be on the cards. One that lets your partner know that a word sounds like another. Second, a symbol that indicates that you’re looking for a word opposite of the word given as a clue. Finally third, a hand that shows either one, two, or three fingers which lets your partner know your looking for the first, second, or third syllable of a word to use with other syllables to eventually solve the target word.

name: Winflation:  The Consumer Survival Game
description:
An extraordinarily rare game I recall playing as a child, Winflation' is little more than a fond memory for me now. It belonged to a childhood friend--a gift from the designer, if I recall correctly--and I've never seen it in a store.

To the best of my recollection, there were similarities to roll 'n' move games such as PayDay or Life: The board was a simple figure-eight track around which the playing pieces would move, and each space had some sort of action or consequence for the player; there were also free spaces that required no activity. In addition, there were stock certificates that could be purchased and/or traded as well as cards to be drawn at certain points; the cards also had ramifications for the player, similar to the Chance/Community Chest cards in Monopoly.

I'm afraid I don't recall the specific mechanics--obviously the notion of inflation was part of the game--but the essential goal was to remain solvent and earn more money than your opponent(s). My recollection is that the game ended when a certain period of time had passed, most likely defined by a set number of laps around the board. I enjoyed the game quite a bit when I was a kid: It seemed more sophisticated and complex than its roll 'n' move cousins, and I recall there being a number of potential activities to be undertaken with each turn.

I would love to hear from anyone else who has played this rare gem. It was published by a company called Zany Eights Productions, Inc., in Pottstown, PA; I suspect that the first-and-only print run was very limited, and Zany Eights never published any other games, as far as I know.

edit:
From the Rules:
The object of the game is to be the last remaining played on the board who has survived week after week of spiraling inflation. As inflation becomes worse and the cost of living increases, each player must meet his daily expenses, while making sure his salary keeps pace with current prices. Most Importantly, each player must keep his job in order to avoid certain financial disaster. Although provisions have been made for only six players, any number may participate. The amount of time required for each game varies with the rate of inflation.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Dragon's Loot
description:
From the publisher:

Players travel from castle to castle, capturing treasures from kings as they wind through a magical path on the game board. Dragon cards can help in the quest by allowing Dragons to steal treasure or to see clearly when flying at night under a bright moon. Beware! Sometimes Dragons have to give their treasure back or they meet up with Wizards and Knights determined to slay them.

Object of the Game
To compete against other Dragons and end up with the most loot!
Game Contents
Dragon's Loot Game Board, 1 Die, 4 Dragon Playing Pieces, 4 Dragon Cards, 44 Treasure Cards

name: Mega Zatrikion
description:
Mega Zatrikion is an ancient and Byzantine chess game. This chess game has seven variations according to the more ancient board game of "Pessoi".

These versions have all the known pawns of modern chess with a bigger grid. In some variations there are additional pawns connected to ancient philosophy.

Played with Mega Zatrikion in some versions are three dice with the ancient shapes of various eras and in this version the highest roll starts the game.

Mega Zatrikion has the following items:
1. One colorful Board (Grid)12x12.
2. The pawns of each player are a different color. Colors are the veneti (red color) and the greens (green color).
3. Three dice with shapes.
4. Other material.
5. A book with some information for this game along with photos.
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Memory

name: Scouting
description: This game with a copyright date of 1926 is called a "Great Pioneering Game for Boys". It is a simple roll and move game with the object being to be the first Scout to reach the Fort. Prairie fires, lightning strikes and falling trees are some of the obstacles you have to overcome on your trip into the Fort.

name: Maelstrome
description:
It is the Darke Age and darkness abounds. In a time before the unleashing of Black Powder the third epoch in Valon's history is if anything more disjointed and scarred than the subsequent Age. Morgana the Empress of the Crystal Elf Empire sits upon the Peacock Throne with her younger son Mordred at her knee, she has ruled a thousand years and in her resides the best chance to halt the decay.

Maelstrome is a fantasy mass combat system based in part on the famous Slaughterloo game and it features many of the same races and creatures that players will already be familiar with, though they are much changed. Alongside the Crystal Elves, progenitors of the Ferach, are the Krautan Dwarves members of a League encompassing hundreds of small baronies and thiefdoms. The Krautans are next in strength to the Crystal Empire and more powerful than the Cities of Man that have appeared across the central continent. Other organized states try to hang onto the vestiges of a disappearing civilization but it has not been easy for the Undead led by the sinister Necromancers and the Dragon Children or Dracci have rampaged across Valon embroiled in their own huge war that decimates all who fall in its path.

From the frozen north the shambling Undead have crumbled many societies and created free booters and mercenaries who sell their swords to the highest bidders, among them the Gnome Legion and the Dogmen of Stasia. It is in Alevia a former province of the Crystal Empire that the mighty Elf regiments make their stand against the Undead and the Dracci. It is from the vast sea in the south beyond Ibe-Herra that the Dragons came bringing carnage to the Goblin Principalities behind their wooden walls and forming an alliance of convenience with the fawning Lizardmen. Savage Orc tribes migrate across all these battle torn lands bringing more pain, though as always their enemies loose flights of barbed arrows upon their approach.

Choose your side carefully in the Maelstrome for though you may admire the remorseless Necromancers or the fury of the Dracci the other races have much to offer. March with the Imperial Elf Regiments or the Regiments of the Wood Elves not forgetting the armies of Man or the Orc Tribes. All can hire warriors from a common pool of fighters, entire units of Ogres, Mountain Orcs even Gnomes who kill with hundred tiny blades. Do not forget of course that your army must have a powerful Mage to wield Wylde Magick in a nimbus of power to pour on your foes each race sports different lethal incantations. Also you can use a Beast Handler to control huge savage monsters that are the doom of a multitude of soldiers, War Trolls and Corpse Monsters assembled from piles of the recently dead.

Once this army of yours is assembled and stands ready uniforms bright or armour rusted and well used you must select a Warlord and special leaders to drive your units forward. In the Maelstrome all must fight for their own ends and alliances seldom last out a season.

name: HOMopoly
description: Here is another themed edition of Monopoly, this one created for a Metro Detroit charity event benefiting Hospice Of Michigan. All properties have been replaced with southeast Michigan business organization sponsors, such as Dow Automotive, The Detroit Free Press, Charity Motors, PVS Chemicals, Compuware, etc. The railroads have become Detroit People Mover stops. Pawns include a snowman, electric guitar, slot machine, spark plug, classic car, and the Ambassador bridge.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Shindig
description: This game is from the TV show "Shindig" which aired on ABC in 1965. It has 46 blue markers & the instructions on how to play. There are 240 Fact Cards.

name: Pax: Game of the Century
description:
Pax, the game of the Century seems to be the only game ever published by the Chesapeake Bay Trading Company, later known as the Foreign Advisory Service. The publisher was a specialty import company that dealt mainly in Dutch and French dishes and pewter, Royal Leerdam, Delft, Quimper, etc. No designer is listed.

The game consists of a deck of cards representing nations or geographic areas and the object is to complete a "hand" of nations that dominates the world political scene to the extent of being able to enforce a "Pax" similar to the ancient Pax Romana. Specially stamped poker chips are used in bidding for cards. Besides the rules and a score pad, the game came with a green felt playing surface with a map of the world and other significant items in white. This surface is known in the rules as "the traditional green table of diplomacy". The game came in two types of boxes, one a padded leatherette style and the other a red paper covered cardboard with trays to hold the cards and chips. The smaller red box has a pocket inside the lid to hold the rules and score pad.

Four players is the optimum number, though rules are given for a three player game. The four players represent the United States, Soviet Union, the United Kingdom, and either France or Germany, as picked by the dealer. Play then proceeds until one player has built up a hand through either draws, auction, or trading large enough to declare his peculiar pax based on his political leanings.

The four types of Paxes are:
Pax Americana
Pax Muscovita
Pax Atlantica (the English Pax)
Pax Europeana (French or German Pax)

The game betrays its Cold War background by some of the interesting art and factoids on the cards, which are about three times the size of playing cards and are quite colorful with period artwork. The rules are a scant two pages, but are easily picked up by any traditional card players who are familiar with bridge. Certain cards are usable only with certain Paxes and vary in value. The publisher boasted that "Pax is sold in all the free countries of the world."
publishers: Chesapeake Bay Trading Company / Foreign Advisory Service

name: Rough Riders Ten-Pins
description: The R. Bliss Manufacturing Company of Pawtucket, Rhode Island produced this "bowling game" at the turn of the century at just about the time that real TEN PIN BOWLING was taking hold in the United States. This game features heavy cardboard "pins" like Rough Rider, Indian, Cowboy Dude, and Cow Girl. Each pin had a number value marked on it. Knocking them over scored you the points listed on the individual pin. You had one shot to score. The pins were randomly set up by your opponent so the numbers on those pins were not in the same place on every turn. highest score after 10 "frames" won the game.

name: The Yacht Race Game
description:
From Margaret Hofer's Book 'The Games We Played'.

The setting for this game The Yacht Race Game is New York Harbor where boats sail in the shadows of the Statue of Liberty, the Brooklyn Bridge, and Governor's Island. The course itself is divided into sections or spaces numbered from 1 to 83 inclusive, the connection on the return is taken up at space 63. The outside course is only to be used in case of a tie.

The course: The yachts start at square 1 and proceed along the course and around the lightship following spaces as they are listed reaching space 88 and then passing to space 63 to go back on the home stretch returning to space 11 which is located between buoy 15 and the Flagship boat which is the finish line.

name: Rival Policemen
description:
from an article written by Margaret Hofer in the book "The Games we Played"

This McLoughlin game comes with vivid graphics and an oversized box which probably makes it one of the companies best games. Players representing rival police forces compete to capture the greatest number of crooks roaming the city's streets. Rival Policemen was inspired by a tense period in New York City's history when a state controlled police force and the city's police force worked simultaneously (but not necessarily cooperatively) to protect the city.

name: Chips are Down
