description: This is a guessing game from Ideal. There is a table that holds chips. You guess how many chips will remain on the table and then you press a lever which releases some of the chips. You guess how many will be released to win them.

name: Petra, Paul & Co.
description:
Petra, Paul & Co. is an educational game about decisions made in the local politics to improve your home town.

The Players act as local parties and try to get enough influence from the other players to fulfill their agendas.
If an agenda is fulfilled, the corresponding part of the gaming board is flipped over to show the improvement. The game ends if a player has fulfilled all of his agendas.

In their turn the players move on the board according to a die roll. They can change direction in 90 degrees but only once in their turn. If they get to another player or to a space that is connected to their agenda, they collect votes. if they get to the library or the newspaper, the players can answer a trivia question to collect another vote. The votes are collected on a separate board, witch shows the game progress. If a players stops at the town hall, a poll is executed. The wining agenda gets as many votes, as players take part.

The game is a clear educational game with easy mechanism for quick explanation.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Voting

name: De Verbis
description:
De Verbis is a promotional word-formation game from Linguamón - House of languages and it can be played in various languages. From the rules booklet:

"Only one thing is more fun than guessing words: getting others to do it. In DE VERBIS, players take turns at thinking up and guessing words. The player who does it best wins the round."


Contents:

45 letter cards
10 "?" cards
30 counters
A pen and paper are needed for keeping score


Summary of rules:
In each round one of the players thinks a 8-10 letter word and marks it with the "?" cards on the table and keeps the deck of letter cards. The other players are given some tokens and, in turn, they ask for a letter: if it is included in the word, the player with the deck of cards places that letter in its correct position on top of the corresponding "?" card; if the letter is not in the word, the player who asked for it must pay 1 token. Whenever a player guesses the word correctly he receives 2 tokens plus as many tokens as "?" cards are still in the word; but if the guessed word is wrong, the player must pay 2 tokens. The player who thought the word receives as many tokens as the difference between the top scorer and the least scorer.

Following the philosophy of the publisher the rules are in Catalan, Spanish, English, French, Basque, Galician, Occitan and Italian.

About the publisher:
The publisher, Linguamón – House of Languages, is a body set up by the Government of Catalonia with the aim of promoting the world's languages as a:

vehicle for communication, civilization and dialog
source of personal development, human creativity and heritage of mankind
right of individuals and of linguistic communities

name: Ovalia
description:
An original CARD GAME inspired by international RUGBY!

Goal : mark points by achieving remarkable card associations.

Issued from rugby, there are associations which are worth a try (5 points) or a drop-goal (3 points). Tries can be converted adding 2 more points. Finally, there is the risk to get a Red Card which freezes a card and cancels the corresponding combination.

MATERIAL

80 cards forming 5 families of 16 cards each. The emblems represent the most famous international rugby squads in "Ovalia" :

The Wallabies / England / Les Bleus / The All Blacks / The Springboks

Every family has 15 numbered cards from 1 to 15 representing the players of a rugby team, and a supplementary one representing a "red card".
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: The Amazon Hop
description:
From the press release:

Teach little ones good behavior, manners and social skills while having lots of swinging, screeching and squawking fun. This game comes with 50 question cards,16 lily pads and stone foam pieces, and a Jungle Activity wheel. When a child answers a question correctly and hops to the next foam pad, the spinner is spun and he acts out one of 16 activities, such as "Hop like a tree frog," or "Trumpet like an elephant." The finish line marks the crossing of the "Amazon River."

name: Roxy's Eat Right Board Game
description:
Join Roxy and her friends on a quest to find healthy foods. The Roxy's Eat Right board game teaches children about the food groups, the food pyramid, calories, vitamins and minerals, how to make balanced meals, and how to identify junk foods. The box contains one fold-out 20" x 20" game sheet and 51 Eat Right Cards. The game sheet is 2-sided (2 games), plus there are rules for 2 other games to play with just the cards.

Each card highlights a common food item in beautifully colored graphics illustrated by former Disney cartoonist, Clifford Dunston.

• Each card shows the number of servings of the food group for which it pertains.

• Each card shows the typical number of calories in the food item.

• Each card has a "Vitamin Power" rating and a "Junk Factor" rating. These ratings are calculated using a formula based on the content of vitamins, minerals and junk ingredients (fat, cholesterol, added sugars and sodium) as a percentage of the Recommended Daily Allowance (RDA)

• Each card is given an "Overall Rating" based on a formula using Vitamin Power per Calorie and Junk Factor per Calorie.

• Each card has a short description of the good and bad characteristics of the food item.

• The cards are color-coded by food group acording to MyPyramid.

• Each deck comes with 3 different games: Duel, Snack Attack, and Build-A-Meal - find even more game rules here.

• Each of the games will help kids to form healthy eating habits. Players are rewarded for choosing good foods to eat and penalized for eating junk foods.

• Teachers can use these cards in the classroom as an fun teaching tool - kids just love the cards!

http://www.educationalcardgames.com/6.html
http://www.shopatron.com/product/part_number=0152/331.0.8884.0.0.0.0

name: Speed Limit
description:
From the press release:

Whether on land, in the air, or even underwater in a new submarine, players must follow rules to survive, and avoid getting caught going over the speed limit. This exciting game tests players’ abilities to obey traffic laws and use the proper speed to become the race ace. “Speed Limit helps players become familiar with various kinds of transportation while improving their skills at adding and subtracting numbers,”

name: All Around Town
description:
From the Press Release:

All Around Town is played on a high-quality felt mat with detailed town and road graphics. Players travel to the Doctor, Dentist, Fire Station, Police Station and elsewhere as directed by the playing cards, either spending or earning money while obeying stoplights and road signs. Parents can interact with children and teach valuable health and safety facts during the fun, educational game.

name: Uberzuiker Presents Pele's World Football
description: From the publisher: "A high-octane sports game that simulates real World Cup soccer, from Anthony E. Zuiker, the creator of CSI."

name: Bling Bling
description:
The board game that features Hip Hop's favorite Dice game, C-Lo or 456.

Rappers Rap about it, Singers sing about and now you and your friends can play it at home.

Make moves, buy property and accumulate money. Be the best player at erecting urban city projects and you can be the winner at Bling Bling.

Coming to a hood near you.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Game of Basket Ball
description:
One of a number of Chaffee & Selchow table games about sports done at the turn of the century. -- Bicycle Race (1891), The New Bicycle Game (1894), Bowling (1896), The Harvard-Yale Game (1899).--

The Game of BASKET BALL came out in 1898. Margaret Hofer in her book "The Games We Played" refers to the game with this short paragraph.

"Women's Basketball was introduced on the Northampton, Massachusetts campus of Smith College in 1892 less than 1 year after the game's invention. In 1898 when this table game appeared, women were playing basketball at recreation centers, YWCA's, college gymnasiums, settlement houses, and high schools across the country."

This game is also listed by AGCA in its "BOARD GAME CATALOG" 8th edition dated Oct. 1998 and by Joel Shrock in his book "The Guilded Age".

name: Volangulary
description:
From the website:

Now you can test and improve your vocabulary and language skills while challenging your family and friends to a game of strategy and fun.

Better keep your wits about you! Players move their game pieces around the board, heading toward the winner's circle. They collect PASS and BLOCK cards as they go. PASS cards will assist you while BLOCK cards impede you. Passing and Blocking adds a dimension of strategy and planning not seen in other games.

No matter your native language, Volangulary™ will help you discover whether you really know the meanings of everyday words, and how to use them properly.

Test your skills in one or more languages regardless of your age. Multiple game levels are included, enabling kids to play against kids, adults against adults, or kids against adults. Anyone can win!

name: Button, Button, who's got Bear's Button?
description:
From the Press Release:

The objective of the game is to button up Bear's coat with three matching-colored buttons. Each player chooses a bear card wearing their favorite colored coat. The colored buttons are randomly placed face-down on a large, easy-to-use spinning board embellished with tumbling bears. After spinning the board, the player must choose one button from any of the four heart-shaped arrows. If the button matches the coat on the player's bear, they place it on his coat. If the button does not match, the player returns it to the board, face-down, and has to remember where it was. The first player to button up Bear's coat wins the game!

name: The Kings Hexes
description: The Kings Hexes is a game which simulates two medieval kings attempting to grow the surrounding regions around their castles. By growing larger they are able to recruit more troops, and gather more levy from their citizens. The Kings Hexes is a game which simulates city building by randomly drawing tiles from a shared pool. Players win by having the most points at the end of the game.
categories: City Building, Fantasy, Math, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Megapower Football Tournament
description:
The Megapower Football Tournament is played on a board (size 120 x 60 cm) which is surrounded by stands.

The number of players is variable. It can be played with 2, 4, 6 or 8 players and one referee.

At the beginning of the game the choice of sides is being determined by rolling a dice. There are two teams with 11 players each.

The players roll dice alternating and try to get to the other players penalty area and make a goal. Skill, strategy and speed determine the outcome of the game.

name: Card Golf
description: Card Golf is essentially the game of golf in a box. It can be played alone or with a group of two, three or four players. Each player is randomly dealt 14 club cards. The game is played and scored using a scorecard from any golf course in the world. Players must combine the club card yardage in their hand to match or exceed, by as little as possible, the yardage of each hole on the scorecard.

name: Totally Treble
description: Totally Treble is in way a sequel to Crazy 8ths, as they both deal with helping children learn musical notes. However, this one deals with learning treble clef notes. Many variants for card games, incorporating the element of music, are included.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Educational, Memory, Music, Number

name: Sesame Street Games for Growing: Alphabet
description:
The Sesame Street Games for Growing Alphabet game set is designed to help children learn letter names, letter shapes and simple spelling while playing and having fun.

The game set contains 5 games that should be played in order from the easiest to the most advanced.

The games in the set are played by using different game materials included. These materials are used in different combinations depending on which game is played: 1 standard size card deck of 56 alphabet cards, 1 maxi size card deck of 36 different picture word cards, and 1 mini size card deck of 36 different picture cards.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Crazy Farm
description: Players proceed down different safari paths such as "wet swamp", "tip toe trail" and "jumping jungle". On each safari path, they try and collect friendly animals for the "crazy farm which is a high class resort for the zany animals that are tired of plain jungle living." A simplistic roll & move game for kids in which the winner is the person who collects the most animal cards.

name: Go Go Kani-la
description:
Very simple action game published in 1971 in Japan.
Each player set Kani-la on his catapult and try to throw them into the opponent player's field through the hole. Sometimes Kani-la was hooked on the net. In any way, the first player who has no kani-la in his field wins.

Simple, but really fun game.

name: Go Figure! Crazzzy Critters
description:
From the press release:

The goal of this tricky card game is for players to put together the set of shape cards in a manner that creates an image their opponents will recognize. The Crazzy Critters game has players create various animal shapes, and during each round, the first player finished with his or her critter yells, “Go Figure!”

name: Touring with Your Hillman Imp Game
description: Touring with your Hillman Imp, The Modern Car Race Game is a simple roll and move game where accidents and detours along the way slow you down. This was basically an advertisement game for the Hillman Imp Automobile. "At the same time that Chevrolet was developing prototypes for the Corvair, the Rootes Group in England was designing a smaller but similar rear engine economy car, the Hillman Imp. Development of the Imp began in 1955, but production did not start until 1963, three years after the Corvair was introduced. The Imp remained in the Rootes lineup until 1976." the IMP was known as the Poor Man's Porsche and was designed by Allan V. Lacki.

name: Little Chief
description: LITTLE CHIEF ----- This 1966 game from Whitman was a simple roll and move game where players Ages 5 - 10 tried to win feathers for their headdress. Each player had a headdress to wear at the start of the game and each time a player landed on a particular square on the board they were allowed to add a feather. First player to get 5 feathers won the game.

name: I Wish I Were
description:
Game for girls 5 to 10 and a forerunner to games like What shall I be? The Exciting Game of Career Girls and What Shall I Wear?: A Fashion Game for Girls.

From the box: A new kind of game combining dress up clothes used on a colorful game board. Spots that one could land on featured MODEL, STEWARDESS, ACTRESS, TEACHER among others.

name: Counter-Ploy
description:
Counter-Ploy is composed of three different board games of skill, strategy and international power.

Game 1 is a military game in which each player owns certain countries with Army Divisions and Navy Fleets to defend these countries and conquer others. Military pieces are moved about the board(map of the world)to attack enemies and defend countries.

Game 2 concentrates on diplomatic strategy. No military pieces are used, yet countries must be defended against capture. Players try to acquire necessities such as, agriculture, gold, industry and oil. Players must skillfully negotiate with each other in order to increase the assets of their countries.

Game three puts it all together by combining the military strategy of game 1 with the diplomatic skills of game 2 to produce the ultimate game of dictators, kings, and presidents.

name: Mytteriet på Bounty
description:
A game based on the Mutiny on Bounty.
The players starts with 120 points each and the goal is to keep as many of the points as possible. As the players roll the die and move around the board (following the route of the ship) they earn and loses points based on where they land.
The player with the most points at the end, wins.

This is Damm game number 336.

name: City of Falls Churchopoly
description: Identical in concept to Monopoly, this game was created to showcase the City of Falls Church, VA and sponsored by the city itself - all proceeds were used to assist in Katrina relief. One drawback though is that it only supports 4 players.

name: Jul i Valhall: Jakten på Loke
description:
(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

Title: Christmas in Valhall: the Hunt for Loke

Come to Asgard and Valhall where Thor, Odin and the rest of the Nordic Gods rule

Loke has disappeared from the cave where the Gods chained him as punishment for the death of Balder. You fear that Loke will take his revenge and release Ragnarokk, so you must catch him as soon as possible with 3 chains and bring him back to the cave. Loke is as fast as the wind and not easy to catch, but follow and get help from the Gods in the hunt.

If you are really lucky, you find Lokes' key to Hel and may release Balder. Then you immediately may put two of your chains on Loke and get a good lead on your opponents.

But Loke is cunning, and you can not be safe with his capture. He may be stealing the magical apples in Valhall that gives him enough strength to free himself from the chains you have put on him. Are you the one to capture Loke and bring him all the way back to the cave?

name: Tren Tanken: Midgard
description:
(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

Tren Tanken = Exercise your mind

Now it's fun to learn history, geography and knowledge about society! "Tren Tanken" is a challenging and fun game - about the curriculum.

The team play game Tren Tanken presents new and intriguing learning strategies. The players work with maps and time lines, explains technical terms, structured concepts - or just answer questions. Tren Tanken can be played at school, as a part of the lessons - or at home. In addition to the cards with exercises and solutions, there are blank cards included that may be used to make exercises. The game is developed in Norway, in close relationship with pupils and teachers.

This edition is made for 10 year olds and up

name: Tren Tanken: Matriks
description:
(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

Tren Tanken = Exercise your mind

Now it's fun to learn history, geography and knowledge about society! "Tren Tanken Matriks" is a challenging and fun game - about the curriculum.

The team play game Tren Tanken presents new and intriguing learning strategies. The players work with maps and time lines, explains technical terms, structured concepts - or just answer questions. Tren Tanken can be played at school, as a part of the lessons - or at home. In addition to the cards with exercises and solutions, there are blank cards included that may be used to make exercises. The game is developed in Norway, in close relationship with pupils and teachers.

This edition is made for 12 year olds and up

name: Dyreparken: Spillet om ville dyr
description:
(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

Title: the Kristiand Zoo

Tapi? Wilderbeast? Komodo dragon? Learn about animals from all over the world in this fun game!

The gamers are to visit animals around the world on a mission from the zoo. Participants will have to answer questions, mime and challenge the other players in duels.

You start with a mission card and have to visit 3 different continents. On each continent you visit you have to bring back a picture as evidence of your visit. Visit the lion in Africa, the tiger python in Asia and the alligator in America. There are also harmless animals around the world like pandas, sleuths and squirrel monkeys.

You will probably get the most headache from the kind, but very stubborn donkey you may meet. You better have brought a carrot as a bribe.

The player who first gets back to the zoo with 3 different animals from 3 different continents wins the game! Have you learned anything of the animals you have visited?

name: Accu-Stat Pro Football
description: From an interview with Trip Hawkins, founder of Electronic Arts, on gamasutra.com: "I designed the precursor to Madden Football in 1970 as a board game called Accu-Stat Pro Football." The article notes that this game was "his very first entrepreneurial effort, funded by a loan from his father."

name: Lust auf Ometepe
description:
On the more than 60 different playing cards, the player discovers the Ometepe Island in the Great Nicaragua lake. Players then gather cards from different sectors such as animals, fruits, plants and life on Ometepe. The farther the game proceeds, the more difficult it gets to show all demand cards of one category.
The player who first succeeds in gathering the cards from 4 categories, wins the game and, hopefully, feels a lot like 'getting to know Ometepe'.

name: Race To Space
description:
The goal of the game is assemble rocket parts, a crew and some cargo on the Moon and launch.

Basic rules:
Each turn a player picks up a card. If they are able to lay down cards that total eleven (including at least one 1), then they are able to declare takeoff. Subsequent turns allow the player to move closer to the Moon with their rocket parts, crew or cargo. On arriving at the Moon, they need 11 to get back. This journey has to be undertaken 7 times to win. There is a lot of luck in how the cards fall. However it works for young children learning to count.

Plus rules:
Much like the basic game, except that the game now has Bad Weather (to prevent a takeoff or landing), Meteor Showers (to cause missed turns) and Engine Trouble (to slow down the journey). Of course each problem comes with a solution, Clear Skies, Meteor Shield and Repair Engine.

2*Plus rules:
Bad Weather can either cause a delayed takeoff (one missed turn) or delayed takeoff until Clear Skies are found.

3*Plus rules:
There are two spy cards, these cards can abort an Earth takeoff completely.

4*Plus rules:
The spies become one for the Moon and one for the Earth. Aborting an Earth takeoff just delays the journey. Aborting a Moon landing makes the entire journey useless, and they still have to get back to Earth to start another journey.

5*Plus rules:
Either the journey cards are played like Gin Rummy, when a set is complete, or the journey can be accumulated as they are in Mille Bornes

The game played at 4*Plus can take well over 4 hours, with each Spy testing the best of friendships.

name: Blackout
description:
Blackout predates American involvement in, but not awareness of, World War II. In this game, players roll dice and cover (or "black out") the matching spaces of their respective cities. The first player to fully cover his city announces "BLACKOUT" and wins the game. Counters are also provided in case the players wish to play a series of games, with each player losing one counter per uncovered space to the victor.

As the dice only passes from one player to another when he is unable to use his roll to cover spaces in his city (and another player *can* use that roll to do so), it is possible for a player to win on his first turn. In that case the, payout for the multi-game series is limited to five counters.

Blackout appeared in both the traditional narrow box (folded board) and wide box (unfolded board) formats.

name: Mondoes
description:
Mondoes is a rummy-like set collection game.
The 112 card set is made up of 4 suits each with two numbers.
The object of the game is to earn points by playing pairs of cards that score points by matching suit and matching numbers. (Matching numbers can be identical or sequential)

Players draw and discard until one player thinks they have a high enough score and calls "Mondoes". Other players can challenge the call if they believe they have a higher hand.

The game ends when one player has obtained 250 points.

name: Ziggurat
description: Played on a game board that represents a stepped pyramid, the object of Ziggurat is create equations by placing the dice rolled on the board. Players score points whenever they place a die , such that when added to a adjacent die they add up to 7. You can also score points for equations involving 3 dice. The equations can use addition or subtraction.

name: Kilt
description:
A clash of Scottish Clansmen. In Kilt players bump, bash and run past your opponents clans. The goal is to grab the rock that starts in the center of the board and dump it in your opponents well.

Components include:

1 16x16 board on a vinyl playing mat, 20 clan pieces and 1 rock.

name: Popeye Card Game
description:
The object of this card game, based on the Robert Altman film, changes from winning the most rounds you can in the High Game to losing the most rounds you can in the Low Game. The Dealer always decides on a High or Low Game depending on the value of the cards he holds in his hands. You are awarded points after each game is played only if you have won or lost a specific number of rounds. Capture the one and only Spinach Card and you will win a point for it alone. The first player to score 10 points wins the game.

There are 40 playing cards divided into 4 color-coded and character-themed suits numbered 1-10: Red Olive Oyl, Blue Swee' Pea, Purple Bluto and Yellow Popeye along with 1 Spinach card.

Long-winded rules that basically boils down to a slightly more extensive version of 'war'. Players lay down cards, highest value card within a suit wins, etc.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Grand Prix
description: A roll and move boardgame depicting Formula 1 racing. If you land on certain spaces good or bad things can happen. If you need make a pit stop you must draw a pit stop card which tells you how many rounds you need to wait in the pit stop.

name: Fjellvett spillet
description:
The players are skiing in the mountains,competing about who will be the first one getting to the big cabin on top of the mountain.
A children's game learning the players common sense in the mountain.

name: Reading for Detail
description:
Publisher:
"The object of the game is to be the first player to cross the finish line and enter the Winner's Circle."

Each player must answer reading comprehension questions in categories Who, What, Where, or When along the way.

Components: 1 game (board, 72 story cards, 2 spinners, instructions/answer key, 6 col. markers)

name: Commissions
description:
Commissions
The Real Estate Game
Each player is a real estate sales representative trying to earn $1,000,000 to win the game. It is a simple roll and move game where you work your way around the board listing, buying, selling and renting properties

name: Peter Potamus Game
description:
Object: Players to move around the gameboard with Peter, share his adventures and be the first to finish.

Parts: Game board, spinner, movers with genuine plastic bases, balloon cards

name: I.Q. Derby
description:
This is a trivia game with a horse-racing theme. It's complete title is "I.Q. Derby - "It's Official"" There are six categories and the box encourages you to "Get In The Saddle And Test Your I.Q.!" with "The fastest general trivia game around!"

I honestly know little more about the game, as the box is very uninformative and the only copy I have is still in the shrink wrap. I could find no other copies, nor any mention of the manufacturer on the internet. it was made by "KAGE/GAINER INTL., ft. Thomas, Ky. 41075."

name: Paulus resor
description: The game is in 6 parts, and in the beginning of each part new cards will be added (in the card squares). On the map there is three lines with points, each line representing one of apostle Paul's journeys. The first goes from Antiochia over Minor Asia to Troas, second from Damascus over Athen and back to Sidon, and the third from Tyros over the sea to Rome. The 6 cardsquares are located to Damascus, Antiochia, Jerusalem, Efesos, Malta and Rome.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Pursuit: A game about the history of civil rights since 1954
description:
Publisher:
"Six players, each representing a young black person, compete. (The part of a player may also be taken by a team of two or three players.) The game is played on a board showing a map of the 48 contiguous states. The map contains a red track, a blue one and a green one. As the players move around the tracks, their purpose is to achieve the highest possible goals in five areas: education, housing, jobs, public accommodations and voting. Final score for each player depends on: (1) the goals he set for himself at the beginning; (2) his ability to achieve those goals; (3) the region of the country in which he is located; (4) the time at which he tries to achieve his goals; and (5) a certain amount of luck."

name: Jolly Pirates
description: Windsor made this "Shooting" game in 1930. It featured a toy gun with a cork "bullet" which was used to shoot down Pirates in sort of an arcade type game.

name: Coney Island
description: Place the game on a table. Players stand 8 to 10 feet away and pitch disks at the gameboard. If any disks lie inside any target circle so as not to touch any part of an edge entitles the thrower to a ticket for that show or thing. The player securing the most tickets at the end of the game wins.

name: Cars: Road Race Game
description: A "3D" board game distributed in a bag with jelly beans for fuel. Promotional item for the Disney/Pixar film, "Cars", with two circular tracks linked with a flyover section of track to permit moving from the outer to the inner track. Movement is determined by an ineffectual 6 sided spinner rather than a dice. Cards are randomly placed on the spaces and turned over when the player lands on them. Players must collect 6 "organic fuel" cards to progress to the inner track. "Every time you get an organic fuel card you also get a high octane jelly."
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Molly's  Mystery Party Game A Spy on the Home Front
description:
From the box: Solve a mystery with Molly. It's Halloween night - but something mysterious has happened to the candy Molly and her friends collected! Everyone seems to have a motive, so everyone's a suspect. It's up to you and your friends to find the clues, crack the secret code, and unscramble the mystery!

How the Game Works: The mystery features characters from the popular Molly stories. The invitations you send out will tell your friends which character they'll play. On the party day, you and your guests can dress up and "get in character". Together, you'll read the script, search for clues - and solve the mystery!

Home Page: http://www.pleasantcopublications.com/characters/molly/SpyOn...

name: Panda Go Round
description:
From the Educational Insights catalog:

Panda-Go-Round is a fast paced race game of "turn and find," where each turn of the tube reveals a new expression on the panda's face, from happy or sad to sleepy - even surprised! Be the first to exactly match the expression on the panda's face with the one on the card and claim the card. Corresponding symbols on the tubes and inside the cards make the game self-checking. The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner. Builds visual discrimination skills, a key to reading success. Includes 2 face-maker tubes and 16 cards.

Ages 4 and up.

name: Combo
description: Game comes with a rule sheet and 60 cards. This is an inexpensive and pocketable little word building game that actually has strategy considerations. When to play a single letter card, when to play a "combo" card, when to sweep the table? Wow! This is Combo. For 2 to 5 teens & adults

name: Space Race
description:
The object of the game is to build a rocket made up of four sections, and then navigate it through space following a set flight plan that is drawn at the start of the game.

As you explore each new star system, a section of your rocket is jettisoned and the rocket accelerates until it reaches maximum speed and heads for your home system. The first player to complete their flight plan wins the game.

Game Contents:

• 1 Large playing board divided into two main sections depicting a rocket gantry for the preparation of the rocket and a star map for traveling through space.

• 6 Counters in six different colors

• 6 Rockets in six different colors, each rocket is made up of four sections.

• 6 Flight Plans

• 24 Flight Check Cards

• 1 Die

• 1 Dice cup

• 1 Rules booklet

name: Marine World
description:
The object of the game is to be the player to have the most points when the game ends. (Copied from the game's instructions)
Players roll a die and move their token first to complete the 'car' track, then to use their boats to move to different islands. Different spaces will allow players to draw a card from the elephant deck. Alternatively players may visit shops to collect souvenir cards. When a player reaches the end of the track the game ends.

name: Binary
description:
Binary is a series of 4 games that use a unique deck of cards. One side of the deck is all black the other side is all white.
The games require a basic knowledge of binary numbers, which the rules provide.

Binary I - a basic game of each player dealing out 4 cards and the highest number takes the pot. (an introduction into binary numbers)

Binary II - similar to Binary I, but players lay the 4 cards one at a time.

Binary III - similar to Binary II, but players lay the 4 cards one at a time, allowing players to raise if they believe they will have the highest number

Binary IV - players across from the table play with the same 4 cards to change it into the highest number. Each plays from their own perspective.

name: Dear Judge Ichiro
description:
Dear Judge Ichiro: the Board Game’ is a group game for 3 or more players derived from the novel Dear Judge Ichiro by Trevor Ryan (Zeus Publications).
It is based on problem solving, specifically anagrams, listening comprehension, parables, and proverbs.

Home Page: http://www.geocities.com/kevinbonbevan/index.htm
mechanics: Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Storytelling, Voting

name: Racing
description:
Racing is, of course, a racing game. Place the cars on the start line, roll the die and be first to the finish line. If you land on a square with star, you draw an event card which lets you advance some spaces, miss a turn, move again or similar.
Other squares have text that tells what happens when you land on them, for instance: "You drive perfectly through the first curve. You get an extra die roll" and
"Trouble with the engine. Move 10 squares backwards".

First car to the finish line wins the game

name: Junior Table Top Bowling Alley Game
description:
This game features 10 scaled bowling pins, 3 bowling balls, and a real return track, an adjustable spring bowler, scoring pads.

The game also includes an application for a junior bowling league.

From the box cover; "A game of fun and skill for the whole family."

name: Giant Wheel Cowboys & Indians
description: Game features a giant wheel that looks somewhat like a large gambling wheel, and a giant gameboard. Simple game of spin the wheel and move along the gameboard, first to finish wins the game. Ages 6 - 12

name: Situations
description:
The “What if...” game that could save your child’s life- teaching kids how to avoid abduction and abuse.

The greatest way to reduce children’s fear of abduction and molestation, while at the same time offering them the highest degree of protection, is to give them knowledge of how to respond when faced with a potentially dangerous situation. With a “What if...” game format using question/answer cards, Situations™ teaches children how to recognize and respond when confronted with potentially life threatening scenarios. You and your children will learn many of the actual methods and schemes used by real child predators one may read about in local newspapers.

This game will also have a profound impact on opening the lines of communication between children and their parents with respect to these subjects that, for even the best of parents, are often difficult to discuss.

Situations™ is a must for homes, classrooms, daycares and other group settings. This game is specifically designed for play between one or more children AND a parent or teacher, and is NOT recommended to be played without an adult.
Ages 4 and up
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Real-time

name: Outrageous Journalists
description:
From the back of the box:

"To play the game, suspects (called players) make their getaway beginning and ending at Rockington Estate. Unlucky players will wear the disguise or go to Da Pokey. The lucky player landing on the Outrageous Journalist (sticking his microphone out of a manhole) will collect $10 grand.

"The player collecting the most evidence wins, and in this game evidence can be bought and sold."

This simple and colorful boardgame was meant to satirize the many court trails which fueled a media frenzy in the early nineties.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Political

name: Miljöspelet
description:
To win the game all players most get one naturepicture (containing 6 cards) each. But this most be done before a picture of pollution are finished.

Components:
1 Rulebook (in Swedish)
1 Board
1 Dice
4 Markers
24 Cards

name: Lilla spöket Laban spelet
description: Roll the dice and move, go from start to finish in the castle. But on the way you can meet a ghost, witch, owl, king or maybe a bat. On the 48 different cards, "mysterious messages", you will get missions to complete.

name: Pocket-size Golf Card Game
description:
POCKET-SIZE GOLF is an ideal size game to carry along wherever you go, to get in 18 holes of Golf while in the auto, in a boat, on an airplane, at home in the living room, or in bed.

Basically take turns turning over a card and moving your marker down the fairway.

name: Ultimate Golf Trivia Game
description:
Here's your chance to show how much knowledge you have in the sport you love. It doesn't matter if you're a beginner or a Tour player, this game is exciting and fun for all. Play the course and impress your friends as you collect Bonus Points and set a new course record! Expect grudging admiration from your opponents as you answer questions. Over 2,400 golf related questions and answers will help you and your friends increase your knowledge and appreciation for this greatest of games.

Plays like real golf, with the object of this game is to shoot the lowest score for the round. Play the course and collect Bonus Points and set a new course record!
Win Bonus Points along the way as you correctly answer questions . More questions are then asked upon reaching the green, and your total score for the hole is recorded on a scorecard. Sound easy? It is, if you can avoid water hazards, out-of-bounds and bunkers!

Includes Game Board, four player pieces, over 2,400 trivia questions, eight Mulligan cards, die, pencil and scorecards.

name: Under Cross and Crescent
description:
"Under Cross and Crescent" is a game about the struggle of empires in the middle ages.
Religion, politics, trade, assassination and crusades as well as jihads are a part of this game.
Your Empire will give birth to new heirs to the throne and send out priests to become pope, or
if your nation is Islamic, you may launch a jihad against the catholic nations.
It´s all up to you to lead your nation to great power and wealth until the Mongol hordes invade.

This game features a new multi - purpose card system and the "Rondell - mechanism" from
Mac Gerdts games "Antike" and "Imperial".

( If this game doesn't find a publisher until the end of 2007 it will be available for free print & play )

name: Jungle Craze
description:
From the box: "An Adventure Game For All Those Who Dare To Enter The Taetsequama Jungle"

Jungle Craze is a roll the dice and move along the path board game. Instead of a simple path, however, the path crosses and intersects, often giving the adventurer choices, but sometimes forcing the adventurer into an undesirable path. Adventurers collect survival gear, hire guides, deal with natives, and of course, challenge Taetsequama. To win, they must steal the treasure from the native temple and then return to the start area. However, once the treasure has been stolen from the temple, other players can steal the treasure by landing on the adventurer carrying it.

The instructions list three levels of play which add complexity for higher levels. Some of the challenges involve rolling specific numbers on the dice -- "Snake Eyes must be rolled within 10 tries." Some issues are decided based on the player's life experiences -- "If you've seen 'Dumbo', go to the south elephant walk. If not, go to the north elephant walk."

name: The Dolphin Training Game
description:
The Dolphin Training Game... The title says it all.
Teach your dolphins many tricks like a Tail-walk or a goodbye wave and become the best dolphin-trainer of the bunch.

The game is based on and uses actual dolphin names from the Dolphin Academy in Curacao. The game is actually a trivia game for the most part with over 200 cards with questions and assignments.

The action takes place on a board representing the island of Curacao, home base of the Academy, and features several basins where you can teach your dolphins new tricks and collect fish.

There's a little extra for (beginner) puzzle fans: The board is divided in 13 pieces, with a large dolphin-picture on the back, making the game also usable as an old fashioned puzzle.

name: Computerama
description:
From the Publisher's website:


Computerama is a wacky family computer board game for two to six players, ages 8 to adult. This game combines many exciting features of other well known, and successful games all into one fun-filled event. Is it a Poker game? A Bingo game? Or a Word game? Yes, yes and yes! It’s all those and so much more.

Players are dealt Computerama Cards to start the game. The first player to finish their three cards and get to the Finish space wins the game.

Be careful of the many challenges that can confront you during this game. Don’t get caught between a “Rock, Paper, and Scissors.” Also always know when to “TIC, TAC, or TOE.”

name: Meine erste Verkehrs-Schule
description:
The name of the game translates to "My first traffic school".

Fast perception and reaction are needed in order to play this game which deals with road safety training for children.

The game comes with, among other things, four thrill whistles and a very beautifully illustrated solution poster With the addition of four play variants "Meine erste Verkehrs-Schule ----SCOUT - my first traffic school" helps children Ages 5 and up deal with situations involving being around traffic. Players discover what is the right or wrong behavior while being near or in traffic. Those conditions are described on "small traffic condition cards". In addition children become acquainted with the meanings of many road signs.

Contents: 1 small plastic car, 1 small plastic horn, 34 situation small cards, 14 small road sign cards, 14 pasteboard traffic signs, 1 solution poster, 1 rule book

name: Archos
description: 2-4 four players move their pieces around concentric circles and towards the center spot. Moves can be sliding one space around a circle, or jumping over another piece towards the center. Players get points by capturing (landing on) an opponents piece, or by "rescuing" (landing on) their own piece in the center.

name: FamilyLore
description:
from the games website:

FamilyLore, a new board game that centers around the players’ family history, genealogy, ancestors and traditions, encourages families to bond and share stories together … so every player is a winner.

FamilyLore Game is a unique board game for YOUR family. Unique because the game changes and grows as your family plays. FamilyLore Game is based on themes familiar to all families--and to other groups that have a shared history.

Players move around the board by answering questions about the family. These questions are organized around 20 themes.

Of the 600 Story Cards that are part of the game, 300 have questions to help you get underway. The remaining Story Cards provide players with a chance to write questions unique to them.

Serendipity spaces are at each corner of the board. When a player lands on one, s/he takes a Serendipity Card and follows its directions.

The first player to complete five trips around the board wins the game. Except, this is a game where everyone who plays wins because every player gets to tell his or her favorite family stories.

name: Beach Music Trivia
description:
Made by ERH in 1985 for 2-4 single players or any combination of teams.

Features 1000 Beach and Shag music questions!

OBJECT: Test your knowledge of Beach Music with this exciting game. It provides hours of fun as players try to answer question while avoiding such hazards as hang over, high tide, and too much sun. The first player to reach the condo and correctly answer a question wins!

Contents include: 250 cards, 4 pawns, 1 die, game board, and the cardboard insert.

name: Columbusopoly
description:
Made by World-Opoly in 1990 for 2 or more players ages 7 and up.

A community spirit game, custom designed to create the unique character of Columbus.

OBJECT: Players enter the game as visitors to Columbus. As players travel around the board, they have the opportunity to buy, sell, and trade properties. The winner has the opportunity to stay as a resident, while the others must pack their bags and leave town.

COMPLETE contents include: game board, 2 dice, 4 pawns, business license cards, sunny money, surprise cards, treasure chest cards, branches and corporate offices, and the instructions printed on the insert.

name: Disney's Cartoon Classics
description:
The video board game featuring Mickey, Donald, and friends. With actual footage from Disney’s animated classic cartoons. There are three games that can be played, Mickey’s Bingo, Feeling Ducky, and Every Which Way.

Made by Milton Bradley in 1986 for 1-3 players Ages 3 - 6.

Contents include: VHS tape, 3 two-sided game boards, 48 character tokens, 2 decks of 30 cards, 1 deck of 24 cards, cardboard insert, and the instructions.

name: Galloping Ghost!
description:
Galloping Ghosts was made by Lakeside for 2 or more players Ages 8 and up.

COMPLETE contents include: 1 revolving/spinning tray, 4 tablets, 4 colored pencils, and 4 ghost markers.
Objective: To not complete any words during the game. Players must drop out of the game when they form their 5th word.

Each player writes the first letter of a word with his colored pencil on the tablet in his writing section. When all players have written their letter, the tray that moves the tablets is turned left in the direction of the arrows so the tablets move to the next position around the table.

Players add a letter to the new tablet in their writing section. The letters in sequence should be part of a legal word. Game play continues as players add a new letter each turn to each combination of letters on the tablets. Players CANNOT "pass" a turn at any time. Each player uses a different colored pencil, so a missing color on any tablet can easily be spotted and quickly identified

When a player is forced to complete a word he moves his ghost marker to the next letter on his "ghostboard". He then runs a line through the completed word on the tablet. The tray is turned and the next player starts a new word on the tablet (the rest of the letter groups stay as they are).

Players should always have a word in mind as they play because they may be challenged at any time.

name: Kampfgruppe Zwei
description:
Kampfgruppe Zwei is the second volume of a series of books which attempt to present a system for accurately representing combat during the Second World War from the perspective of small units and individuals. This title places it's emphasis on the wide variety of ground vehicles which were involved in the conflict. Whilst it is perfectly capable of being played as a 'stand alone' system in it's own right by those who are exclusively interested in vehicle combat, it is also designed to fully integrate with the companion volume 'Kampfgruppe Eins' (Infantry Combat) for those who wish to explore joint operations between the two arms.

All that is required to play are models to represent the appropriate vehicles and terrain, a suitable playing area, six sided dice and a measuring device. Players are then at liberty to recreate combat involving motorcycles, Tiger tanks and everything in between.

name: Kampfgruppe Drei
description:
The third in the Kampfgruppe system series, this volume covers weapon systems such as mortars, which provided infantry units with their own integral 'artillery' support (down to platoon level in most armies). It also considers rockets, which were frequently employed in the close support role during street fighting and 'bunker busting' operations along with various other weapons.

A ready reference section is provided to maintain the flow of play when major aspects of the various procedures need to be confirmed. A section is also presented dealing with defensive works along with scenario ideas and tactical information relating to attacks made against them.

name: Kampfgruppe Vier
description: By using the contents of this volume in conjunction with other 'Kampfgruppe' titles actions such as raids by commando or airborne units can be recreated from landing. Larger scenarios might involve amphibious landings in the Mediterranean or 'island hopping' in the Pacific. On a more routine level, the various sections of this volume can be employed to provide air and 'off table' artillery support during predominantly land actions. Similarly, come of the specialized combat engineering vehicles developed for the Normandy landings can be used to assist in overcoming difficulties further inland, as occurred in the actual conflict. In common with its companion titles, Kampfgurppe Vier is fully compatible with all other aspects of the'Kampfgruppe' system and can be employed fully, or in part, to suit the specific requirements of players.

name: Rattenkrieg
description:
From the intro:

"Rattenkrieg" is designed as a stand alone game system that allows players to recreate fighting in built up areas during the Second World War. However, because it is based on the popular, tried and tested 'Kampfgruppe' series it is also compatible with the rest of Dropwing's World War Two titles, allowing scenarios of infinite variety to be created.

Urban fighting is held by many to be one of the most challenging aspects of modern warfare and this is equally reflected by the challenge of representing such combat on the war games table. This volume enables various types of infantry and vehicles to test their mettle against some of the unique situations to be encountered whilst fighting in built up areas.

Some of the most significant battles of the Second World War were fought in urban surroundings, such as Berlin, the Warsaw Uprising and perhaps most notably Stalingrad. However, it should also be remembered that, in addition to such epic and historically significant encounters, countless smaller actions took place within the towns and villages along the paths of advance made at all stages of the war. The prime purpose of "Rattenkrieg" is to enable this style of combat, along with its unique atmosphere and challenges, to be recreated on the tabletop.

Special procedures are presented to incorporate sniper duels, sewer fighters and tank hunting teams, in addition to more mainstream combatants. Ready reference sheets are printed on facing pages and due to the comb binding the book can be opened flat to speed up play by having all of the main procedures available at a glance.

"Rattenkrieg" also includes a scenario based on an historical event, which can be used to introduce new players to the game as well as form a basis for experiment with various aspects of the game.

name: Football Tactics
description:
Made by John Kovach Co. in 1980 for Ages 8 and up.

Contents include: 14 men, 1 football, 1 scoreboard, 1 game board, cardboard insert, and the numbers on the back of the men.

name: Flash Match VCR Jr.
description:
Made by Mattel in 1996 for 2-4 players Ages 10 and up.

A rapid fire memory challenge.

COMPLETE contents include: 1 VHS tape, 1 large playing deck, colored chips, plastic insert, and the instructions.

Test your memory and bluffing skills. Match cards from your hand to pictures, which flash on the screen, to win more cards. The player with the most cards, when the deck runs out, wins the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Micro Force: The Game – American Civil War
description:
From Back of Cover
Take command of a division in the Civil War with this fast-playing and fun system for tactical combat simulation. It has everything: rules, tables, a scenario generator plus a collection of prepared scenarios featuring many of the most popular battles of "The War Between the States."
- Game Rules and Tables for 10mm Miniatures
- Weapons Data for Artillery & Small Arms
- Scenario Design Guide
- 11 Ready-to-Play Historical Scenarios

SCALES:
1 infantry stand = +/- 70 men
1 cannon = a section (2 guns)
1" = 25 yards or meters
Typical 2 player game: 4' x 4' board; 2-3 hours

[Though a stand represents around 70 men, casualties are recorded for each half-stand. Thus a 5-stand regiment has 10 steps]
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Dragon Dynasty Collectible Card Game
description:
A CCG featuring all the mythical and historical Chinese heroes. There's Cao Cao from the Three Kingdoms; Lin Chung from the Water Margin; the Monkey King from Journey to the West; Bruce Lee etc.

The Starter Set kicked off with "Three Kingdoms I".

Following the Starter Set is "Expansion Set 1 : Water Margin I".

name: Surf's Up: Big Wave Game
description:
From the Press Release:

Based on Sony’s star-studded CGI film “Surf’s Up” due in theaters nationwide in June 2007, this game will give everyone a sneak peak. Players must try to get their four penguins over the wave to the other side of the beach, but big penguins can keep the smaller ones from getting too far and the wave is unpredictable.

name: Horseland: Blue Ribbon Day Game
description:
Gameplay involves a spinner to move along a course. Players need to collect one ribbon from each of four colors.

From the Press Release:

Visitors of the Horseland Web site, one of the top Web sites for girls with more than 3 million on-line users, and fans of the “Horseland” Saturday-morning television series can share their enthusiasm for horses with this board game. Players select their horses and try to earn points in different categories and compete to be the first player to get a blue ribbon.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Challenge USA
description:
Made by Skelton Shelton Nelson in 1979.

Exclusive features of the game include: 7 variations enabling the player to participate at different skill levels, ranging from a simple puzzle, to an entire group participating in an old fashioned history bee; A laminated game board displaying a map of the USA which can be written on and erased; self-check answers; and an opportunity to program your own cards.

Contents include: game board, 2 dice, 50 state puzzle pieces, 4 tokens, instruction booklet, 14 packages of programmed information cards, 1 set of penalty cards, 1 wild card, 1 dead card, 1 7-section card holder, 1 board design strip, claiming circles, East and West land banks, and 4 Liberty Bell tokens.

name: Math Marks the Spot
description:
From the manufacturer's web site:

Shake, roll and race! This oversized mat game will have your kids begging to practice their math. Roll the soft foam numbers and operation dice and race to find the answer on the oversized number mat! This durable vinyl mat features all the answers (sums and differences) to addition and subtraction problems that use numbers 1 through 6. Includes 3 dice and 28 cardboard game markers.

Ages 5 - 8
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math, Number

name: Watchamacallit Puzzlewords
description:
Each player thinks of a subject and secretly writes words relating to it on a planner, like a little crossword.

The other players call off positions on the board, finding the letters that make up the words.

By challenging and naming a word before it is complete, players can earn bonus points, but lose points if they are wrong.

Puzzlewords will increase your word power and provoke laughter and discussion all around the table.

name: Huey, Dewey, and Louie
description:
The Ice Cream Cone Game.

Made by Western Publishing in 1977 for 2-4 players Ages 7 - 12.

OBJECT: Be the first players to get an ice cream cone from the ice cream shop to Donald and Daisy.

COMPLETE contents include: 12 playing pieces, spinner, game board, and the instructions printed on the inside of the box top.

name: Hey Diddle Diddle
description:
A happy game for 2-4 players Ages 4 and up. No reading required!

Made by Colorforms in 1981.

OBJECT: Travel along the starry trail, jump over the moon, and be the first player to arrive home.

COMPLETE contents include: platform game board, spinner, 4 colorful cows, 4 wooden sticks, and the instructions printed on the box top.

name: Battle Dot 1
description: This game for Ages 4 and up and up helps them learn beginning math concepts like counting on. It plays similar to war, but instead of a standard playing card deck, each card shows a small sum represented by dots of different colors. Children lay down cards, then determine if they've won the hand by adding the sums. Comes with 24 large cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: 'Eye Jinxx
description:
From the Introduction to the Rules:
"Eye Jinxx, the jigsaw puzzle board game, can be enjoyed several ways.
It can be assembled cooperatively, by one or more persons, without rules or time constraints.
It can be assembled competitively, by two or more players/teams, in accordance with the rules, time limits, and scoring format provided. We recommend a maximum of FOUR teams, with no more than SIX players per team.
Also, whether playing cooperatively or competitively, there is the ongoing challenge of locating the eight hidden objects.
We recommend that prior to playing the game, the puzzle be assembled and the hidden objects be located."
Components include jigsaw puzzle pieces, game board, D6 die, 4 pencils, 3 minute sand timer, score pad, and 4 hidden object cards.
NGC 404
Copyright 1990 by Strathcona Mosaic Limited.

name: Intense Bridge
description:
A published Bridge variant.
It uses Jill cards to allow the declarer to call "his" or "hers".
HIS ranks: A K Q Jack Jill 10 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2
HER ranks: A Q K Jill Jack 10 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2
A few other rules change this game from the standard Bridge game.

name: Stopp!
description: This game is basically a copy of the Hasbro-Game "Taboo": You explain words to your team members and try to avoid certain "Stopp-Words". Main difference: The explanation time is much shorter and you are only allowed to explain 1 card.

name: 3 in 1 Table-Top Sports
description:
From the box:

CALLING ALL TABLETOP SPORTS FANS!

Flex your fingers and get ready to flick! Inside this cool package you'll find everything you need to play tabletop soccer, hockey, AND football!


26 punch-out pieces for players, ballsa, and pucks!
Two sturdy goalposts!
Stickers!
Dozens of game rules, flick tips, and more!


From the rulebook:

When's the last time you played a game of soccer, hockey and football...on the kitchen table? Get set to flex your fingers and challenge your friends! Use this book to score your way into the tabletop sports history books...

INCLUDES:


Amazing finger flick techniques!
Team uniform tips!
Tabletop game rules!
Scoring strategies!
Plus! Other fast moves and quick tricks!

name: Oz Quiz 2000
description:
The updated version of 1984's Oz Quiz.
The crazy, zany around-Australia trivia game.
Over 2000 questions. Comes packaged in an esky as per the original.

name: Pooh Scavenger Hunt Game
description:
From the manufacturer's web site:

Join Pooh, Piglet, Eeyore and Tigger for a most exciting adventure. Collect everything on your list. Everyone wins!
Several ways to play for different skill levels. Features chunky cards for small hands.

Develops shape and color recognition, counting skills and cooperative play.

For Ages 3 and up.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Yale-Princeton Football Game
description: Large, colorful football themed boardgame with beautiful graphics. Comes with wooden play pieces and spinners.

name: The Flintstones Mitt-Full Game
description: Dexterity game that features mitts shaped to look like Fred, Wilma, Barney and Betty. The object of the game is to keep a ball balanced on the mitt without it rolling off as you try to do a series of moves determined by cards that you draw.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric

name: Goomicus Alphabet Soup Word Game
description:
Alphabet Soup Word Game. The starting player takes the spoon and ladles out 2 spoonfuls of letters for himself, then passes the bowl to the next player until everyone has their own 2 spoonfuls (approximately 30-35 letters total). Each player tries to use all their letters to construct words. Object is to achieve the highest letter word score in a given period of time. The Goomicus is a free letter and can be used to represent any letter of the alphabet. Scores are calculated by the number of syllables in each word, by the number of letters used, and by the number of Goomicus tiles used. Penalties may incur for unused letters depending on the chosen difficulty of the game. You can play competitively, on teams, or freestyle depending on the player ages.

Contents: Instruction pamphlet; bowl; spoon; 130 connectable letters (8 of which are Goomicus which is wild)

Ages 6 and up

name: Walt Disney's Mickey Mouse If I Were In Your Shoes Game
description: Collect the most tokens by staying out of another player's shoes. Ages 8 and up
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bones
description:
Made by Ponder Mason Games in 1986 for Ages 7 and up.

Bones is a high rolling, exciting and challenging dice game with a race to get bonus points. It may be played solitaire or as many players as one wishes.

COMPLETE contents include: 5 dice, score cards, roll em’ bones pencil, and the instructions.

OBJECT: Finish the game with the highest score. Fun and thrills till the very last roll.

name: Happy Landing
description:
A geography game made by Whitman in 1962 for 2-4 players Ages 12 and up.

A help yourself educational game for home and school.

COMPLETE contents include: large world map, colored disks, question cards, smaller map, cardboard inserts, and the instructions.

OBJECT: To acquire the greatest number of points by identifying locations indicated on the cards.

name: One Fish Two Fish Red Fish Blue Fish Game
description:
For 2 to 4 players Ages 3 - 8.

Use your magnetic fishing pole to collect fish and put them together to make a puzzle. Includes 4 fishing poles, and 16 fish in 4 different colors.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Novel-based, Puzzle
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Mr. Detective
description: Obviously inspired by Clue, the object of the game is to move from city to city (rather than from room to room) to discern the location of a hidden bomb within eight game-days. A decently produced game, one of several released in 1985 by obscure Kits Game Corporation.

name: Racepoly
description: In Racepoly: The Race of the Century, players first engage in an "authentic auction" for international-class race horses, then pit their horses against each other in a complex race involving money management and various pitfalls. One of several decently produced games issued in 1985 by obscure Kits Game Corporation.

name: Sling Dingers
description: This is a game of Indoor Lawn Darts. Using plastic pieces and plastic targets players try to softly lob the pieces into circular targets. Succeed and score a point. The game advertises that it could be played outdoors but the pieces are just not sturdy enough for the pounding that an outdoor game would inflict on them and the pieces are so light that outdoor winds would play havoc with the game. Certainly best played indoors.

name: Blockade Runner
description:
Blockade Runner was inspired by an actual Yankee civil war game. The chance of the Runner getting into port is about the same as in 1864.

After the USA began the blockage, merchant ships became runners. The Rewards were worth the risk. Blockade Runners were leaving England hoping for a big payday.

Two, three or four people play this fast acting game.

For Ages 10 and up.

name: Bienchen summ herum
description: There is a colorful meadow with flowers. Bees fly from flower to flower to collect pollen. Dice is rolled to move the bees. Small children learn to distinguish the different colors.

name: Kampen om Borås (Kunskapsspelet)
description:
Kampen om Borås (Kunskapsspelet) is a game about the Swedish city of Borås. The mechanics is, roughly, a mix of Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit where most of the questions are about the city and its history.

Home Page: http://www.kunskapsspelet.se

name: Football Game
description: Play on any flat surface, set out the flags & goals to represent a football pitch. Set out the players (counters) in any formation you wish & move the ball around by flicking. Place the white disc ( the ball) in the center & toss a coin to decide who kicks off.

name: Hard Burn
description:
A "Firefly"-themed card game similar to Mille Bornes. Make money, but keep flyin'.
From the rulebook:
"Well, you’ve just pulled of a heist of valuable medications from St. Lucy’s Hospital in Ariel City on the planet Ariel. All you need to do is fly out to the border planets and sell them. However, the Hands of Blue are in pursuit! In order to escape them, you must fly through the Black and avoid all the hazards that will slow you down and get you pinched by them. If you fly far enough in the ‘Verse, you should be safe to sell off your stolen cargo. They won’t fly 86 million miles for a box of band-aids, will they?
In this game you try to fly 86 million miles through space to escape the Hands of Blue. But you must be wary, because your competition is doing the same and will tip off your enemies to your location (by playing cards to stop or slow you down), of course, you can do the same!
In the basic game, designed for 4 players, the object is to be the first crew to accumulate $5000 in platinum (that is the point system) over several rounds of play. In doing so, you must try to complete a trip of exactly 86 million miles in each round of play."
categories: Card Game, Racing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Rise Again: Honest Brawls Between Folk
description:
Rise Again: Honest Brawls Between Folk

Firefly-themed card based fighting game somewhat based on Kung Fu Fighting.
From the designer:
"You can’t take the sky from me: In RISE AGAIN, 2 to 6 players fight each other Firefly ‘Verse style, trying to beat the gos se (which we politely call “GUTS”) out of one another with various forms of brawlin’. Players can attack each other with Attack cards or by using a Weapon card they have in play. Players can make their attacks even more hi-larious by playing Attack Enhancement cards and by having a Stereotype card in play. Defenders use Block cards to avoid or cancel attacks, and can even play Guts Restoration cards to restore lost Guts."
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Black Hole Invaders
description:
The object of the game is to get your space plane back to the Mothership first, or have 3 Mothership cards, but beware to the black Hole Invaders. If you end up with 3 Invader cards you are captured and out of the game.

A limited print run sci-fi game by Omega games.

name: Dirty Dicing
description:
In Dirty Dicing, players roll six standard dice and use the results to fill in boxes on a scoresheet. Players also get two "smart moves" which they can use to pass a bad roll to the next player or to refuse dice which have been passed to them. Doubles are ignored, so a roll with three doubles scores nothing and is known as "dirty dice".

Dirty Dicing was published in Counter Magazine #36.

name: Enchanted Checkers
description: Checkers variant. Meant to be played with miniatures. Each pawn has it's own special power. 36+ different powers available. Fantasy theme army lists included. Lots of Variants. Not your Grandpa's Checkers. Free homebrew ruleset available at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/EC.html
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Roll-Ralli
description: Each player is trying to acquire a ticket and go to the airport as fast as possible. The first player at the airport with a ticket is the winner.

name: Pop-Cones
description: This is like a junior version of "Trouble" and features Kohner's trademark Pop-O-Matic. Tokens are cones as you'd see in Kohner's "Headache" game. Same object as any of those go-around-the-board-to-Home games.

name: DIY-opoly
description:
from the publishers:

A DO IT YOURSELF PROPERTY TRADING GAME!
Is your idea of high fashion a well-equipped tool belt?
Is your ideal vacation one in which you remodel the kitchen?
Do you spend your night out at the local hardware store?

If you answered yes to any or all of the above, D.I.Y.OPOLY is the game for you. Even you need a little R & R every now and then! Gather family and friends and welcome them into your world of power tools, elbow grease, and sawdust.

In D.I.Y.- OPOLY players buy, sell and trade favorite properties, then increase the property value by adding Tool Buckets and Hardware Stores. It sounds easy enough, but add a trip to the emergency room, a project you can’t handle, and an exploding toilet, and it gets a little more difficult, and a lot more fun! So choose your token and advance to “Get to Work!” Who knows? You may soon be elected Handyman of the Year…or you may get in over your head and have to hire a contractor. Whatever happens, it’s gonna be almost as fun as building a deck!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Splurge
description: Splurge is an exciting game of skill and fortune for 2 to 6 players. It incorporates in a single board game a number of famous and popular dice and card games (poker, blackjack, craps, etc...). Each player attempts to win by a combination of plays on the board and successful side-betting with other players in the game. The game is ended when one player gets both his tokens to the finish, and the winner is the player who has accumulated the most money at that time.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The First Battle of Alamein: July 1st to 27th 1942
description:
When speaking of ‘The battle of Alamein’ it is generally assumed that one is referring to the battle which finally saw Britain’s Eighth Army defeat Rommel’s much vaunted Panzerarmee Afrika in October/November 1942. However this was, in fact, the third battle fought at the Alamein position over a period of five months. The second battle, sometimes referred to as the ‘Battle of Alam Halfa’ or ‘Rommel’s last dash’, is seen as a necessary holding action which blunted the offensive capability of the Axis forces. The ‘First Battle of Alamein’ or ‘July Battles’ which concerns us presently has been given a comparatively negligent amount of historical attention; at times referenced as a hideously complex standstill or fatuously dismissed as insignificant. However, it was this battle which put a stop to Rommel’s gallop to Alexandria and began the change in Eighth Army’s fortunes that would eventually lead it to victory in November 1942.

The game map is a simple reproduction of the battle field of El Alamein in North Africa, from the Mediterranean Sea in the North to the impassable Qattara Depression in the South.

The Commonwealth player controls the units on the board which are Light Blue.
German Units are represented in Grey, and Italian units are represented in Green.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Another Glorious First of June? Jutland 1916
description:
THE BATTLE OF JUTLAND - 31ST MAY 1916

The aim of this game is to create a playable, but accurate strategic simulation of the Battle of Jutland. One of the most important aspects of war at sea is the difficulty of bringing an opponent to decisive battle, it took Nelson nearly two years to bring the French fleet to battle at Trafalgar, and in an era before radar or secure communication it remained as difficult. Therefore this simulation uses a double blind system to simulate these difficulties.

GAME CONTENTS

2 Search Charts – One British, One German
1 Turn Chart
100 Counters:
- 64 Ship Counters
- 4 Fleet Counters
- 16 Contact Counters
- 6 Light Cruiser Search Counters (2 Red, 4 Black)
- 3 Engadine Float Plane Searches
- 2 Radio Intercept Counters
- 2 Submarine Contact Counters
- 1 Zeppelin Search Counter
- 1 Turn Counter

name: 1st Manassas: 21st July 1861
description:
This game simulates the battle of 1st Manassas 21st July 1861 at brigade level in a series of 30 minute game. One player represents the forces of the United States, the other Confederate forces.
The map board represents an area 8 miles wide x 7 miles long. Each Hex is 300 yards in diameter.
Units are represented by double-sided hexagonal counters. The simulation is at brigade level, but a number of un-brigaded units are represented as are artillery batteries.

name: 1847:  Road to Mexico City
description:
This game is about the Veracruz Campaign during the Mexican-American War of 1845-1848.

The map is a 20x36 hexagon grid representing the operational area from Mexico City to the Gulf of Mexico and divided into three zones by red zone indicator lines. Each hex represents approximately 10km.
The Mexican forces are made up of primarily regulars of regimental size, but are augmented by Mexican cavalry, artillery, militia, guerrilla bands and local villagers capable of waging defensive combat. The US forces are composed of regimental sized infantry, artillery and engineers.

name: Personality Probe...?
description:
It is a game designed for three or more players (special rules for two players) and the more the merrier.

There are topics for everyone: children, husbands & wives, general (for everyone), and master-mind (for the deep thinkers and serious minded.) It is a good way to communicate with each other and learn how to think about oneself and life using over a thousand provocative, unique, stimulating and sometimes humorous questions. Because these questions don't always come up in everyday conversations, it is a chance to gain insights about each other in a pleasant, relaxed, and enjoyable atmosphere.

name: Clash of Empires: Magnesia 190BC
description:
A Conflict Simulation of the Battle of Magnesia in 190BC between the armies of the Roman Republic and the Seleucid Empire.
The Clash of Empires game contains
- the game-map
- the Roman and Seleucid army counters
- “Push Back” counters
- A six sided dice is also needed.
The counters are organized into seven Divisions (four Roman and three Seleucid).

name: Gladius et Sarissa:  Cynoscephalae, 197 BC
description: This simulation covers the Battle of Cynoscephalae, a classic battle between the Roman manipular legion and a Hellenistic force descended from the army of Alexander the Great. The battle was the result of heavy skirmishing and both sides quickly rushed reinforcements to the scene. Therefore, at the beginning of the simulation there are no fixed positions except for your skirmishers. Alternatively, you may wish to try your hand at the turning point of the battle and see if you repeat or change history. Historically, the Romans won this battle after heavy fighting but can you recreate history or will you lead the forces of Philip V to victory over Rome?

name: Dungeons and Patterns
description:
This game was created by a couple of ubergeeks (of the software development variety) for other geeks. You can (as of this typing Feb 16 2007) read more about it at

http://oopsla.acm.org/OOPSLA02/ap/files/tut-32.html

Contents: one dice, two map sheets, a guide for the GM, and room descriptions/pictures for the players.

It's sort of a cross between zendo and a ridiculously light RPG. One person is the GM (or "Pattern Master") and describes what the other players in the room see. Everyone else in the room cooperates as the group explores a dungeon and earns keys by solving riddles together.

The riddles are usually of the form "You enter the next room and see these few objects." Players then suggest things to do to investigate the objects and their interactions. The GM tells them what happens as they explore. Eventualy the players regonize the software development pattern for which these objects are a metaphor.

The game was created for a conference attended by software developers and presumably has limited appeal outside that group, as few others would ever be able to identify the metaphor, having never read about software development patterns.
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Exploration, Fantasy, Humor, Memory, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Peter Pan's Adventure Land Board Game
description:
You will travel to Never Never Land and actually become Peter Pan or one of the other well-loved characters, and your aim is to become the first player to reach Captain Hook's Galleon - the Jolly Roger.

On your journey, you will encounter many obstacles: watch out for the Crocodile Square and avoid if you can the gushing mysterious river that could sweep you down the board. There are many pitfalls awaiting the unsuspecting player.

ages 3 & above

name: Murder Mystery Party:  Murder by Magic
description:
Solve a murder in an evening with friends.

Lord David Coppertone was hosting the annual convention of the Magic Ring in his new home Magic Mansion, which is being attended by the world's top magicians, conjurors, illusionists, escapologists and mystics.

Lord Coppertone performs his most dangerous of stunts to escape from the medieval Iron Maiden torture chamber. However, all did not go according to plan and Lord Coppertone fails to make the great escape.

Host your own party and discover who conjured up this cunning plan...or is it just an illusion!

The Game Pack includes all the material, information and suggestions for you to host this party...including costume suggestions, menu suggestions, invitations, name tags and clues.

name: Inheritance
description:
