Requiring no prior bible knowledge, Inheritance teaches the Seven Pillars of Wisdom (Prov.9:1) while players have fun trading, hugging, paying tithes and making offerings for the poor. The winner ascending to the center of the inner board celebrates Christ as the Lamb of God in a final result where everyone wins as "Happy is the man who finds Wisdom." (Prov.3:13).
Designed for 3-7 players and ages from 8-to adult, game play in Inheritance offers a level of play which will be immediately familiar to both Monopoly and Parcheesi players, providing a completely new board game experience and principally cultivating the Wisdom of God.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Laerad
description:
As written on the front cover: "Laerad is a strategic-level fantasy war game"

Up to seven fantasy armies struggle for supremacy on the world of Laerad.

The game requires 30 (!) 6-sided dice: 10 red, 10 white and 10 blue ones.

The armies are identical (yes, even dwarves and elves...), but an optional rule adds some racial differences.

Rules are in Italian and English.

name: Amen! Game
description: This game is a Bible trivia version of Bingo. But instead of the letters of "bingo" for the columns, the columns of this game are A, M, E, N and !. According to the rules of the game: the exclamation point column is to be identified as the "Halleluiah" column. Another difference is that the moderator does not simply call out squares to be covered on the player's card, but will indicate a column and read a question from one of five question cards. If you know the answer and have the answer on your card, then you cover that square. For instance, the moderator might say: "Column A. Who killed Goliath?" If you have David in your card's Column A, you would cover it. The free square is known in this game as "Free Salvation by Jesus." The first player to complete a horizontal, vertical or diagonal row calls out "Amen!" and wins the game.

name: Stilbruch
description: An artful matching game, in a stylish tin with small tiles with black and white photos of either famous chair designs or cultural iconic moments in time. Try and match the chair with the times.

name: Phantom Ball
description:
The ultimate game in adventure along with the danger of black magic. On your quest for victory, you follow a dangerous trail constantly at the mercy of chance and evil. Such dangers as the TOWER, the gateway to the maze of tunnels beneath you, and the supreme evil of the PHANTOM BALL conspire to end your travels. Depending on how destiny treats you, you may be the victor or just an observer.

THE TOWER
It holds the key to your destiny. It can help you or destroy you. It acts on pure chance, it holds no favorites. Once you enter, your exit may not be what you expected.

PHANTOM BALL
It draws its power from the evil in black magic, It's attacks are unpredictable and savagely quick. Once unleashed, it has only one purpose, to destroy your player.

name: Sa'vant
description:
Sa'vant appears to be a Code 777 or Headbanz light. Players are dealt a card and without looking at it put it in the holder in front of them, where other players can see it. Then the play moves clockwise in three "sets" where players make guesses about their card.

In the first "set", players guess as to what position their card may be -- Highest, 2d Highest, 2d Lowest, or Lowest. In the second set, a player again makes a guess as to what position his or her card may be (and a player may change his or her guess from the first set), and also makes three guesses as to which card he or she may hold. In the third set, a player makes a guess as to exactly what his or her card is.

Points are determined as thus:

1st Set - 1 point for accurate position guessed
2nd Set - 1 point for accurate position guessed
1 point for Exact card held being one of the three guesses

3rd Set - 3 points for exact card guessed.

name: Teletubbies Colorforms Stick-On Game
description: Ages 3 and up. The Tubbies have said their famous bye-byes but want to come back and do it again. Collect the teletubbies. When you have them all, the game is over.

name: Starslavers
description: STARSLAVERS is a game of strategic space exploration with tactical combat where interplanetary press gangs "recruit" aliens for arena combat.

name: Whistling Wizard
description:
Flange-ended bulb whistle is inserted into question space and bulb is squeezed. If whistle sounds, answer is correct.
Each player has three chances to answer a question. If question is answered correctly on the first try, player scores 5 points, second try 3 points and third try 1 point. No score is given if player fails to answer question after three tries.
Starting player selects the first question appearing on the top row of the card, takes his turn and scores accordingly. Next player takes the next question appearing on the top row and proceeds in the same manner. Players continue across row after row, each player taking a new question whether or not his predecessor has answered the previous question correctly. When all questions on the card have been used, a new card is put in the box and play continues. Highest score for all six cards wins the game.

name: Verdict
description:
From the back of the box:

Verdict is the legal card game that provides outrageous fun for 3 to 6 players.

You are the prosecutor. Accumulate evidence and be the first to get a guilty verdict. Stop your opponents by denying their motions and objecting to their evidence.

Be quick with your objections and quicker with your gavel!

Verdict is fast, fun and interactive. It's perfect for any get-together with family and friends.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: Tee Off
description:
A golf themed card game featuring a custom deck of 54 "stroke" cards. Just like in real golf, low score wins. If you have plus cards, try and pair them up, as a pair will cancel each other other and score zero.

For each hole, players are dealt 4 cards, 2 of which they must play blind, the other 2 them may look at.

For more excitement try the optional "Vegas style" rules which allow players to place wagers on each hole.

name: The Hidden Kingdom
description: Game comes with 32 cards. Each featuring information and a picture of a different bug, spider, or insect. This information has nothing to do with gameplay, but each card has a number 1 - 8 and a letter A - D in the upper left corner. Players are trying to collect sets of four cards with the same number. Each turn, the current player asks opponents for a card of a given number and letter. Players are required to hand over the requested card if they have it, but as soon as a request cannot be fulfilled, a new player's turn begins. When all cards have been played in quartets, the player with the most completed sets wins.

name: Kids Battle the Grown-Ups Card Game
description:
From the University Games web site:

Designed to help parents and children learn more about each other's interests, Kids Battle the Grown-Ups is a trivia game that offers a level playing field for both sides. And now the popular board game has been made into a card game packaged in a sturdy tin. It's the perfect game to take along on family vacations! Grown-Ups are asked questions most kids can answer, and kids are asked questions that most Grown-Ups can answer. Grown-Ups, is J.K. Rowling a man or a woman? Kids, if you take your coffee black, what do you add to it? (The answers - a woman, and nothing.) Answer all 3 questions on your card correctly, and you win the card. The first team to win 2 cards, wins the game. It's time to find out who really knows more... the kids or the grown-ups? Game comes with game cards and instructions. For 2 or More Players, Ages 8 and up

name: The Wiggles Card Game
description: For Ages 3 - 6, this is Go Fish with a Wiggles twist. Gather matches by asking for them from your opponents, but then you must perform the action on the cards in order to keep the match.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Strawberry Shortcake Stick-Ons Game
description:
For Ages 3 - 8
From the back of the box:
"Huckleberry Pie has just zoomed all over Strawberryland on his skateboard and is now starving for a berry sweet goodie. What luck- Strawberry Shortcake and her friends just so happen to be out gathering as many berries as they can to make the ultimate strawberry shortcake that everyone can enjoy. There are so many jucy berries around, Strawberry Shortcake and her friends Ginger Snap, Orange Blossom, and Angel Cake can't wait to get started! The problem is that little sister Apple Dumpling and frisky Pupcake can sometimes get in the way. Oh, watch out! Every so often Apple Dumping giggles and drops an apple into the basket instead of a strawberry. Pupcake is a curious pet and after sniffing the basket, he can't help but eat up the berries! Oh no- there go all the berries! The first player to collect 8 strawberries and take a delicious strawberry shortcake to Huckelberry Pie wins the game!"

name: Dolls
description:
Dolls is a hostage negotiation game using little pipe-cleaner people called dolls. At the beginning of the game each player has the five dolls distributed to his opponents. Each player also receives a number of strategy cards that let him launch rescue attempts, foils other's attempts at rescues, move dolls from one player to another, etc.

Players must negotiate for the release of their dolls. If talks break down, a player can execute dolls that he has possession of. Coming up with innovative methods of execution is also part of the game (Chopping up a pipe cleaner man and sending him back one piece at a time, lighting a doll on fire, running over a doll with your care are only a few possibilities).

name: Orgy
description:
Orgy is an ADULT card game. This game is set in a furry setting where anthropomorphic foxes, kitties, wolves hoofers and lawyers all are competing to have the best party. The object of the game is to complete your orgy by building up 7 sequential levels necessary for the fun to commence. There are also cards that let you interfere with your opponents plans.

The seven levels are:

1.) An ORGY card, which will define what breeds of furries that will attend your orgy.

2.) Three or more CHARACTER cards that match your ORGY card.

3.) Two or more KINK cards.

4.) One or more LUBE cards (may need to be more depending on your character types).

5.) Two or more Toy cards

6.) Two or more ACTION cards.

7.) One LOCATION.

The first player who plays all seven layers wins.

name: Memolette
description:
Throw the die and choose which one of the nine holes you want to drop a marble into. Take care! Only four marbles fit in each of the holes. You can't remember if a hole is full? The marble rolls back automatically to remind you!

What happens when you throw an 'M' on the die. Put the marble onto the circular track, send it on its way and last but not least: keep your fingers crossed!

Be the first player to get rid of all your marbles and you are the winner.

name: The Addams Family Game
description: This Addams Family game may be the first game based on the short-lived television series that eventually became sort of a cult show (along with the MUNSTERS). The game features 7 different paths along the game board, where each of the possible players can move their piece until they reach the victory square. There are spots for Morticia, Gomez, Uncle Fester, Wednesday, Pugsley, Lurch and Grandmama. Movement happens with a spinner and there are spots on each path which require the drawing of additional cards, which add both good and bad outcomes.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Virginian Game
description: The Virginian game, Adventures at Shiloh Ranch. Based on the NBC TV show staring James Drury as "The Virginian", Lee J. Cobb as "Henry", Doug McLure as "Trampas" and Gary Clarke as "Steve". Object of the game is to catch the most Bandits. Simple Roll and Move with dice used to determine certain events.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mr. Novak Game
description: Roll and Move game based on the NBC TV show Mr. Novak . The series followed John Novak, played by James Franciscus, an English teacher at Jefferson High School in Los Angeles. The Object of the game was to become the President of the Jefferson High School Senior Class. Students running must collect votes. They do so by going to school activities to get them where hey must take a mental test. They ask other students if they are "For me or against me?" A card is drawn with the correct answer. If the player answers correctly he/she moves another step closer to being elected.

name: Knockout
description: 2 Player Boxing game designed by the world famous Gambling expert and magician John Scarne and World Heavyweight Boxing Champion James J. Braddock.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Barnyard Races
description:
Barnyard Racing begins as a craft project. The 3-D board is decorated and colored with markers and rubber stamps that are provided.

On the completed board, players race their animals around the board by drawing a card and moving the number of spaces indicated. When a picnic space is reached, the player chooses a stamp from a selection of face down stamps, each depicting a different food. If the stamp matches the picture on the picnic space, the player stamps their stamp book. A player wins when all food stamps are in their stamp book.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Strawberry Shortcake Big Easy Game
description:
Ages 3 - 7

From the manufacturer:

Are you ready for a Berry Good Time? Strawberry Shortcake, Orange Blossom, Angel Cake and Ginger Snap are on their way to a picnic. Each of them will bring yummy treats with them. Put your treats in your Colorforms wagon. They stick like magic! Collect 10 treats and you can go to the picnic. Sharing is the name of the game: if players team up, they can get to the picnic faster! All the fun is played out on the super-sized Big Easy™ Play Mat, and game variations for children of different ages make the fun last. Game comes with 26” x 36” play mat, 40 Colorforms pieces, 4 character cards with stands, 2 wagon cards, spinner and instructions.
categories: Children's Game, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number

name: Concludo
description:
from the publisher's website:

The intelligent word game where players make up words or edit words already declared. But unlike all other word games, players can choose to use Dual Letter, Copy Letter and even Erase Letter cards to make the game more exciting to play.

name: Engie Benjy Memory Game
description:
from the publisher's website:

Two games in one. First assemble the playing board then free the path for Engie Benjy’s car by remembering what’s on the tiles and removing them from the board. Ages 3 and up
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Jump Jet
description:
A very rare game where the players pilot aircraft in flight formations making attacks & returning to base.

The game is easy to setup and quick to play.

Players must assemble their own colour of aircraft & return via the flight path designated.

The winner is the first player to return all of his flight to base.

name: Island Trader
description:
A very rare game that mixes the travel of Capital Adventure with the trading of The Business Game a.k.a. Mine a Million.

However the game is easier to setup and quicker to play.

Players must journey from island to island by ship, avoiding pirates & collecting cargo.

The winner is the first player to return to the center island with all four cargoes of fruit.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Spring Chicken
description:
From the box cover:
Spin a marble around the nest
put it on a feather or two
Oops... Be careful
SPRING CHICKEN has a surprise for you!

Ages 5 - 12.

name: Salvation Challenge Boardgame
description: Salvation Challenge is a great new family game. Each player starts out with one million in kingdom cash. Players get saved by landing on Calvary and making the salvation call, “Jesus Save Me”. Players then enter a race to be first to give all of the kingdom cash to missionaries to further God’s Kingdom. The first player to get saved and give all their kingdom cash to the missionaries wins. Ages 10 and up, 2 to 6 Players
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trader
description:
A promotional game developed by MeesPierson in cooperation with Identity Games.

from the rule booklet:

Trader is a dynamic board game that embraces every element of the commodity trade. The players become traders and discover whether they are experts at doing business efficiently. Trader is about making money through well-timed buying and selling of loads of commodities. Discover the strategic world of the commodity trade!
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: The Hill
description: From GAMES Magazine: The grass always seems greener on the other side of this six-level hill, so everyone's going over the top to win by reaching four enemy bases there. Dice rolls determine movement. You can jump single enemies (except uphill) and flip them over to become yours. A piece landing on the summit becomes a Field Marshal, which cannot be jumped but may leap and convert entire rows of enemies. However, there can only be one Field Marshal, whose allegiance proves difficult to retain; it must vacate the sacred peak immediately, allowing others to reach it and wrest control. Things can get hectic, but patiently blocking upwardly mobile forces in order to keep the fickle Field Marshal loyal usually wins. Still, this is a feisty game that can literally be enjoyed at all levels.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Trojano
description: A spin and move racing game from the 1920's by Chad Valley. Comes with a playing board with built-in spinner, and miniature cars for player tokens.
